description:
Visited XOX Truffles while on a food tour. What a gem! Chef Jean Marc started this business as a side business after suffering from a heart attack from his corporate America job and this became his full time gig. You can tell by each carefully crafted truffle this is his passion. 
The flavors are on point and if you order a coffee you can get a free truffle. You won't get this at Starbucks =/ 

Alcoholics unite! They had alcohol infused truffles so chocolate and alcohol... it just doesn't get better than this.  I had the cognac which had just a slight bit of cognac flavor. You'll need to eat a few of these to get any kind of buzz but do I hear challenge?!? challenge accepted 

The location is small so you may miss it but it's definitely worth the visit in North Beach.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
If I were to tell you that you absolutely had to try this little hole-in-the-wall chocolate shop but you're not considering it b/c it's in the far end of Northbeach? That might be your greatest mistake EVER!

I used to love only milk chocolate, and didn't care much for dark chocolate until my S.O. introduced me to this place. 

OMG! OMG! OMG! 

If you're a fine (red) wine drinker, you can relate to this analogy: Remember when you only drank nice semi-sweet to sweet white wines but couldn't stand the taste of the harsher red wines? And then someone introduced you to a wonderful red (Cabernet or Bordeaux) @ a meal, and you experienced that Ah-Ha moment? XOX truffles is kinda like that!

The proprietor is a large curly-haired bear of a man, who is also a very gentle & proud (and rightly so) Frenchman. He smiles broadly but is a little bit modest in his product. His hard work at his craft is reflected in the big flavor-packed deliciousness of these wonderful little truffles. 

I have purchased large quantities for both the S.O. and I over the past 7 years, and have yet to tire of their wonderfully rich intense chocolaty flavor. 

Forget those fancy packages, unless you are hunting for gifts or are a tourist. Those white take out/To-Go boxes he offers are the real deal. 

The more you buy, the cheaper they are. 40 truffles are not too many for one person. Refrigerated, you can steal a sweet & tasty morsel (or two, or four) of sinfully deliciousness anytime of night or day for the next 2-3 weeks!  How good is THAT?

If you even just 'like' chocolate, or even just 'think' you like chocolate, you haven't tried something as wonderful in your mouth as these. 

Do yourself a favor: Treat Yourself, Don't Cheat Yourself!

Enuf Sed!
author: william s.

description: Above average, no doubt, but far from the best that I've had. Prices are extremely steep for the weight/size of the product.
author: Ken L.

description: You have got to go to XOX truffles, best and most refine place in San Francisco for truffles and sweet. I love chocolates, I never was a fan of truffles until I visited this place. Dark chocolate or milk chocolate both are my fav now. Definitely worth paying for, will come back for more for sure.
author: Alison C.

description: XoX Truffles is the real deal! Do yourself a favor and stop by this North Beach neighborhood gem. Your coffee or hot chocolate gets you a free truffle from a top ten chocolatier in the US! They also make great holiday gifts!
author: Rafael M.

description:
Truly amazing find!  Voted top ten Best Artisian Chocolatier in America by The Food network David Rosengarten.  Located in North Beach, San Francisco, one of the best cafe mocha and truffle combination.  Definitely stop by this shop (when you are in SF).  Carefully made espresso and savor their handmade truffles(one free with drink).
Chef Jean Marc is shares his passion and craft, personally making each truffle by hand in the store.  I captured a picture of him in action!
Great gift for Mother's Day or Valentine's Day.
author: Richard H.

description: Devine!    So thankful I got the truffle tip and dropped in, we sampled and bought a great assortment!    I've shared with family and friends and the response was unanimous, these truffles are amazing!!!    Definitely worth dropping by if your in the area or better yet make it a point to go, you will not be disappointed!
author: Val R.

description:
We came here after reading all of the great reviews on Yelp to try some truffles. There are so many different flavors, and many are very unique. Cognac, mango, raspberry, kahlua, amaretto, hazelnut, Earl Grey, matcha, milk, dark chocolate, caramel... just to name a few. You can buy truffles individually for $1 a piece, get a free truffle if you buy a coffee, or buy 20 or 40 of them at a time. We decided to get 40 for $26. You can pick any combination of flavors, so we ended up getting about 6 different flavors. The owner was nice enough to give us each a truffle of our choice to taste as well.

The truffles are delicious. They are so delicately made and melt in your mouth. The individual flavors are also quite distinct without being overpowering. I really enjoyed the hazelnut truffle, which was rolled in crushed hazelnuts and tasted heavenly. I also like that each truffle is small enough that you don't feel too guilty about eating a couple of them. 

All of the truffles are mixed together in a box and it is hard to tell which one is which from just looking at them - so every bite is somewhat of a surprise!
author: Amy C.

description: Classic hot chocolate is delicious! Smooth, creamy and really original and genuine. The owner made it which made it feel more home made. Overall, experience was fantastic! Will be back!
author: Jonathan Z.

description: Awesome truffles for reasonable price. So happy that they have been keeping the same high standards for years.
author: Gokhan T.

description: I never ended up actually getting delivery from them, this is just a review of what it was like making the attempt: the person who answered the phone, a man with a French accent, was hilariously rude and when I tried to ask about their half pound gift boxes listed on GrubHub, said dismissively "you're asking about stuff I'm not familiar with." Okay... Maybe you should either get familiar with it, since it's your business, or don't answer the phone.
author: Tiger P.

description:
Superb small locally owned chocolate truffle shop right off columbus ave. between washington square and dimaggio playground.

Parking is street only which means there is no parking. San Francisco is massively pedestrian/ bike friendly with tons of public transportation options and well, like a lot of things in the city, you are best served by getting here in some way that does not involve driving.

While the storefront is unassuming, the chocolate truffles they put out are fantastic. The truffles are believe it or not handmade. There are dozens of different varieties including chili truffles along with all the standard choices (the champagne and vodka truffles are popular), and while mostly they sell by the piece, for bulk orders they can make some wholesale style deals. They have a focus on presentation as well, and will ship pretty much anywhere, but do note that shipping chocolate to west texas in July may not have the best results. 

In store they have room at the window counter for maybe six folks if they are friendly and everyone's taken a shower but for the most part this is a retail take it home style location. Having said that, they do have an in store deal wherein if you buy a couple of truffles, you'll get a free cup of coffee. The coffee is just a plain brewed cup, but it's dang near perfect with a truffle or three. They do an unremarkable hot chocolate as well. Make no mistake however the focus here is all on the super awesome chocolate product they put out. 

Pricing isn't any too bad. I mean yeah sure it's easy to go crazy in here with all the great truffle choices, but it's the most economical stop on Columbus for coffee, and it's entirely possible to get close to a dozen truffles for ten bucks or so. 

If you are out and about like (love) chocolate, need a tasteful (and tasty) gift or just want to treat yourself a bit this is a must have.
author: Steven W.

description: My family and I came across XOX Truffles by accident. We were walking down Columbus Avenue, after we picked up cannolis, fortune cookies, and a box full of dim sum. We paused and saw the XOX Truffle sign and thought it looked like an interesting shop to check out. It was the best idea ever! We were going to look and maybe pick up a few truffles, but then I saw the hot chocolate sign with all the different flavors and we couldn't resist. We got the hot white, regular, and milk chocolate drinks. All three were so good. The white was sweeter than the other two and super rich, but delicious. The regular hot chocolate kind of had a dark chocolate taste, but that could be from drinking the other two drinks, the milk chocolate and white chocolate. There was two or three people in front of us, but that was okay. The owner said they would be with us soon. A new employee made our three chocolate drinks with the owner checking on him. They all turned out so delicious. All three had distinct flavors. This was the best hot chocolate we have ever had and we have been on a quest for the best hot chocolate for years. The temperature and the consistency was perfect. We also got a free truffle with each drink. We chose lemon, peanut butter, and dark chocolate. All delicious!
author: Julie W.

description: The hot chocolate is to die for. Free truffle with drinks.  We will be back again soon
author: Tracy V.

description: Awesome little gem we found searching online for delicious "must try" deserts while we were in the Bay Area. The owner was very friendly and quick to get the crowd served that was piled into his small shop. The truffles were to die for. A few vegan options which was fantastic!! The place is a but overwhelming due to it being slightly cluttered with what I believe were just baking supplies and kitchenware. Semi organized but kinda stressful for someone with slight  ocd lol. Not a ton of room to sit and enjoy coffee or truffles just a small window bar looking out towards the street. I'd definitely recommend checking it out if you are in the area.
author: Amanda C.

description:
This little shop of chocolate is such a hole in the wall type place. The owner, who is also the maker, really knows his stuff about chocolate making. He is really sweet and the service he provides is very welcoming, like you're part of the family type of feel. I love dark chocolate and the little drops of dark chocolate here are heaven. The bitterness and how smooth the chocolate is just melts and swirls in your mouth. They also have different specialty flavors like Kahlua and cognac, but I opted out for earl grey and I gotta tell you it is worth every penny. The shop is small and easy to miss. There's not much seating so it's more of a grab and go type place. 

This place is simply superb and I would definitely choose this chocolate shop over Godiva or Ghirardelli any day. Sorry big guys!
author: Daw M.

description:
Best truffles I have ever had! Each piece is small enough to be "healthy" but just enough to give you a brief sensation of heaven. Lots of dark dark chocolate options, as well as some not as much for those who prefer it that way. Chef Jean-Marc was amazingly friendly and passionate about his chocolates. You can feel his love and dedication to the art in each piece of chocolate. 

Small storefront, but enough room for a few people both inside and outside. There's also some coffee/espresso options to pair with your delicious chocolates. My favorite was the lavender truffle, but there were so many flavors to choose from, it was really hard to decide which to get (solution: try them all!!) He even has matcha truffles! Unless it's a fresh batch, consider letting the truffle warm back up to room temperature from refrigeration. The taste and texture are completely different that way.

Overall, I say XOX Truffles is a must-try if you're in this area and like chocolate. Pricing is appropriate for the quality you get, but it isn't cheap, so be prepared. The store is small and easy to miss, but once you're inside, you won't want to leave! Also, could be a great idea as a gift for others... or maybe, just keep the chocolates for yourself - no one has to know! ;P
author: Jennifer W.

description: I discovered this place when they first opened way back when. The quality and service has always been the same if not even better year after year. The chocolate truffles are off the charts. So many choices get the box that allows you to try out 2 of each kind. Also the hot chocolate I found recently here is also to die for. It's literally like drinking a chocolate truffle so good. The man behind the counter, you can tell, loves what he does from the way he makes his products and by the way he treats his customer. I highly recommend it, if there's a line out the door, be patient, it is well worth the wait.
author: Patrick T.

description: Love this truffle store! Such a gem! The owner is very friendly and his truffles are amazing. My husband and I probably bought $200 worth of truffles to bring back to friends and family since we were from out of town. We loved all the flavors so it was really hard to choose but the couple that stood out was the mango, amaretto, and hazelnut. We will definitely return when we're in SF again!
author: Stella Y.

description:
This was a stop on our food tour. The owner Jean-Marc Gorce gave us a live demonstration of how he personally hand makes every truffle.

Simply amazing that he does this everyday all day personally.

Best truffle I have ever had!
author: TC A.

description: Great little shop in North Beach, pretty amazing, hand made recipes.  Went on a Saturday, wasn't busy, wife very happy.
author: Nathan P.

description:
Stopped by XOX Truffles today for a cup of coffee after a long day of work. Today was chilly; I would say around 55 degrees. 

I was greeted by the nice cashier⁄barista as I walked in. She asked in a happy smile "Hot coffee or Mocha today?" I said Hot coffee since it's chilly outside. She started pumping the coffee machine. I started adding the creamer and sugar. Before I could say anything, she asked "Mango or Green tea truffle today?" Wow, it's like she knows what kind of chocolate I like already. I went with the Mango since it's my all time favorite. I was going to choose green tea truffle but I had green tea this morning so I wanted something different.

This place is the place for coffee. Free truffles with any purchase? They got me there and it was all worth it. Their truffles are amazing and their coffee feels like home. Customer service? Top notch! 

Will I be back for coffee tomorrow and choosing the green tea truffle? Probably. 

Overall, this coffee place feels like home and is very well nice designed. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Anthony T.

description: Service was friendly, coffee was good, & the truffles were AMAZING. They had many different flavors from fruits to liquor. I would go back!
author: Christina S.

description: Such a sweet local's spot - free truffle with your espresso! Yes, please. Every bite of chocolate brings out the flavors in the espresso. Yum!
author: Kim E.

description:
Sometimes in life, something really unexpected comes along and makes you think about things. Shifts the ground beneath you a little. Gives you a new viewpoint. I'm not saying that's guaranteed to happen here, I can only tell you my experience.

If ever there's a lesson in how we should cherish the little things, it's best exemplified at XOX Truffles. So much beauty, so much passion, so much flavor; and it's all wrapped up inside a small but beautiful package. Truffles are so small. That's an easy observation to make. But use all of your senses and you realize how they are pure magic all around: they smell intoxicating and the minute you're in the shop you'll be taken away to a new place where your heart just beats a little differently. Listen to the artisans who make them, if you're lucky enough to arrive during production. The methodical care they take, and how the warmth almost sings to you. Be careful to touch them--though they have that think layer of cocoa dust on the outside to protect them, know that they'll melt. It's that delicate precipice that makes holding them alluring but also dangerous. And yes, taste them. Taste all of them. Every flavor. 

They are so small, but so much is wrapped up in them. I've been thinking about this concept a lot lately: that seeing the world through someone else's eyes can make it new, beautiful, magical, and wonderful again. Truffles are an art, and here we get to see a portrait of the world through the eyes of the artist truffle-maker. The soft milky chocolate, the sharp and unexpectedly poignant cognac truffle, and the bright and happy orange. Each of them is an expression of the artist's experience, their mood, their perceptions; seeing them through the eyes of the visionary is a view of a world filled with flavor.

Think too, about watching someone else enjoy the unique flavors. Think about experiencing it through their eyes. I've been thinking about this concept, too -- the parents who take their kids to Disneyland for the first time and re-discover the happiness around them. Buy a bunch of truffles and give them to someone, then watch them enjoy each flavor. Listen to them describe the subtleties and nuances of each one. There is no more delicious way to realize that we are all unique, precious, wonderful creatures with diverse ideas and viewpoints, than to gift a box of these truffles and just sit back to watch and listen.

Visit the store and you'll also learn important life lessons about judging the book by its cover. Located right on Columbus, you could blink and miss it. The shop is tiny, the signs hand painted, the dishes mismatched, and the appearance belies the absolute perfection of an art that happens on the inside. I actually think the exterior is perfect just how it is. It has character, it's authentic, it has a style all its own. But there is a certain truth to the notion that you've just found something wonderful where you least expected it. Just stop. Get to know what's on the inside. It will surprise and delight you.

All this comes at a price: expect to pay over $50 a pound. They have pre-packed boxes (adorable Chinese takeout boxes) in various sizes. I grabbed a half pound box which has two of every flavor within. But do it just once, and you'll want to do it over and over again.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
What is there to say other than yummy truffles? Lots of alcohol-filled truffles for those who like that kind of thing.

Dont buy the peanut butter truffle. I should have known better, but I bought some and they were not especially good.
author: James C.

description:
Little drops of heaven! Too bad this shop is so far from me in Walnut Creek, but also good because I won't be tempted to stop by here every single day! 

The owner is so sweet and so nice, but the highlight here really are the delightful truffles. Be sure to buy a box of 20 instead of individually because it's so much cheaper! 

Flavors to try: raspberry, orange, salted caramel
author: Ashley L.

description:
Best truffles in the Bay! When I'm craving chocolate, it has to be good chocolate. The kind of chocolate that makes your insides melt, at least that's how it feels for me. I'm a bit of a dark chocolate connoisseur. 

I first got a box of chocolates from xox truffles when I was about 19 (11 years ago) from a lady I used to dance with. Some of us already started eating the chocolate before our performance and we all agreed it was the best chocolate we've ever had. I remember one girl (I swear it wasn't me) ate almost half her box! It was that good.

I came here recently feeling deprived of dark truffles and I noticed they had some vegan chocolate. I got a small box of some vegan dark chocolate, hazelnut, coconut and espresso. It was all so good. I don't come here often... it's one of those really special places where you can go and treat yourself. The truffles are small and hand made but that's what makes you appreciate it more. Also some of their truffles have a bit of a bitterness to it, but I personally really like chocolate like that. 

If you love like love love chocolate truffles, give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.
author: Reese E.

description:
This is absolutely THE spot to have drinking chocolate (think: easily one of the best hot chocolates you'll enjoy) and just chocolates in general.There are a few options for the drinking kind: Milk/Dark Chocolate, Classic (not AS sweet), or Mexican (spiced). My fave is the classic but really, they are all truly delicious and usually crafted with love. 

The hot chocolates are rich and smooth, like liquid dessert, nothing heavy, but just right. This chocolate blends magnificently with milk and is a great treat on the go. Each cafe beverage comes with one piece of chocolate of your own choosing, all made in-house. Unlike your typical perfectly shaped piece of chocolate, these are anything but uniform, but they are best in their true form. Plus, there's a wide variety from anything spicy to fruity and in between.
The owner is sweet (pun intended) and he knows chocolate. When in North Beach, drop in and get your goodies, support this local small business in North Beach and leave happy.
author: Amy L.

description: Found this while walking the streets of SF (little Italy district i think) and i am so happy i ran into this shop!! I came here for some coffee and was greeted by the owner. I fail to remember his name at this time but he was SOOOOO nice. All i remember is he's French and married to a Filipina! :) he had excellent customer service and was so warm to us. I got the mocha and so did my sister. With the coffee you get a free truffle, tons to choose from! I would recommend the pomegranate chocolate , that's what i got and it was amazing!!!! Definitely check this spot out!
author: Starla M.

description:
TL;DR - No shame, I definitely ate 8 pieces by myself on a Saturday morning.

I found myself wandering north beach/russian hill while waiting for my friends to get ready for brunch. I wanted a latte and saw that they also gave you a truffle on the house with a coffee purchase. SWEET. I love freebies. 

The latte is light, more of a cafe au lait (the closest beverage to a latte you'll find in france) but it was the truffles that stole my heart. 

Great truffles and amazing service (the owner was so kinda and knowledgeable and PATIENT).
author: Crystal Z.

description: Have to stop here every time I'm in town. I love sweets and this is at the top of my list. Fast friendly service and a great variety of chocolate truffles.
author: Aaron J.

description:
Recent transplants from NY, on a hunt to seek out good truffles in SF, first one we found where the maker actually knows what he's doing. Sweetness level just right, nice complexity in the ganache, shells are thin, chocolate is soft and smooth.
Doesn't hurt that the concept is charming: little shop with tiny truffles and coffee, walkable to the water.
author: C J.

description:
Kinda average truffles.  I might try them again sometime to see if I maybe ordered on an off day or if they have better ones that I did not try.

The people who work here are nice and the place is in a great location in North Beach.
author: Bob F.

description:
This is a rating for the owner Mr. Gorce's professionalism and care for his customers based on a failed delivery order placed through third party service. 

My order was snatched by a third party delivery person but Mr. Gorce helped me to make sure the second attempt would be successful.

I did not have the opportunity to meet Mr. Gorce in person. The order I placed the order was for a friend living in SF, whilst I live in the east coast. I had a chat with Mr. Gorce ahead of the order, explained the situation and asked for personalization of the gift box for my friend, he gladly accommodated my requests. 
At the time of delivery, the delivery person fail to contact the recipient and did not even answer calls from the service company's headquarter, after I escalated the issue to them. The delivery person simply ran away with the truffles!! (I choose to believe that the truffles were too delicious for him to resist)
When I reached out to Mr. Gorce again, he was not only aware of the issue (the delivery person looked suspicious when picking up the item) but also making efforts to rectifying it even though it was not his responsibility at all. Mr. Gorce was worried about the delivery because he was aware that the box was important to me. 

I am very impressed with my experience with XOX Truffles, to say the least. I look forward to my next visit to SF because I for sure will visit the store and say thank you to Mr. Gorce in person!
author: Jing W.

description: I had the earl grey truffle and caramel one and oh my oh my oh my! I highly recommend this place. If your loved one is upset at you, get them a box of these HEAVENLY truffles and I GUARANTEE you that you will quickly be on their good side! TRUST ME!
author: Noor M.

description:
So many different truffles to choose from, especially boozy ones like champagne and bourbon, with all the varieties having a lovely melt-in-your mouth consistency. They're all Hershey's Kisses-sized, so do go overboard and come away with a box of a dozen or more to try. 

The guy who runs this place is also incredibly sweet and obliging with customer requests to mix and match flavors in large boxes. Thanks Yelpers for another great local find!
author: Vincent L.

description: Wow!!! No other description for these truffles. My favorite were the caramel truffles, the caramel was not sweet, but buttery. I went back in and got another box of just the caramel :))
author: Julie L.

description:
Good things come in small pieces!

Well, the above statement may not be true everywhere, but I guarantee you that is the case in XOX Truffles! I am not a big chocolate fan, but the truffles here are an exception! Take the brandy or tequila flavored truffles, imagine a little piece of chocolate that melts in your mouth and immediately releases all sorts of amazing and complementary flavors that include a hint of these two drinks. Don't like either brandy or tequila, no worries! There are plenty of other flavors to pick from! 

Psst! You guys, do you have a significant other who loves chocolates? Go over there and ask for one of their assorted boxes.

p.s. Remember, picking up a bouquet of flower on the way home to go along with the truffles will not hurt either!
author: Afshin A.

description:
By far and away my favorite chocolate... not just in San Francisco, or even in the USA... anywhere!  The truffles are handmade on site (the last time I came in, they were making them behind the counter) and are packed with so much flavor in such a small packet.  These suckers are dense and heavenly, with such whimsical flavors as Earl Grey, Manila Mango, Creme de Menthe & Champagne.  They even now have soy/vegan truffles.  

Word to the wise:  these truffles are more expensive than your run-of-the mill candies.  $1.00 per truffle, or 20 for $14.  And don't scarf them down... savor them instead.  Your sweet tooth will thank you!

I've also heard the hot chocolate is worth the trip to the far side of North Beach.  Eventually, I'll have one to go.  But for not, I'll stick with the truffles that are in my home now.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Stopped here because I wanted some coffee after dinner. Holy cow is their coffee great!!  The barista was speaking fluent French, which I took as a good sign. The coffee was perfect in every respect!! I would highly recommend!!!
author: David Z.

description:
Best hot chocolate I have had in my life...you see them mix in real chocolate into your drink and did I mention this place serves some of the best truffles ever!!!!! Try their earl grey truffle
Also you get a free truffle if you buy a drink
author: Arcadian B.

description:
This was a real gem on a recent food tour of North Beach. This chocolate shop on Columbus focuses on the classic French truffle, not the modern shiny confection as the owner will tell you. He takes pride in describing how the chocolate truffle should resemble the iconic culinary truffle fungus found in the ground, complete with a dusting of cocoa powder to create the proper "dirt."

The truffles are hand made and are excellent. He makes many different varieties including liqueur, fruits, and some exotic versions with heat and spice. I had a white chocolate vanilla, cognac, and orange which were all great, but a simple plain chocolate version was just pure indulgence.

I was happy to find this little treasure on the tour and gladly recommend it to any visitor or local looking for a special chocolate treat!
author: Kristian D.

description: Great truffles. I found this place 3 years ago. Normally a great place to get coffee & a truffle. The experience with previous baristas was excellent. This year, she was not engaged with customer.
author: Larry A.

description:
These truffles are amazing! There are probably 40ish flavors, and I did not have one bad one! The shop is tiny, and doesn't look very impressive (or you could say it's charming), but it doesn't matter because they taste so very yummy. The truffles are pretty small, and most are covered in a very thin layer of (very well tempered) chocolate. 

The chocolatier making the chocolates (who I believe is also the owner) was there and thanked me several times. The woman who helped pack my box was also friendly.

Prices are pretty high, I think around $50 for a pound. These are meant to be savored, not scarfed down (even though I sometimes ate them that way too), so just buy some and enjoy them slowly, and you wont feel bad about spending that much money on chocolate. I bought a half pound and it was fine, but honestly when I go back I'll get a full pound. And I WILL NOT be sharing with anyone.

The only thing that would make them better is if there was a way to differentiate the flavors. They almost all look the same, and they are packed into a Chinese take-away box so they're all just mixed up in there. I guess it's kind of fun to be surprised every time you eat one, but I'd rather know which ones I had to choose from.
author: Lacey T.

description: One of my favorite places in north beach. You must try their bitter hot chocolate. AMAZING. and each drink you order comes with a truffle. Can't complain about that!
author: Maya S.

description:
Hands down, the BEST hot chocolate i've ever drank in my life! Not made with powder or syrup, but with real chocolate that is melted and mixed with milk. You get a free truffle with your drink.
 Sixteen ounces drink is only $3.75. Very rich, deliciously sweet drink served in a paper cup. 

By the way, it says on a sign by the cashier that minimum charge on a credit card is $8 or 50 cents charge. I don't see how that is a big deal to some people...
author: Natalia R.

description: You won't find another artist like this anywhere else. Amazing. Do yourself a favor and get a bag and try a variety of his creations. On a cold day, the hot chocolate is unreal.
author: JT S.

description: The truffles are fantastic! Better than all the very expensive truffles I had in Paris. The value is very good too, 40 truffles of my choice cost me only $28 :)
author: Lily T.

description: Love love love!!!!  Every piece of truffle chocolate is amazing... can't go wrong. Order any coffee and get one free...Love it, it's so good you'll likely buy more
author: Laurel Thandi N.

description: The drinks were good and reasonably priced, especially for the area that the shop is in! Also got one free truffle with a drink purchase. My friend and I chose the earl grey truffle and it was very good! Highly recommend! :)
author: Vemmy M.

description: While I wasn't looking, Jean-Marc added 3 more hot chocolate flavors: Bitter, Milk and White with Classic being the original flavor.
author: Brian M.

description: Coffee here at XOX Truffles is definitely worth it a try. Was scrolling through Yelp to see all kinds of different chocolates that they've had and was super pleased. I came here just to try their Mango truffle and bought a coffee a long with it. Since I was craving for coffee, might as well get a free truffle. The Mango truffle was worth every bite. It's delicious and super tasty. I'll be back!
author: Winnie H.

description:
These truffles are every chocolate lover's dream. 

XOX Truffles is not a big shop so it's easily looked past but you should really slow it down and take a good look here. They have so many different kinds of truffles here that you will be sure to find one that will satisfy your sweet tooth. 

If you're into alcohol, they have a good range of truffles infused with alcohol. Chocolate and wine are a good match, aren't they? For me, I love myself some dark chocolate, earl grey and fruit infused chocolates. The earl grey was phenomenal. If they tell you it's an earl grey truffle, then it's going to give you earl grey. The same is true of the green tea, which is so delightful too! My favorite probably has to be the dark chocolate truffle, but that's because I am a huge dark chocolate fan. Can't say no to rich, bitter chocolate! 

They have so many cute little boxes for you to put your truffles in. These would make fabulous gifts and would make any store bought box of chocolates look sad. They take the time to pack and seal the truffles nicely, as well as pretty up the box. Each truffle is pretty small, but you only need a little bit of that heavenly bite to feel good. 

You get a free sample with your purchase so try away! On hot days in San Francisco, keep your box out of the heat because these truffles will turn into molten otherwise.
author: Liz C.

description:
Holy mind blown! I never really saw the appeal of truffles; most of the mass-produced ones people offer you are just overwhelming sugar bombs. But these truffles are the real deal. They are subtle and handcrafted and minutely balanced between the sweetness on the inside and the cocoa on the outside. My brother told me that the owner is very proprietary about his recipe, and he probably has to be, because if other people could made truffles like these, they would. 

It's just a bitty little store front with the truffles displayed in a glass case. You can also have real coffee, which my husband assured me was very good. But I wouldn't dilute these truffles. The pomegranate was my favorite but I didn't taste very many different kinds.
author: Monica F.

description:
Strolling through Little Italy and then I realize that XOX was on my list for the quest of finding the best hot chocolates in SF. 

Anyways the truffles here are amazing, a symphony in your mouth. The quality of the truffles are premium, as soon as you step in the small shop you can see the truffles being prepared by hand. They have a nice variety of truffles. I tried the Vanilla Madagascar and the orange chocolate and both were smooth as silk. The truffles are rich in flavor and before you know you'll wish you had ordered more. As I mentioned earlier, I'm on a quest to find the best Hot Chocolate in the city so I did order one. It was $2 for a small and I was impressed because I've never had anyone whisk hot chocolate ever. The young lady took her time with it, whisking it halfway through and I appreciate it. That makes my experience here even more memorable. Regardless of how good the cup of hot chocolate was, I would rather Come to this place since they put that extra effort into your drink. Needless to say, the hot chocolate was one of the best, I love the fact that the hot chocolate wasn't blazing hot.

Even though I came for Hot Chocolate which was one of the best I've had. I believe the truffles have got to be the reason to come here. The hot chocolate here is definitely a top option, but the truffles are elite, and if your a fan of chocolate then you must make your way down to XOX.
author: Arron E.

description:
Amazingly authentic truffles that are homemade and literally individually created by the chef himself.  Pretty affordable for truffles, all things considered, although these are smaller which also makes them harder to say no to!  The dark chocolate regular truffle was sublime and I also really liked all of the liquor flavored truffles.  I think my favorites were Kahlua, Cognac (which is the chef's favorite too), and Espresso.

The most affordable option is to buy the take-out boxes (not super amazing wrapping but you get a pretty good deal).  I think the smallest container was 20 truffles for $14 which is pretty darn cheap.

Came here as a stop on a food tour and I was excited to learn about how truffles are supposed to be made.  Chocolate truffles were named truffles because they are supposed to resemble the fungus truffle which is why they shouldn't be perfectly rounded (like other machine manufactured truffles) and are often dipped in cocoa dust to look like "dirt".

I can't wait to come back and try some more.  This would also be a great place to pick up a gift/souvenir!
author: Jess Y.

description:
***Found hair in one of the truffles ***

The quality of the truffles are very good but some flavors are very mild so you can't tell what flavor you are eating.  Still, I love chocolate and bought some to take home to LA since I was visiting San Francisco. Brought some for my mom and boyfriend's mom.  My mom also couldn't tell which truffle was which flavor but said they were good either way. 

Decided to write a review when I found a piece of hair wedged into one of the truffles. Hopefully the owner will see this and make sure the people who prepare this keep their hair out of their truffles.  Will upload picture.
author: Pia C.

description: We came to this location due to the reviews. The hot chocolate was delicious and not expensive at all. Just the right amount of chocolate to milk ratio with whipped cream. I added some cinnamon which gave it the extra bit of awesomeness.
author: Carlos C.

description:
This is hands down my favorite chocolate shop in San Francisco

Four years ago my grandfather and I walked into this truffle store randomly because my grandfather was extremely cold and wanted a hot chocolate (he is from Florida, lol). We stumbled upon this small, family owned truffle shop and we sat down and had hot chocolate and probably more truffles than we should have eaten. I was searching for the place I had gone with him the last time he ever came to San Francisco and I finally found it again last week!

When I walked in it was just like it was with my grandfather four years ago, and since his birthday would have been 3 days ago, I figured I needed to get some truffles to celebrate his birthday. The gentleman attending the counter was AWESOME, and I mean really super nice. He chatted with us and about my grandfather and he just made the experience that much better.

The truffles here are far beyond what I have tasted at other chocolate shops, and the family vibe makes everything so much better. This is by far the best truffle place in San Francisco, it's a must try!
author: Haley B.

description:
Yuuuuuuuuuum! Chocolate. 

I love a good truffle. Well, actually, I love oodles of good truffles, so this shop is a little bit of heaven for me.  

I came in with a friend so she could buy a variety for some gatherings, and one sample later, I was buying a box of my own!  Sneaky truffle people.  They even gave us ANOTHER sample, but I retained my composure and didn't buy any more.  Next time, though, I probably will.  

I saw people ordering hot chocolate that was made at the counter, and it looked amazing.  If we hadn't just finished lunch, I would have forced my friend to have some with me. I think they come with a truffle as well, so it's a steal.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Terrible online ordering process. I placed an order on 12/9/15 for the holidays that never got past processing. When I called in January to follow up, I was told that they had not shipped due to temperatures at the destination. This practice is perfectly acceptable and thoughtful, except I never received any notification about this, despite having received my account and billing emails correctly. Instead of waiting indefinitely for an email response, the next step should be to call the phone number on my account.

Shipping also costs about half of what the truffles cost to begin with, better off buying in store only.

The cherry on top is after originally posting this review, I received an email with subject line "Note added to your XOX Truffles order from December 9, 2015." The note reads: "Refunded 1/7/16. Did not pay Express for FL. Bitch!" If you didn't know this notifies your customer, now you do. This is also an effective way for successfully contacting your customers about their unprocessed orders in the future. I openly admit I did not pay for express shipping, as I thought ordering on 12/9 was enough time to ship before Christmas and had not considered temperatures as a factor.
author: Hayley C.

description: The truffles here are so delightful! They melt in your mouth and the owner is so welcoming and helpful. My love for French truffles is real and now I can stop by to pick up my favorite chocolates now that I've found this hidden gem.
author: Jacqueline P.

description:
Labor of love.
When you can say that about a business, it's a very good thing.

And you can say that about this business.

The man behind XOX Truffles works hard & passionately, & clearly knows his stuff.

Unless you straight up just don't like chocolate, there's no way you can't love these truffles.

They're perfect little morsels.  Refined & very grown-up treats.  Flavors like earl grey & lavender.  Some w liquor.  There's even one made w soy that is vegan.  

You get a complimentary one w purchase, any flavor you want.  Even if you only order a coffee.  Coffee & chocolate...so European.

Handmade love.
A great gift...for your friends & loved ones, or just for yourself.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I love the rare experience of walking into a business in a larger city and getting a small, family vibe. The inside of XOX Truffles is small, but cozy and the guy working the counter was very friendly. I originally walked in on a mission for coffee, but quickly realized there is much more to this place...
We ordered a couple mochas as well which were a bit rich but delicious. We were given free truffles with our mocha order too. That was a HARD decision. The selection of truffles was out of this world. My first choice with the lavender (divine) but before we left we were also offered a couple of earl grey truffles as well (also divine!)
Both the earl grey and the lavender truffles melted in our mouths. They were amazing and just small enough to not be too rich with our mochas. I wish we had ordered more!
author: Brianna H.

description: If you associate San Francisco with chocolate, and you'd like to experience a true chocolatier making little delicious things, this place is a must.  On our recent trip to SF, we thought we'd find more places like XOX, but realized it's much more unique than we realized.  The chocolates are truly special, deeply flavored and light as a cloud.  I wish I had some right now.  The place itself is very small and discreet.  I went looking for it, and walked right past.  It's worth going out of your way for.
author: Evan G.

description: I had the soy vegan dark chocolate and soy vegan hazelnut and they are the best bits of chocolate of my life. absolutely zero hint of soy flavor. oh my god.
author: Lui L.

description: Tiny store & amazing truffles!!! Peanut Butter & Coconut were my favs. Give it a shot.
author: Grant B.

description: Such good truffles from this place! They even have dairy free options. They have coffee drinks and you get a free truffle with any drink. It is a great little chocolate shop and is a great option for an after meal dessert being that is it located near a bunch of Italian restaurants.
author: Yuva C.

description:
Went in with a food tour. We did not have high expectations (we didn't know anything about this place beforehand). My husband and I were very surprised by the very vibrant flavours of the different kinds, and the high quality of chocolate. These are the only chocolate truffles we have had that have the true "truffle" shape (and I eat a lot of chocolate!). We initially had 3 each as part of the tour but we bought a box of 20 of assorted flavours. They are all in the same box so it's kind of exciting to see which flavour we get. 

The packaging for 20 is literally a small take out box like the kind used for rice in Asian restaurants. This would be disappointing as a gift. I don't know if they have other packaging, but that doesn't take away from the excellent truffles. 

The chef is really cool and friendly.
author: Richa B.

description:
After ordering lunch from the Italian homemade company, we went on the hunt for coffee and found this little shop two doors down.  

The lattes and tea options were very comprehensive, but I was most impressed with XOX Truffles' hot chocolate.  The barista mixed it very well, whisking a large amount of cream into it with an actual whisk.  The result was incredibly rich and creamy, possibly one of the best hot chocolates I have ever tasted.

Since we had ordered coffees, we got free truffles to sample!  Ended up deciding on amaretto chocolate, which was simultaneously dark with a hint of bitterness and creamy.  

In short, a fantastic place in North Beach, and a great source of drinks and/or chocolate to accompany any meal.
author: Emily Y.

description: Due to the raving reviews I had to visit this place. Its nothing special, I especially did not like EarlGrey flavor... very artificial I spit it out. We got 20 and had banana, some liquor truffles. I'd say the plain dark chocolate and hazelnut were the best but overall I'm not impressed.
author: wei t.

description: Awesome coffee ! One of the best coffees I ever tasted . Plus you get one free truffle chocolate when you order a coffee .
author: grace k.

description: I've been going to this place for years everytime I visit SF. The best truffles, and the owner is a talented genius with his dedication and creativity. The Brandy truffle is one of my favorites - but overall I haven't had one bad truffle here. I especially love that you can get a free truffle with pretty much any purchase.
author: Ashvin P.

description:
I can't believe it has taken me sooo long to write a review because I've been a fan for too many years.  Jean-Marc is a chocolate genius & a friendly man.  Visiting his shop is a treat in many ways.  I generally buy a box of 20 heavenly truffles for $14.  They are perfectly bite sized, flavored well & made with high quality chocolate.

My fav flavs:
Caramel - a MUST try!
Noisette - crunchy exterior
Amaretto - yum yum
Champagne - who doesn't love bubbles??
Earl Gray - sophisticated

BTW - You get a free truffle when you buy a coffee.  

They also opened a location at SFO so you may fly by & pick up decadent chocolate morsels for your flight or a gift!
author: Kim S.

description: What a fantastic place this is.  Handmade gourmet truffles, lots of flavors (including vegan), and very reasonable prices.  We've always loved how the pieces aren't gigantic, so you get delicious little bites without feeling like you've gone crazy.  Fancy boxes are available which you can customize, but it's also cool that they have Chinese carry out boxes for simpler occasions.  They give you a free sample when you order a box, or when you get a coffee.  You really can't go wrong here, but some favorites over the years have been the dark chocolate, espresso, rum raisin, noisette (hazelnut), casimira's favorite (white), and black and white ball.  Very inventive, high quality, but unpretentious and low-key, with very friendly service.  Love this place.
author: Greg W.

description:
I was brought here by a friend that suggested that these truffles made for amazing gifts. Located in the North Beach neighborhood of San Francisco, this store is a chocolate lovers' dream. XOX sells chocolates both in their shop and to retailers like Whole Foods. Run by a husband and wife team, XOX offers truffled chocolates in 27 unique flavors including honey vodka, rum raisin, red wine, caramel, Earl Grey, orange, and peanut butter.

A sample will cost 75 cents each, so I took advantage and had several. My favorites were the orange and red wine. For gifts, XOX offers beautiful packaging in different sizes. If you are in North Beach, I highly recommend stopping by XOX for a taste!
author: Steve N.

description: Beautiful truffles and beautiful people in this cute and sweet coffee & truffle shop! Been coming daily to try all the truffle flavors. It will not break the bank either, you get a free truffle with every coffee!
author: Aviva F.

description:
Simply GREAT! 
Went in today and I believe it was the owner (I forgot) who showed us how the truffles were made, he explained everything detail by detail and he made for us the lemon truffle -- just devine. 

I ended up buying just the lemon truffles but I did taste the caramel and dark chocolate truffle as well, You just can't go wrong with this place, everything is great.
author: Eliza B.

description: This place is amazing! I had the ice coffee and it was amazing quality!!! I know when coffee is amazing when I can drink it black and it's smooth! Also, I had the coconut and peanut butter dark chocolate which is amazing!
author: Lucy T.

description: A small place, but big flavors. Good temper on the chocolates, and my favorite truffle was a pomegranate one. Definitely a sweet, small treat!
author: Laura S.

description:
These days, I think it is rare to meet someone who truly loves the work that they do. Not everyone puts their heart and soul into their job, career, or business. That is why it was extremely refreshing to meet Chef Jean-Marc Gorce, the Frenchmen and Chocolatier. 

My boyfriend and I were taking a food tour in North Beach and were very lucky to have this charming truffle shop as one of our stops. Chef welcomed our large group into his shop and excitedly told us the story of how he got into truffle-making and how he and his wife turned XOX Truffles into the successful business it is today. 

Chef Jean-Marc Gorce makes his truffles fresh everyday (I know because I saw him make them and you can too if you take a visit!) and the love, creativity, and cooking expertise he puts into every truffle shows.

There were so many truffles to choose from and I tried 9 different flavors but I can say that the MUST TRY flavors were the following:

1. Cayenne Tequila (Sweet with a kick at the end!)
2. Coconut 
3. Bourbon

I highly recommend taking a stroll here for a coffee and some truffles after a dinner in North Beach. I cannot stress enough how lovely both the shop and its Chef are. It will satisfy your sweet tooth and renew your love in chocolate.
author: Loryn F.

description: Very affordable and the coffee was great! You get a free truffle with your coffee! I got the a la Kahlua. It was so good and I wish I had bought more!!
author: Allison H.

description:
Really Expensive - because these magnificent gems are so phenomenal you can't  just eat one! I love to buy the small Chinese Food Carton and select 2 doz treats - to share- really.
We stop in a Graffeo up the street for another North Beach dark treat.
author: Kae D.

description:
We came here as part of a food tour and had a great explanation of how the place got started and how to make truffles. We had the amaretto truffles to try as well as some to take home as well. He has like 20 flavors or so with some vegan ones as well. 

Did you know chocolate is good for your heart. Just like red wine though it is only good in moderation. Good thing moderation is in the form of 5 truffles. Amaretto and caramel are really good. It's a nice little shop that also does french coffee really well. If you are looking for italian style espresso go to north beach. If you are looking for a nice french roast, come here. Hot chocolate is also very good here. If you are looking for chocolate in the area, look no further than XOX Truffles.
author: Vincent W.

description:
The chocolates are expensive and not beautiful but they are handmade from a pretty shop in SF Little Italy so it is an experience in itself.  Because it is expensive from a little shop, we savor it even more.

It will not break your pocket book and you only want to a little of indulgence anyway so go and treat yourself.
author: Connie W.

description: We had a wonderful time! Dropped by right before closing. Had a delicious almond milk mocha. Truffles were amazing. We should have doubled our order. We enjoyed talking with the chef as well. What a treat!
author: Samantha B.

description:
I used to live right above XOX in my first apartment together with soon-to-be hubby in San Francisco. It was 1988-1989. Unfortunately XOX did not exist then....and we moved on up to Russian Hill for the next 7 years and STILL they didn't exist. Harumph.

If you're like me and hate the hard shells that come on most truffles, then this is the place for you. And if you wonder where they're made, then take a look at the photo I'm posting of the owner/chef making a batch. Right here, baby.....right here.  

XOX truffles are like eating only the center ganache of a truffle - and this is the only type of truffle I will eat. The flavors they offer at XOX are so delicious that you have to select at least 4 or 5 flavors. Caramel is always a favorite. I also enjoy the Kahlua. The teens liked orange and lemon and Earl Grey among others.

You can then take your lovely truffles and a coffee and sit outside to enjoy watching all of the Columbus Ave. passers-by....
author: Laurie H.

description: Small place that makes a variety of truffles, as well as great hot chocolate. You will not find perfectly formed truffles as you might get at a larger, more commercialized store, but the flavors are all that you would want, and expect. DO check store hours as they vary by day.
author: Jean G.

description: Oh! I love the truffles here. They are bite sized awesome treats! I tried expresso, chocolate and rum and raisin truffle. They were all good!
author: Aayush S.

description: Highly recommend this place for a no-frills decadent truffle. You will love how the Earl Grey melts in your mouth with a very subtle tea taste in your mouth. If Earl Grey is not your thing, they have have coconut and even vegan varieties for your sweet tooth. Also, the owner is very charming and friendly.
author: Adam K.

description: Always amazing flavors and great service. For me, having milk allergy, this place is heaven.  So good.
author: Michael W.

description:
It's been years since I've had truffles and this was very much welcomed in my stomach.

There were a few options for the gf so she picked her own set. Where I just basically just told the person behind the counter to give me two of everything.

They were delicious. Some of the flavors are very pronounced such as the earl grey and the liquior flavored ones, whereas some was just like, okay not bad--whats next.
author: Jason Z.

description: Love it! Jean even showed us how he makes those delicious truffles! Try the cognac. It's the best. And also, ask for his story!
author: Ganesh K.

description: XOX truffles offers delicious vegan truffles, the best I've had in the country (and other places I've tried around the world). While it seems they only carry 2-3 options each day, the flavors are amazing and will not disappoint. The employees/owner were all super friendly too, I'd certainly like to continue supporting small, local businesses like this so I'll be back.
author: Christina M.

description:
I have been trying to find a flavorful yet affordable coffee shop in the area, and surprisingly XOX is currently my favorite! They're technically not a coffee shop, but for only $2.25, I can get a 16 oz coffee + a free truffle! What a deal!! Their truffles are great (I like the hazelnut one the most).

If you're not a coffee person, try the hot chocolate! It's made with real chocolate and whisked in your cup. You'll get a free truffle with your drink as well. Win, win!!
author: Jenn W.

description: So delicious... and the owner is open and friendly and obviously loves doing what he does.  If you come to San Francisco, make it a point to stop by here.  The vin rouge and the jasmine were personal favorites!
author: Scott C.

description: We came in and had the most delicious truffles I have had in my entire life. He is rated as the #7 chocolatier in the US. He is a must check out if you are visiting San Fran. He also ships truffles anywhere in the US. We will be ordering some when we return home to Phoenix. Highly recommend the hazelnut.
author: Nicole R.

description: Owner and creator is friendly and genuinely believable and stands behind his counter and his product. Lovely truffles and as always let them melt in your mouth, no chewing friends.
author: cm g.

description:
This place is amazing.....the truffles are made on site and are so very good...!
Worth every calorie.
author: Connie N.

description: This place is a must. Best chocolate I've ever had. The coffee is great and the owner is really kind.
author: Solo M.

description: This is THE place to get high quality FRESH chocolate truffles in SF.  Don't be deterred by the non-nondescript interior of the place.  The owner is a french gentleman that's super nice.   All the truffles are made on site, so you can be sure that you are getting the freshest truffles.
author: Judy H.

description:
Per the bf's recommendation, have tried this place TWO times now (which means my review is 2x more reliable!). Let me preface by saying I used to work at a fancy chocolate store so I'm kinda picky about chocolate now. I'm also just a chocolate fiend (from birth...apparently according to my mother).

All the truffles I've tried have been very good. The ones that stick out are the hazelnut and coconut; I found that the flavors in these were more prominent. All the truffles are very smooth and balanced (not too sweet/bitter). The "price is right" too with a 20 piece coming in $10 from what I remember. That is a deal fosho. The 2 times I've tried their truffles, they've packaged it in those cute "to-go" containers you get from Chinese take-out. (...which speaks to my Chinese self:P)

*The only thing that I wish was different was that their truffles came with a flavor guide or something...or maybe that they looked physically different. so I could know which flavor I was eating. But...I guess, that just means each truffle is a surprise. Supplies!
author: G L.

description: Amazing chocolates & great cappuccino. The owner is very friendly! Love that every coffee comes with a free truffle.
author: Matt B.

description:
I just returned from a chocolate hunt in Paris, but I realize now that my search was in vain. Don't get me wrong, I did have some great chocolate in France. However, before today, I didn't realize such delicious delicacies existed. 

These truffles are like cocoa infused crack. Go buy them now. Or at least do yourself a favor and stop in for one sample next time you're in SF. You will not regret it. If you do, please call me so I can begin lab tests and experiments post haste to diagnose your genetic malady.

Merci beaucoup truffle wizards for enlightening me today.
author: Pete K.

description: These are awesome! Handmade truffles and the owner is incredibly friendly and informative!
author: J. C.

description: My dearest friend enjoying a mocha coffee with real chocolate with me in the city! Free truffle with coffee and 20piece buy! Everything was delish and service was awesome! Will be back!! The framboise truffle and cayenne tequila were sooo good!
author: Toni Marie A.

description: Holy moly, now THOSE are some good truffles! Pair them with a hot mocha-in my opinion, the best combo out there. This was my favorite coffee spot in SF, by far. Everything was so authentic and charming, including the service!
author: Audrey H.

description: I found a charming truffles shop in North Beach.  I was lucky to snag a free parking space around the corner on Greenwich St.  The owner/chef Jean-Marc Gorce makes the truffles on site.  He comes across as very personable and enjoys his artisan craft.  The truffles are $1 each or you can get a free sample if you buy a cup of coffee.  I would buy the can of 20 truffles for $18 with the cute pictorial of San Francisco's Crookedest Street.  You can choose to fill it with any flavor you want.  The choices are overwhelming so I'll list the flavors available on the day I visited : Cognac, Vin rouge (red wine), Sebastien's champagne, Noisette (hazelnut), Citron (lemon), Coconut, L-Orange, Framboise (raspberry), Earl Grey, Peanut butter, a la Kahlua, Cayenne Spicy Tequila, crème de menthe, Amaretto, rum raisin, Lavande de provence, Mango, Dark Chocolate, Espresso, Caramel, Soy/Vegan dark chocolate, Soy/Vegan a L'Orange, Honey Vodka.
author: Dr. Phil ..

description: Free truffle when you order a coffee!!! Amazing truffles. I got the raspberry one and will definitely be coming back. Owner is very sweet
author: Joy M.

description: This place is amazing, if I go back to san fran im deff stopping by here again, just told my friend about it as she is going for a visit :)
author: Rosa H.

description: truffles wow great stuff 1st time try it in san francisco try the hazelnut, coconut, kahlua, black and white  all was really tasty and flavorful its a 1 bite dessert but wow a bite that is out of this  world each truffles is 1 dollar each so 1 bite  is 1 dollar but its 1 bite that will blow your mind away with flavorful will for sure get some more again next time i am back in san francisco these truffles will blow your taste buds away try them out yelp on yelpers
author: sushiatown s.

description:
This place has the most delicious truffles I've ever eaten and I don't even like sweets. 

I ordered dark chocolate, strawberry, and cognac. Honestly, I couldn't tell the difference between dark chocolate and cognac, I just knew they were good. On the other hand, the strawberry tasted extremely sweet and almost too artificial, which I didn't like. Each piece is only $0.75 so trying all the different flavors is relatively cheap.

There are two tables outside that can fit about 6 people and a few seats inside that are in a row. Our group of 4 decided to sit outside since the weather was nice and relaxing.
author: Edward W.

description: Simply authentic, amazing, and delicious!!  My tastebuds were blown away. If you want a real truffle make sure you stop by here. It's hard to describe what happens in my mouth when I eat these truffles. It's glorious!!
author: Matt F.

description: free truffle with your coffee - love the concept! stopped in for an iced coffee - great flavor ! and came out with a nice treat - a hazelnut truffle ... these are DIVINE! so much hazelnut/ chocolatey goodness... can't wait to go back
author: danielle a.

description:
Wow, gosh and viola this is the place for authentic handmade truffles galore. The varieties are of this world and just to name a few flavours-
Green tea, Earl Grey, coconut and the list goes on like the yellow pages. 
They have pretty decorative boxes to take home or to give to friends also. So every time I am in SF; I would visit this out of the world truffles galore shop and get some souvenirs to take home with too. The owner is also the gentleman who makes the divine truffles. He listens to the French radio while making his magic truffles and I haven't heard singing in French yet! The truffles he makes sing to me for sure! Next time you pass by; check out this fantastic and quaint truffles shop! I guarantee you, won't be disappointed and will leave the shop with a gigantic smile on your face!
author: Elaine C.

description: 30+ flavors of homemade deliciousness. These truffles are literally a party in your mouth that you can tell are made with love. The hot chocolate is the best I've ever had and the quaint little shop is too cute. Don't miss this when on San Fran!
author: Julie D.

description:
If there is one part of the Sidewalk Food Tours of SF that I loved it is the  discovery of XOX Truffles. 

XOX is a one man show ran by Chef Jean-Marc Gorce. And before you ask: yes, he is French. The dark chocolate goodness comes out of  a very small (even by SF standards) shop on Columbus Ave, just few blocks down from all the touristy spots. The location is unassuming and too easy to skip if just walking around the neighborhood, unaware of the deliciousness waiting inside.

We stopped by XOX as part of the aforementioned tour and Chef Jean-Marc was so friendly, funny, and nice that he turned the visit to the highlight of the whole tour. He took his time to show the whole group how he makes his truffles and gave us an overview of his chef career and reasoning behind opening the truffle shop in SF North Beach neighborhood, most known for all things Italian, be it real or fake. 

Jean-Marc's truffles are bite-sized and hand made by the man himself right in front of you. This is an artisinal, small scale operation at its' finest. After the plain truffles are done, Jean-Marc adds the flavor and toppings. Upon the time of our visit there was about a dozen different flavors to choose from, ranging from hazelnut, raspberry to cognac and vodka. All truffles are pure dark chocolate, so rich and flavorful; a sweet delight that just  melts in your mouth and makes you want more.

The prices are a bit on the higher end but  totally worth it. Even if you are not the biggest fan of chocolate truffles I guarantee you will become one after the visit to Chef Gorce's shop. No store-bought chocolate can compare. To top it off,  if you buy a coffee, you get a free truffle....Come on now: one can't hurt!
author: Vedran V.

description:
We were on a San Francisco Food Safari Culinary Tour. One of the stops was here. We bought some truffles. They were so good. They are small sized. Just the  perfect size as it turned out. I was amazed that the size really makes a huge difference.

I will go back for sure. Nice people working there. I have to try their hot chocolate.
author: Dee J.

description: The truffles are amazing! We had hot chocolate too! Delicious! Fairly priced. Thumbs up!
author: Christian S.

description: Best hot chocolate in the city! The owner made the experience so much more sweet!! This place is worth every penny.
author: Megan E.

description:
In short: The hand crafted truffles here are must-try. The texture and flavor are simply fantastic. If you try it, you will be back for more.

A bit more detail.
Enter the modest shop and the gentleman behind the counter will give you a warm Southern-France greeting. If you're in the mood for it, order one of his excellent cappuccino's and get your free sample of one of his famous truffles. I recommend the black and white or lavender.

You will taste said truffle and immediately crave another.

The exterior is firm and coated with a thin layer of cocoa. The softer inside will melt on your palette in a sudden wave of perfectly balanced sweetness. I think the word perfect is no exaggeration here. 

This man has perfected the truffle.
author: Art M.

description:
Best hot chocolate and truffles. The people working in there are great and friendly
 If you are in North Beach do not miss it!!
author: William S.

description:
Their truffles are like little bites of heaven! It's sooo good and they have tons of unique flavors like earl grey. I usually never like chocolate infused with other flavors, but the ones here tastes natural and goes so well together. 

I was also extremely happy to find that their soy chocolate is just as delicious as the dairy ones!! This is so great for people with dairy allergies like me! The truffles are also stored well even on hot sunmer days, giving it the perfect cool temperature. Must try if you love chocolates!!
author: Joyce C.

description:
i have to come here everytime i go to sf. this place has been the dame delicious quality since a friend brought me here 8 yrs ago.

very intimate place. owner is a nice guy. chocolates are not too sweet. im not a fan of alcohol so my recommendations would be for caramel, hazelnut, earl grey
author: R C.

description: I absolutely LOVE this store! The hot chocolate is amazing if you like dark chocolate! You get the bold chocolate flavor without it being overly sweet. I like getting a shot of espresso in it. All the truffles are good but I'd recommend the a l'orange. It has just the right amount of orange flavor!
author: Grace H.

description:
I came for the truffles. We strolled through the North Beach fair and I told Hubby we had to go over to XOX for truffles.  I treated him to a cup of mocha (he HAD to add whip cream) and the coffee was too weak for him and tasted more like a hot chocolate (yummy!). YOu get a free truffle with a cup of coffee.  (double yummy).
I also bought 20 truffles. Always my favorite is the dark choc - smooth and creamy.
Tried the lavender - very strong lavender scent, not a retry for me again.  The honey vodka was interesting. No so much honey but VERY strong alcohol flavor.  Drinkers would like this one.  Truffles and cup of mocha Joe for under $18.  Love this place.
author: Ry T.

description:
Looking to try some handmade truffles, then this place is a must try. 
My favs flavors: Coconut, Rum+Raisin, Cognac.

I always make sure to stop by xox, when in the neighborhood.
author: Preeti M.

description: These truffles are delicious! We always get an assortment and are sad when they are gone. Very addictive.
author: Ana V.

description:
From the moment you walk in, you can tell this place is special! Wow, the delicious smell of chocolate delights your senses. 

Great coffee and free sample truffles made our visit spectacular! This is a place we will seek out and return to on our next visit to San Francisco!
author: Vince F.

description:
Friendly staff, excellent coffee. It's a small place so it gets packed pretty quickly. I was surprised at how much I liked their house iced coffee. I normally dislike house-brewed iced coffees, but they convinced me instead of ordering my usual Americano. 

The coffee tasted delicious of flowery goodness with a soft finish. I liked my delicious complimentary truffle to compliment my coffee too :)

I will go back when I'm in North Beach!


If it's a hot day - you'll have to buy bottled water from them or get a tiny cup from the sink. :/
author: Mimi T.

description:
These are hands down the best chocolates I've had in SF. The outside is a thin and delicate shell filled with intense, melt-in-your-mouth, smooth, and dense flavors. There is a wide variety to choose from, with my personal favorites being: earl grey, amaretto (top one), spicy tequila, and black and white. 

They're also pretty darn inexpensive. I'm used to going to stores and paying around $12 for four measly truffles (or even 2!) but you can get a nice mini-Chinese takeout box of them for that much over here. They're not the beautiful little art pieces that other stores have, but making these truffles actually isn't as easy as it looks and also tends to take more expensive ingredients (chocolate has six crystalline structure types, with #5 being the most difficult and expensive but best one to obtain). 

Also: this is right next to The Italian Homemade kitchen. Stop there for lunch and then stop by here and fill up a box of chocolates =).
author: Sylvia L.

description: Visited again and I have to say, it's still dynamite. You can't beat the "free truffle with a coffee" deal cause the iced coffee is delicious and the truffles are the best. The. Best.
author: Jarred D.

description:
Hmm. After seeing all of the glowing reviews, I was so so so excited to finally try XOX truffles.  Unfortunately, I don't think it lived up to the hype.  With that being said, it was still pretty good, just not amazing.

I went on a Sunday afternoon and the place had two people working.  Both were working on something, but quickly greeted me when I came in.  I didn't know which truffles I wanted, so they gave me a few minutes.  I ended up getting a coffee and the hazelnut, dark chocolate, and cognac.  The cognac was the best, and the most unique.  The other two were good but had much milder and much more usual flavors.  I'd probably recommend trying their weirder flavors.  The truffles are $0.75 each, but you get one for free with the purchase of a coffee.  The coffee really isn't anything special, but it's good enough to balance the sweetness of the truffle.  

The store itself is really tiny.  They do have a couple tables outside of the shop if you want to sit down.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I was walking through North Beach today looking for some place to have a nice lunch, and passed by this nice truffle place. I think I remember reading somewhere that there is a famous truffle place in North Beach and so I decided to come it to give it a try. I ordered 5 truffles ($.75 each) and they were so delicious! 

Green Tea: This is a truffle that is coated with a green tea chocolate. The inside truffle is extremely delicious and melts in your mouth. 

Orange: Wonderful orange flavor that melts in your mouth. Made to perfection! 

Caramel: The owner recommended this one and the Cognac but I decided to go with the caramel instead. It was seriously amazing. I don't know how he made it, but the truffle had a delicious soft gooey inside of caramel, and the outside was also very soft, so it was a miracle that the truffle doesn't fall apart when the whole thing is so delicate tasting. However, it did get crushed when I put it in my bag, so do be careful to hold your truffles delicately when you buy them.

I have yet to try the lavender and the ear grey flavored truffles that are sitting on my desk this very moment!
author: Jeanette S.

description:
There isn't much I can say that deviates from what hundreds of others have already written, but XOX is such a sweet place - because of both the quality of the truffles, and the extremely friendly owner.  A friend kept raving about the place during a recent visit to San Francisco, explaining that the owner hand made all the truffles, and that the caramel ones were to die for.

The place is small and allows the product to speak for itself instead of relying on a lot of marketing and fancy packaging, which I love. When we arrived, there was a line in front of us, including a couple who barely spoke English and appeared to be struggling to decide which truffles to buy - the owner was so patient and friendly and helpful, making suggestions and keeping count of how many they picked out (way more patient that I was feeling, waiting to pick out mine!). I ended up with a mix of mint, caramel, peanut butter, hazelnut, strawberry, and champagne truffles, and was even allowed to pick one additional sample truffle! The truffles themselves were perfect - rich but not too sweet, with just enough flavor melted in to accentuate but not overpower the chocolate.

I will definitely make an effort to return here the next time I'm in San Francisco. It's so worth the calories! It's also great knowing that I'll be giving someone as nice as the owner more business.
author: Angirenee W.

description:
Yum!  Free truffle with each cup of coffee.  

Melt in your mouth, chocolate goodness -- creamy, flavorful, little piece of heaven.

I find I prefer the liquor flavors which have more distinct flavors.  The lavender is also quite nice if you like floral / herbal flavors.  The earl grey was a bit too subtle for me to taste.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Amazing! I adore the mango, earl grey, lavender, strawberry, hazelnut.... They are all amazing though!

Prices decent
author: Jessabelle R.

description: I mean....wow.  when i first saw in the window, I thought too plain looking. Its not abt fancy looks here. Just excellent, perhaps best Ive ever tasted
author: Stuart K.

description: Some of the best truffles ive ever enjoyed. Crunchy out the outside and creamy and decadent on the inside. I love the hazelnut and peanut butter the best.
author: Nilo K.

description:
My boyfriend frequents San Fran with his family, and he just HAD to bring me here when we went together. You get a free truffle with every coffee drink. The coffee - normal, fine, whatever. The truffles? WOW!

The truffles are inexpensive and I was SO happy that he makes a few vegan truffles too. They were just as good as the others and I just had to buy some for my milk-free mom back home in Texas!

Don't pass this place by, you'll be hooked!
author: Lesley W.

description:
Foodie or not, there's a truffle that's got your number here.  Even if you drop into San Fran for a day, you absolutely MUST try these!  You can taste the artistry, the passion, and the care as these melt in your mouth into delicious smoothness.  
I love the l'Orange, and my hubby (who doesn't care much for dark chocolate), absolutely loved the Peanut Butter.  Some other flavors that deserve honorable mention: earl grey, amaretto and raspberry.  If you miss these in town, no worries, pick some up at the United terminal at SFO.
(I'm currently ordering more online :)
author: Irina S.

description:
The BEST chocolate that I have had!!!  I am so regretted that I only got 20pc last Sunday. It is so good to be with Coffee/Red wine and even just have it melting in your mouth. 
I will go back again this weekend!
author: Vlicy C.

description:
Forget Lindt, this is the place to get REAL chocolate truffles! My wife and I really needed a caffeine fix after a day of sight-seeing around Alcatraz, Fisherman's Wharf and Lombard (Crooked) Street. We wandered into the place after noticing all the great reviews on Yelp (thanks everyone!). 

This place is great because the truffles are homemade and not made in some factory far away. Each one has a different shape and uniqueness to it. I had the coffee and my wife had a hot chocolate since it was a chilly summer evening. Everything was so decadent! The barista was extremely friendly and so were some of the other guests. They gave us some tips on places in the neighborhood we could walk towards. 

I like spicy chocolate so I tried the cayenne chocolate truffle which had a great balance between subtle spice and rich dark chocolate. I have also recently had a craving for chocolate and peanut butter so tried that truffle as well, which was perfect! the flavors were melded together so well that I couldn't distinguish where the chocolate ended and the peanut butter began. My wife on the other hand loves coconut and chocolate and caramel, so she tried the coconut truffle and the caramel truffle. They were also tasty and well balanced. 

Combined with a freshly brewed cup of coffee or hot chocolate these were an awesome compliment to a wonderful day of sightseeing in San Francisco. I cant' wait to come back soon!
author: Shamie D.

description: Delish with a capital D!!! What a charming establishment...very small but super welcoming. The staff was friendly and helpful. Wonderful chocolates and coffee drinks!
author: K L.

description:
Went here after eating lunch because my family requested a dessert meal. I had a hot chocolate and 1 caramel truffle that came with it.
