At first the truffle was bitter but quickly took a turn to a smooth creamy wonderland. The chocolate tasted very good. "Better than Starbucks" as my sister stated it was very soft and creamy. Although I enjoyed it very much the hot chocolate was a little flat but still good. There was good music playing as I enjoyed myself (mostly rock) and added a nice feel to my overall experience. 

I would recommend this spot to chocolate enthusiasts and people with the occasional sweet tooth alike.

Definetly come here if you are staying over the weekend or staying for a vacation.

In addition the pace has been opened for 16 years which tells you something about this humble family owned truffle shop.
author: Martin K.

description: Truffles that leave you speechless! If you are a chocolate lover and love truffles, then I recommend you pass on the other touristy chocolate shops (cough, pier 39, cough) and stop here to get some amazing chocolate truffles. These are high quality chocolates. Stop by this shop so that you can say you remember having these chocolates when they were located in a beautifully cozy shop in San Francisco before they got huge! Just be warned, you may feel inclined to sign over your first born to have all the chocolates in the display window.
author: Cliff S.

description:
These are not the kind of truffles you find in Walmart, let's get that straight.

These are truffles done right and intense.
And you'll need something to wash it down with.
Not to worry they have a coffee menu.

The shop itself is small, a little hidden, and it's got a fun funky feel.

The staff is friendly and welcoming.
author: Melissa N.

description:
On one of my rare trips up to the city, my friend and I decided to grab some dessert at this cute little truffles shop because her boyfriend's company's coffee is served here! 

There are so many different types of truffles it took me quite a while to decide on what to pick! I finally decided on the earl grey, caramel, and kahlua. The caramel tasted like one of those Ghirardelli chocolate squares with caramel in the middle - my favorite! To be honest, I couldn't really taste the earl grey or kahlua.. but there were still delicious anyways! 

I noticed they brought out two new flavors with white chocolate while I was sitting outside. I love white chocolate so I had to go back in and grab another one. I was trying to decide between the Black and White and Casimira's Favorite. I ended up choosing Casimira's Favorite, vanilla covered in white chocolate. It was amazing!! Quite sweet but definitely my favorite. 

Also, almost forgot to mention that each truffle only costs 75 cents! And if you get coffee or tea, you get a free truffle. The prices can't get any more reasonable than that. I also noticed quite a bit of discounts if you buy in bulk. I saw 20 for $12, but didn't really pay attention to the larger packs.
author: Stephanie C.

description: This little gem was pointed out on our City Guides tour of Little Italy.  Chili tequila truffle--mmmm,mmmm!
author: Lori T.

description: I love this place!  This place is such a treat- when I go I try not to over-indulge and so I only pick a couple at time which is so hard.  All the flavors are my favorites- rum raisin, red wine, champagne, lavender, hazelnut, and on and on.  It is a tiny shop with little seating, but if you can score an outdoor table, do it- it's great for people watching.  And every time I've been there, the owner/chocolatier has been there making truffles.  Such a great thing.
author: Becky N.

description: Popped in here early on a Sunday morning just as they opened. Had nothing to go on but the reviews online which were all quite complementary. Chef put together a 20 piece box and provided us with a few samples. Truffles these days are about as common a confection you can find but these were, did, live up to the hype in every way. Two thumbs up!
author: Qiong W.

description:
XOX Truffles did hit the spot!!!  Lavender and tequila/cayenne were awesome...

Sitting outside this small Chokolateria with a coffee and these masterpieces was a perfect way to kill some time before the bar opened!
author: Anders M.

description: Chocolate truffles rolled in Cocoa! This was another stop on the Taste Buds Tour. I got the coconut and caramel. They're small, not overly sweet, and tasty little morsels.
author: Elise G.

description: Probably the best truffles I've ever tried, and good Americanos.  The ambiance was a little lackluster, but overall a decent stop on a beautiful stroll down the street.  The Champagne truffle was our favorite, but the tequila spice truffle was a close second.
author: Eli J.

description: The "coffee with a free truffle" is a really pleasant alternative to every other coffee shop's offering, and both parts of the package are good here. Really tasty truffles.
author: David S.

description:
This was on a Foodie food tour. We got to taste 4 of the truffles, speak to the owner/chef/truffle maker, and see how he makes the delicious creations.

The owner is so informative, likes to take pictures, and is very talented at the hand-made art of truffles.

The chocolate is very rich, and each of the flavors is very different, but so intriguing. The tequila (a little spicy), champagne and earl grey are my recommendations.
author: Nataliya A.

description: I'm a newbie to San Francisco, the other day my friend brought me to this little gem. The place is easy to miss and walk past, I walked past till the corner a couple times then gotta walk back. I never miss to stop by whenever I go to Columbus st. I usually get a cup of mocha and red wine truffle. They completely made my day.
author: Somi S.

description:
I found this place by accident, and I am so glad I did! I bought a small sampler of 20 pieces and was given one free at the store. The price is great for quality chocolates and the pieces I've had are exquisite so far! The only down side is that I don't know which flavors I am having in the assortment, just that they are delicious :)

They have excellent service as well---super friendly. I regret that I didn't have a chance to buy more before leaving San Fran.
author: Christina P.

description: Whenever we are in San Fran, we will always come visit XOX truffles! A Must!
author: Alan A.

description:
The chocolatier was in, short winded and not as talkative as I had hoped but was very pleasant!  The prices were much lower than I was expecting for the little brown nuggets.  Are they pretty? yes!  It's chocolate!  Is it artistic looking, no, but that can be found elsewhere. 

The melt in your mouth feel was great, just dissolving to a hot chocolate of greatness. The chocolate was rich but I have had a bit better in a truffle. Is it better than your ordinary... Yes for sure.  This is especially true when you factor in the low price. This is a time I wish there was a 4.5 star but it's just a hair shy of a 5 star for me.
author: Mike S.

description:
Even though it was nearing closing time, the hour that most employees are tired and less friendly, the man working was amazingly nice and made us feel extremely welcome. The coffee was good and the truffles delicious. The truffle that stuck out to me was the Earl Grey, it was smooth with a delicate earl grey flavor, I feared it would be bitter like cream-less tea but it exceeded my expectations!

This is a charming hole in the wall type place. Thumbs up.
author: Danae M.

description:
I am so addicted.. my favorites are cognac, cayenne spicy tequila, hazelnut and french roast. But honestly all the flavors are so damn good just try it all.  Really depends on mood and preference. 

It's $13 for 20 pieces and a free sample.
author: Anna C.

description: If you toss these truffles on the sidewalk, it'll look like someone didn't curb their pet.  However, the taste far exceeds the outer appearance.  I assume the melancholy guy in the chef pants is the Chocolatier.  He is always pleasant but he makes me wonder why the keeper of my dream job looks more miserable than me.
author: T S.

description:
When I think of chocolate truffles, two different visuals come to mind:

1.) an expensively dressed woman sipping on a martini, wearing a large hat, haw-haw-hawing with her fellow affluent hoitie-toitie socialites snacking on truffles with pinkies up and commiserating over their latest botox adventure or recent 5th yacht purchase.

2.) an old retired lady in a flowered mumu with rollers in her hair sitting in front of the tv eating her "bon bons".

Haha - I know, my impression of truffles is completely arbitrary and skewed.  They never really interested me before... until I tasted XOX truffles.  I'm not a big fan of sweets nor chocolate, but these little gems really blew me away.  I could see these little things are made with a lot of love, and passion for the trade.  So very Francais, so very artisanal, and I now have new-found appreciation for a good truffle.  

The champagne one was amazing.  The caramel one, fantastic.  The hazelnut,  yummy.  The tequila-cayenne - wow!  I can go on and on.  What I'd really rather do is just dunk my whole face in one of the bowls and get truffled up.  Not cute, but I'd do it if given the chance.

To anyone I know that is reading this, my birfday is coming up.  Hint, hint.
To the hubz, when I'm 80 and in my mumu and rollers asking you to bring me my bonbons, please hand me XOX truffles.  :)
author: Teresa P.

description: The truffles were great but the coffee was terrible. It was pretty cheap for drip coffee and you get a free truffle ($1 value) with it anyway so it wasn't a big loss. I'll come back just for the chocolate!
author: Karen G.

description:
cute litte french truffle place!

The owner was soo nice and very passionate about his truffles. 

Really all the flavors are delish. I did like the champagne one though. Also go for the hot chocolate which is made with the same chocolate they use for the truffles. You also get a free truffle piece when you order the drinks so it's a great little treat. 

Anytime I need a warm hot chocolate fix I will be coming here!
author: Christine W.

description:
I come here at least once a year or more, to buy a box of delicious chocolate truffles. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/sxhmrr1dgjS0N_Wc0zOd8Q/l Top 10 in the USA. The fancy boxes cost more, the plain chinese takeout box is the best value (0.50 each). http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/caVitHIrVeUf5IGElIhmMg/l There's about 2 dozen flavors http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/f-z20TByFuyJZf-dxnaZGQ/l (one is named after the owner's wife Casimira). I usually get a mix of one of the liqueur flavors and a couple of the fruit flavors.

The menu includes coffee, tea, & sodas. And he usually gives u a free truffle with any purchase. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/b0nnPtJ4QPggaslhctHGIw/l The space inside is very small, but there are 2 small round metal tables outside to sit and enjoy your coffee. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/oUCVc0RGTKQQnoMULHt2xg/l 

This time I arrived while chef/owner Jean Marc was making a new batch. He's always super friendly, so he was happy to show me the process and let me take a few pictures. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/T1jn5apzz0p8bMtQLDjmuw/l Later, I realized that I forgot to take a picture of him. Well, next time.
author: Luis C.

description: Tauted by chocolatier magazine, how could we resist?! Delectable truffles and attentive, considerate service.
author: Breanna K.

description:
A little back story.... earlier this year I was on bed-rest for 2 weeks.  Could hardly move.  Everything hurt.  My very sweet friends came by to visit, keep me company, cook me food, etc.  One of my friends brought me a little box of XOX truffles.  

OMG  So amazingly, melt-in-your-mouth, close-your-eyes-is-this-what-heaven-tastes-like delicious.  I kept the box in the refrigerator and every time I forced myself to hobble on crutches to go around my apartment, I would reward myself with a truffle.  So, yes, these truffles are worth hobbling on crutches for; they're that good.
author: Chloe M.

description:
We stopped by XOX Truffles on a recent food tour we took in North Beach.  We were each given a "sample" of truffles and, by sample, I mean about 15.  Naturally, it was way too many to eat in one sitting, so we enjoyed them over the course of our trip to San Francisco.  Each one we tried was delicious, very rich, and oh-so-chocolately.  I think my favorite was the coconut-covered one.  

I noticed that they were offering a free truffle with every coffee purchase.  What a great little treat!
author: Eric K.

description: Outstanding truffles and a warm welcome from the proprietor. Could not recommend more highly. Recommended flavors include cognac, caramel, and lavender.
author: Michael M.

description:
I would have completely missed the tiny shop of chocolately goodness if I did not have three other people trying to search it out as well. But I am glad that I was able to visit XOX Truffles because their truffles have a nice hard shell with a creamy delicious center. Ranging from 0.50-0.75 cents each, these truffles are totally worth buying a box of 15 or 20, even though they are small.  And with over two dozen flavor you are bound to find one that really tickles your taste buds. 

I bought a box a twenty for myself and enjoyed pretty much every single flavor. I cannot pinpoint my favorites because I feel that most of the time I am just each "a dark chocolate variant" aka chocolate with a little something different added. I do know that I love espresso, orange, and peanut butter but I am not keen on the spicy one. After tasting these truffles, I picked up two more boxes of twenty as gifts.
author: Andrew W.

description:
Wow this place is good!  The owners are clearly passionate about chocolate and use quality ingredients to produce some wonderful truffles!  They have a very nice variety of flavors.  I especially enjoyed the vanilla, menthe de creme, peanut butter, and lavender truffles.  I like the smaller truffle sizes that let you try more truffles than some of the chocolatiers that charge $3/truffle and make them huge.  

As a side note, if you are looking for a great date idea, go to the Italian Homemade Company nearby for lunch/dinner and come here for dessert!
author: David B.

description: This place is awesome!  I ordered the caramel, hazelnut and espresso truffles.  Caramel in my opinion was the best.  Also was offered a free truffle after ordering a coffee.  Truffles are $1 each unless you buy them by weight.  I think I saw 20 for $14.  Go on treat yourself!
author: D J.

description: This place was great! Their hot chocolate was perfect on the cold day that we were there on. I also took some truffles back home for my hubby. Loved the one with rum the best!!
author: Kinjal N.

description:
Dear XOX Truffles,

You should be ashamed of yourselves. Why on earth do you have to make such delicious truffles that nearly put me into a sugar induced coma because I inhaled almost an entire 20 piece box in one sitting? My complete lack of willpower means your mere existence could kill me.

K
author: Gail S.

description:
Every time I visit San Francisco, I make it a point to stop by XOX Truffles.  They are known for the caramel truffles, which have a deep, almost burnt flavor that I love.  During my last visit, I picked up the lavender truffles, which were fantastic...they remind me so much of the spa.  Delicious!

I usually buy 1/4 lb at a time to take home.  They are fairly delicate and need to stay in a cool environment for as long as possible or they become very soft to handle.
author: Joyce M.

description:
I wasn't really in the mood for some coffee but my friend grabbed the Iced White Mocha here. I tried one sip of hers and HAD to walk right back into the shop to get a cup myself! It's truly one of the first coffee places I've gone to that doesn't make their drinks bitter or overly sweet. To top off, they also give you a complimentary truffle to go along with your purchase. My friend let me steal her comp truffle, so I picked the Earl Grey and ended up buying 20 pieces of varying truffles for $12 bucks. Can't wait to share this place with all my friends!

P.S. Service was awesome and staff was beyond friendly.
author: Cindy N.

description: Very sweet and special little treat from SF! I stopped by with my friend after biking on the Golden Gate Bridge and purchased a box of small truffles with different flavors and a cup of coffee. They were nothing but a perfect afternoon snack combo.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Happy 500th review! I dedicate this to a sweet little (literally - it's cramped inside) shop I found the first time I was wandering North Beach. Offering up about 20 flavors of hand-made truffles, this shop of chocolate-ly, truffle-ly goodness is run by husband and wife duo Jean-Marc (of Fringale, apparently) and Casimira.

As of several months ago (pricing may have changed), you could buy inidividual bite-sized truffles at $0.75 per, or in quarter pound increments of about 20 truffles each, up to an entire pound, served up in Chinese take-out containers at ~$12 per quarter pound, in any combination of flavors you so desire.

Of course, the problem with these variety boxes is that, if it's your first time trying these, you may have some difficulty distinguishing flavors, and, well, it's nice to know what you enjoy and what you don't! Having made this exact mistake, take the following with a grain of salt, as some of the flavor associations may be wrong:

* Cognac (Cocoa Powder-Dusted) - Pretty darn tasty
* Honey Vodka (Cocoa Powder-Dusted) - Couldn't quite pick this one out
* Spicy Cayenne Tequila (Cocoa Powder-Dusted) - Not bad
* Vin Rouge/Red Wine (Cocoa Powder-Dusted) - Tasty!
* Caramel (Cocoa Powder-Dusted) - Just alright
* Dark Chocolate (Cocoa Powder-Dusted) - This one got a bit lost among the box, probably because it wasn't particularly unique
* Earl Grey (Cocoa Powder-Dusted) - Another one I couldn't quite place

A bit pricy given their size, but, really, these are pretty strong and flavorful truffles - how quickly are you going to, or should you, really, finish a box of 20? They lasted me a good month, so $12 wasn't all that bad of a deal. Also, while their shop might not look accessible because of the single step to get in, they have a ramp stowed away inside that they're more than happy to bring out should you need it.
author: Johnny W.

description: forget Starbucks:) get great cup of latte and free truffle. Madagascar vanilla beats all of them for me.
author: Pauline P.

description:
Three must do's in SF on a clear day!

1. xoxo chocolates.
2. top of Coit tower for views.
3. return to xoxo chocolates for all your gifts!

I tell everyone who visits sf if there is only one thing you can do, go there. Each year my child is very smart. She takes a box to each of her teachers.
author: R. W.

description: We almost passed this place while walking from Blue Angels show to the Market. Stopped by for coffee and discovered this place. Coffee was fresh and tasty, but truffles were real gem! I am not chocolate lover but this one worth it to try!
author: Irina K.

description:
I love the "home-made" quality of these truffles!! This place has great "ma & pop shop" charm and makes me feel like I travelled back in time, when candy was freshly made and not mass produced, when shop owners took pride in personally creating a best-in-town product. 

I highly recommend the champagne truffle and the caramel truffle!  Both melt in your mouth with just the right pop of flavor.
author: Riz W.

description: Phenomenal place. Great service sided with my favorite thing in the world, chocolate!
author: Gaieshan D.

description:
I think I just went to heaven. :)

These truffles are really the BEST BEST BEST truffles I've had in my life.

I buy them by the boxes.  They are great gifts!

My favorites:
-Hazelnut
-Orange
-Caramel
-Coffee.

I think I'm starting to salivate just talking about them.

Added the fact that all the workers there are incredibly nice and friendly!  They even let you try a piece or two!

Love EVERYTHING about this place!
author: Michelle T.

description: This is such a great find! I usually just get a box of twenty (they are small), and have them put together a variety of flavors. I don't even have a favorite because they are all so good, and there are some unique flavors that have been surprisingly delicious. They have really cute gift boxes for their truffles as well!
author: Audrey G.

description:
A plethora of truffles. An 18 yr old girl with a huge sweet tooth. I almost feel like this place was made for me. 
It's a cute little shop, not very roomy, it's not like a sit down to eat type of place anyways. They have a great selection of truffles from amaretto to black and white truffles. 
The truffles were perfect and all the flavors were distinct and not too sweet. 
The only problem I had however was that the earl grey was overwhelmingly strong. I don't dislike earl grey, but this was just terrible. 
I do recommend the other flavors. Casimira's Favorite was also mine, so definitely try that.
author: Veronica L.

description: This is a must visit while in SF. I'm not a truffle fan (Well now I am). I actually did not think I liked truffles but you don't taste one of these truffles and not like them. In fact, I tried 10 different kinds and liked them all. He had about 5 vegan truffles that were even richer in taste than the other ones. Good price, great service, excellent truffles.
author: Jackie D.

description: Yikes. Went in here with my roommate for 2 simple lattes. Something went wrong and they both tasted like water and milk. Went inside and let him know that the espresso shot wasn't working out, and he got pretty upset. "I've been in the business for 18 years and no one has ever disliked my latte." Okay, relax man we just want some coffee. Asked for 2 regular house coffees in exchange and he wanted to charge us. We will never be back.
author: Heather R.

description:
If you like truffles, this place is for you.

The chef is from France, so he knows what he's doing.  He makes them all by hand, and they're all delicious.  There is a wide variety, and they're small and cheap, so feel free to experiment with a few different kinds.  I tried the Amaretto, champagne, and one other I can't remember at the moment, and they were all really delicious.

Great gift idea for chocolate lovers or if you just want to surprise someone with some tasty treats.
author: Dave S.

description:
I happened to stumble into this place only for a coffee and was quickly diverted by the beautiful display of truffles.  The owner was super nice and offered my two free samples with my coffees.

I ended up buying a box of 20 truffles with an assortment of flavors. All delicious. I will definitely be ordering these online.
author: Julie F.

description:
Friendly Vibe, Tasty Treats!

Stopped in this rustic little shop on the recommendation of a friend - who swears XOX Truffles are the best truffles in the world -  and was not disappointed. Not sure if these are actually the best truffles in the world - as I am not a connoisseur of truffles - but for my palate, they were outstanding.

The selection of truffles is extensive, and the flavors and combinations of flavors are inspired. The Coconut, Cognac, Champagne, and Black and White are standouts in my book, but each truffle we tried (having purchased a selection of twenty) was luscious and delicious in its own right. Rich but not too heavy, made with excellent chocolate and exquisite flavorings. There was also an interesting Tequila Chile truffle in the mix with surprisingly good sneak-up-on-ya heat.

It was also a pleasure being served by the chef/owner, who was charming and a delight to speak with.

When in San Francisco, XOX Truffles is definitely worth a visit.

Highly Recommended.
author: Jinx T.

description:
This place has been featured in all sorts of articles and news stories but is still such a small shop. They are a true hidden gem of San Francisco. Their truffles melt in your mouth. 

If you want to impress a friend with a local gem, take them here. On a date? Even better. You can grab a taxi to downtown for about $7 from their location.
author: Andy M.

description:
Good variety of truffles

Price- just get a box and it will be cheaper
Quality- I applaud unique flavors and this place has a bunch of different flavors like earl grey, orange liqueur and some other great ones
Quantity- truffles are bite size
Atmosphere- very small place but has a home/cozy feel to it
Staff- very nice
author: John L.

description:
A tiny chocolate store in North Beach on Columbus Street.  I was expecting an upscale shop like Godiva stores, but I was pleasantly surprised to see that it was more of a mom & pop establishment.  Their truffles were nothing like those perfectly shaped Godiva truffles with a hard shell and soft liquid inside.  It was more like a chunk of chocolate.  Products were not displayed in a perfect alignment with special lighting.

$1.00 Coffee, which as one free truffle.
$0.75 a piece of truffle.
$8.00 for 20 pieces.

Since I love chocolate, I enjoy eating lots of it.  At 75 Cents a piece for a very small chunk, I cannot justify eating lots of it.  It was certainly GOOD, but I could also eat GOOD chocolate at Delessio Market & Bakery (http://www.yelp.com/biz/JM3jo6vkc60anARye9ypfQ) and getting a chocolate cake there.  Godiva truffles cost more, but each piece is bigger and more filling.  I could easily enjoy a cup of coffee with one Godiva truffle, but XOX Truffles were so small, I wanted more.
author: トモ T.

description: Came here in need to satisfy my cravings. No regrets. Went inside, small little place that can sit 3-4 people. You can see they guy (owner my guess?) making the truffles right behind the counter, and possibly his daughter helping out. I'm not really sure, I'm so sorry... Anyway, they have tons of flavors, about half of which are vegan! I bought the 12 for 12.50, just for the really pretty box. Even the girl tried to get me to buy the cheaper one since it was just for myself. Haha. The truffles are so soft and smooth and rich, oh so yummy! I don't remember which flavors i got. I just remember that they were really good.. Ha!
author: Yvonne N.

description:
fresh handmade truffles. caramel, raspberry, coconut, and more. Jean-Marc is a master chocolatier and his wares are his blessings to us. Never walk away from here without at least a box of 20. they are the size of small olives so don't worry about the calories. this is a mandatory stop on my tour of North Beach for all my out of town guests. and it never ever disappoints. another treat here that needs to be mentioned is the wonderful Graffeo coffee served here. the coffee beans are roasted directly across the street. you get a free truffle with every coffee drink. wow!
Liqueur flavors:

Amaretto (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Black & White Ball (White Chocolate-Coated)
Cognac (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Creme de Framboise/Raspberry (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Creme de Menthe (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
a la Kahlua (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Liqueur de Noisette (Hazelnut-Coated)
Rum Coco (Coconut-Coated)
Rum Raisin (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Triple Sec (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Noisette (Soy/Vegan)

Non-Liqueur

Caramel (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Casimira's Favourite (White Chocolate-Coated)
Citron/Lemon (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Coconut (Coconut-Coated)
Dark Chocolate (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Earl Grey (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Framboise/Raspberry (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
French Roast (Coffee Crunch-Coated)
Noisette (Hazelnut-Coated)
a l'Orange (Cocoa Powder-Dusted)
Peanut Butter (Dark Chocolate Hard Shell-Covered) 
Dark Chocolate (Soy/Vegan)
a l'Orange (Soy/Vegan)
author: Jeff W.

description: Really nice place, also their customer service was so good! Took a cappuccino and a l'orange truffle super tasty.
author: My S.

description:
These truffles are made in a French style, hand rolled, which is why there's variance in size and shape. Each truffle has a thin shell and a smooth, rich texture. Also, you get a free truffle with any purchase!

Outstanding flavors:
1.   earl gray for the strong bergamot flavor
2.   peanut butter for it's fragrant but not too sweet taste

Okay flavors:
1.   strawberry was sweet and artificial like strawberry Pocky
2.   rum raisin - the number of raisins need a'raisin
3.   Casmira's favorite was too sweet. Generally not a fan of white chocolate.

 As you can tell, I prefer chocolates that aren't too sweet.
author: Mimi X.

description:
Never been a great chocolate fan, but these are incredibly well done! The shop is small and he has bowls of truffles spread out behind the glass counter. Don't expect a giant piece of chocolate. You can tell these really are homemade because each truffle is a different shape. A tad pricey for such a small treat, but worth the indulgence at least once.

I'd recommend any of the ones with liqueur. I loved the kaluha, cognac, and ESPECIALLY the amaretto! It really just adds another dimension to the chocolate and the flavors literally melt in your mouth!
author: Sally C.

description: One of my fav places to bring guests. The owner/chocolatier is welcoming. Every truffle is delicious! Hope they'll never close
author: s t.

description: Without any doubt the best chocolate truffles PERIOD. Do yourself a favor and try them when in San Francisco or you can order from their website. You won't regret it. Such a great range of flavors and everything is handmade by Jean-Mark. I bought some for my wife 8 years ago and now every time I go to San Francisco on business I have to stop by and get her more. Of course I get some for me too!
author: Phillip F.

description: Are you in North Beach and looking for an amazing dessert? Take the short walk down Columbus and get yourself some amazing truffles. The best. You will NOT find any better. Can't wait to go again.
author: KJ B.

description: AMAZING! It's hard to find a good chocolatier let alone good truffles. Espresso and dark chocolate is my favorite.
author: Slade S.

description:
Good truffles! Fairly priced. Got the mocha. It was super rich, aside from
Some bitterness to it, I think I would've liked it a lot more. May visit again.
author: Carrie T.

description: This is one of the best hot chocolates I have had in a long time. Not too sweet, not to bitter, just right. The owner made it from scratch and it came with a free truffle!
author: Mia F.

description:
Perfect space to loll away the time, especially on a warm sunny afternoon.

In addition, if you've got to wash away any maddening thoughts of a previously horrid roommate situation, this is also the right spot.  One could never go wrong with truffles.  Apparently one could go wrong with a roomie choice  :p

Before I proceed with lovely thoughts of swirled creamy pieces of chocolate and happy moments poured into a cup, let me build the base of this thesis:

1.  Slammed doors and cabinet doors so that the entire house would vibrate in response.
2.  Had an equally loud gf that would come over only to do her laundry and her insane flip flops and foreign chatter would resonate across the wood floors.
3.  Would use my bathroom even though he had his own and leave his piddly mess around the toilet.
4.  BO smelled so bad, it would reek from across the hallway.

Know who I'm speaking of?  That's right : fat bastard.

So in order to escape with what sort of sanity I had left after being tortured in such a dump (I have a dog so it is very hard to find a place that accepts a medium sized pet) the refuge that would beckon me was XOX Truffles.

I'm a sucker for anything white chocolate, so there is no surprise there in my first selection: smooth, sweet, buttery nothingness that parallels a dip into the very pool set aside by Hades.  If only death were that welcoming, I'd be the first to dive in.  Another special a friend utilized in a supper were the Cayenne Tequila Truffles.....the chocolate souffle was made even more dangerous with the slight shavings of this truffle.  I never knew a piece of chocolate that bit me back.  I spent the rest of the evening patting my blushing lips.  And I'm simple, so ordering an extra box of the caramel were already half gone by the time I was over the GGB.

Unpretentious, fantastic truffles, inexpensive, and kind staff:  what more of a solace could one ask for while escaping the very depths of hell that I had to unfortunately call home?

Be ready to leave with more than 2 pieces.  It is that good!
author: Miika M.

description:
If you're reading this review from home and are considering making a 20 minute+ drive out to XOX truffles for a fancier version of your store stocked Lindts, STOP. Go to the nearest Safeway and get some nice dark baking chocolate, butter, creme de menthe, hazelnut extract, whatever--but yeah, try your hand at making truffles before complaining about the size or appearance of the ones here. Truffles are easy to make with basic ingredients, but XOX offers some truly unique combinations. I won't be making my own earl grey or cognac truffles any time soon, so if I want my chocolates exotic, I'll come here.

The younger man behind the counter (I haven't been enough times to figure out how many employees they have) was very friendly and drizzled some extra chocolate on my coffee drink. I think chocolate addict may somehow be stamped on my head, visible to all purveyors of the stuff. 

Pricey and the store could be expanded given its popularity. I wanted to linger and chat with the employee, but felt a little claustrophobic.
author: Cathy H.

description:
The coffee shop I aspire to have one day.

Family run small coffee shop. Made from the pure labor of love. The owner hand makes the truffles fresh daily.  Free truffle with every  drink? WHAT. Is it my birthday? No lounging. No wi-fi. Ideally you'd pass through North Beach on a sunny day for a caffeine pump and sweets.

The truffles are absolutely decadent. Unusual flavor from liquor fusions, fruit, spicy to earl grey. The flavors really pull through with each bite. Perfect gift for that person you're not sure what to get.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
A trip to San Francisco wouldn't be complete without a truffle and coffee from XOX Truffles.  

We travel to San Fran every three years and make it a point to visit XOX Truffles each morning we are there!  The French owner is so welcoming and generous with providing you with a free truffle with a purchase of a coffee or espresso.  These homemade chocolates melt in your mouth; savor every bite!
author: Patty S.

description: I ate some truffles here and they were out of the world. And that, boys and girls, is all you need to know.
author: May G.

description:
I love this place.  Best chocolate I have ever had.

The chocolate is hard enough that it doesn't disintegrate in your hands, but once you pop it in your mouth, the creamy chocolate in the center just melts in your mouth.  It's ridiculousness.

They have a variety of alcohol-infused chocolates - I tried the cayenne tequila chocolate and it was crazy.  You take it in and the first thing you taste is chocolate.  Then...five seconds later - BAM!  Tequila.  Then fifteen seconds after that, you get a dull cayenne flavor that gradually intensifies.  This is what you experience with the chocolates -  unique chocolates that are multifaceted with distinct flavor.

Chocolates cost 75 cents each, which isn't bad for a high end chocolate.  My friend and I got 20 for $10, which averages out to 50 cents each.  They also give you samples for anything/everything you choose to buy.  You could get a small coffee for $1.50 and that'll come with a sample.   That's a good deal.   

I stuck with sweet chocolates.  If you take a look at my picture (front to back), you'll see caramel, green tea, earl grey, hazelnut, and casimira's favourite (white chocolate + something else).  Caramel is my favorite.  Don't miss this place if you're anywhere near fisherman's wharf, Chinatown, or north beach.

This review is part of my "AWESOME SF DAYTRIP" list.  Check my profile to see my other recommendations.
author: Ken C.

description:
2 years ago and 8 months pregnant, we pulled over and my husband jumped out of the car, returning with a hot chocolate. I took one sip and then rolled down the window as we drove off, yelling NO WAAAAAY!!! They smiled, they knew, they made my world. 

Ok, so now here we are Valentine's day 2012, and living 2 blocks away as of 2 weeks ago. I just sent the husband (he has a name - Scott) off for the same hot chocolate. Will it affect me the same? I guess I'll find out. But I sit here drooling at my desk with anticipation. 

Where the hell is he? I bet he is sitting outside eating truffles and drinking coffee. Ok, well he deserves a little treat on Valentine's Day too right. XOXO
author: Amy E.

description: XOX Truffles are as good as any other truffles that you'd have at another truffle place. Please don't interpret this as an insult, XOX. They are really good.
author: Brad P.

description: This was a welcome stop on a food walking tour.  The chocolatier was charming & informative - the truffles were decadent & delicious.  The proprietor seems to value flavor over appearance (these had an almost home-made look, if you're a *really* good home chocolate maker).  That's fine with me, since I was eating these & not planning to put them on display.  As others have noted, the prices were *very* reasonable. Good thing I live on the other coast, or I'd be here way too often.
author: Donna G.

description:
Great coffee and a free truffle score. 

Spicy cayenne tequila truffle is amazing!!!
author: Talisha M.

description:
This place is really tiny but definitely worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood. What their truffles lack in size, they make up for in flavor. Speaking of flavors, there are a ton of flavors including cognac, earl grey, and French toast! 

Price-wise they aren't too bad though I wouldn't say they're cheap. $12 will get you 20 which fits nicely in their little Chinese take-out boxes. 

What really helped the entire experience was the outstanding service we got when we came in. He was friendly, polite, and ensured that we'll come back again in the future.
author: James D.

description:
Definitely the BEST truffles in SF. I like to buy 20 pcs in different flavors and they give you 1 for sample.  When we eat these little cute guys, every taste is a pleasant adventure. I never went back to Godiva again after I tried XOX Truffles. 

They have paid boxes if you want them as a gift. But I'm sorry to say they don't look half as good as these little guys you'll put inside. So go to other store and buy an elegant box and ribbon, and come back to XOX Truffles to fill the box. It will make a wonderful gift.
author: V L.

description: Dark chocolate with chili powder and tequila. A surprise and a delight. My favorite treat walking down Columbus Street.
author: Sonia S.

description:
Vegan truffles are the bomb. XOX truffles is a delightful little cafe located in a quiet and artistic location. My friends and I were walking towards Little Italy and stumbled across this hidden gem. I decided to take a look inside not because of the truffle but was in need of caffeine. 

Taken away by the choices of truffles, I was awed by knowing there were four different types of vegan truffles. My favourite is the dark chocolate and second would be orange. Though it's soy there is no after taste and definitely melts in your mouth. Obviously, I didn't get any caffeine fix but got a box of truffles for a sweet price. 

Coming to SF without coming here would be a big sin.
author: Denise D.

description:
Some damn good chocolates here. I like just picking a few to nibble on for $.75 each, not bad. Beats any other truffle I've had in the city. I highly recommened the hazelnut and spicy tequila. (not together...that could be awkward)
Bring cash unless you're purchasing a box, minimum charge on card is $8.
author: Claudia F.

description: Decadent, melt-in-your-mouth, truffles that will keep you coming back for more. You can also get real hot chocolate: cream and melted chocolate.
author: Sarah S.

description: Never has let me down. Amazed at how good the truffles were. I always make sure to stop by when I have time. The owner is a very nice gentleman.
author: Rico S.

description:
Stopped by as part of a food tour of North Beach, and was very impressed!  The absolutely charming owner took the time to tell us the history of his shop, as well as give a demonstration of his process and let us pick samples.  He really devoted his time to us while we were there, which I appreciate (even telling a customer that arrived after us that it would be a little while before he could get to him). It's definitely worth the visit if you can make it here.

There are more than 20 truffle flavors to choose from, and they are tidbits that are the perfect size to not overwhelm you with richness.  There are also some vegan options.  A box of 20 (approximately 1/4 lb) is $13 - very reasonable for chocolate of this quality.  They even offer a free truffle if you order coffee :)  If you don't know where to start, I enjoyed the champagne, green tea, and caramel quite a bit.
author: Jennifer J.

description: Zomg, hands down best truffles I've ever had. Every flavor is delicious. The liquor is pretty strong in the honey vodka and chili tequila truffles, but that just adds to their character! I got the 20 for $13 deal but now I wish I bought 100 seeing as how I don't know when I'll be back in SF!
author: Ashley C.

description:
Can't comment on their coffee, but their truffles are bomb. You can't beat $.75 truffles. Or a free truffle with your coffee purchase.

You have about 15 flavors to pick from. They have options for vegans too.
Notable flavors: earl grey, green tea matcha, orange (or whatever they call it.). This list is a work in progress.
author: Paulina D.

description: This place has some of the best chocolate I have ever eaten! Every flavor was awesome! I think my favorites were caramel and earl grey.  The owner is also the coolest guy ever, very nice to customers!  I will definitely come back next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Paul H.

description:
On a pit-stop in our cross-country roadtrip, our good friends in SF took us to Jean-Marc's truffle atelier. 

Jean-Marc is a no nonsense artisan and a real chocolatier artist. Take the time to give him the courtesy and respect his hard work deserves and he will reveal his passion for truffles and fine delicacies. The Grand Marnier, Armagnac, Cognac and Champagne truffles blew any others I've had in the past. The coffee is served as it is in a cafe or brasserie in France and will put hair on your chest if all you know is that piss-poor excuse for coffee Americans enjoy we, in Europe, call dirty sock water. 

He won't kiss your ass or sing a birthday jingle because it's you're special day so keep the sensitivity at the door and prepare for your tastebuds to have their first gastronomic orgasm. 

We had a fabulous time talking with Jean-Marc and were treated to a grandiose degustation. I will order some online soon and plan to visit again when we make it back out to SF. 

Merci mille fois pour ce beau retour aux sources, Jean-Marc!
author: Fab B.

description:
I'm very surprised that this place gets such a fantastic rating.  The truffles are meh at best, and the coffee was absolutely awful.  The fact that our lattes were served in less than 15 seconds was enough to realize that the coffee was not brewed freshly for us, and the taste confirmed it.  Like a stale, old cigarette.  Nasty, nasty.

Buy a candy bar and head to Philz for some real coffee in San Francisco.  So, so disappointed.
author: Julie B.

description: Was there this past December. Loved the place. We were just walking around San Francisco and saw Truffles, had to stop. I am a chocolate truffle lover, I even make them myself. Bought the box of 20 for $13, that way got to try so many different kind. They were all so good. My favorites were the champagne, brandy, dark chocolate, red wine...The guy gave us two for free to try. Go to try a tequila and chili one which was surprisingly good. Also it has really good prices $1 each truffle, where I come from they are $2.50 and not even close to being as good.
author: Lili M.

description: I would always swing by if I am around the neighborhood. Bought a medium box truffles, + coffee. 2 free truffles for the 2 purchases. Stay healthy Jean-Marc, will be swinging by soon.
author: John C.

description:
XOX truffles are well worth their high reputation: silky, flavorful and delicious. The shop is smaller than I expected and really cramped, but that's OK: They can spend more money on ingredients by spending less on rent. 

My only complaint is that, when you purchase an assortment of flavors, they pack all of them together. Since most of their truffles look identical, this makes it impossible to choose what you want to try or to offer a specific flavor to someone. I imagine that they'd be willing to pack them separately if asked, though.
author: Todd H.

description:
I came here to kill two birds with one stone, first, I had bookmarked to check this place out as I am a diehard chocolate fanatic and second, because the gf I was buying SF treats for told me she didn't like pralines which dumped on my "Bear Poop" souvenir from Yosemite.  I came here around the afternoon and my oh my!  so many choices!  

The girl who helped me was really nice and welcoming, she didn't make me feel lame for being so unsure/indecisive with my truffle picking.  I forgot most of the flavors I chose, but the ones I distinctly remember were the earl grey, white chocolate, peanut butter, amaretto, kahlua, mint, matcha/green tea... sorry not too sure about the exact names either.  Even with the 4 stars I have few things to gripe about... when my friend and I opened the package up we had no idea which was what flavor which would have been nice to know as they being all mixed up some of them took on flavors of the other truffles.  Another negative was that I had asked the 20 to be separated into 2 sets of 10 as truffles are so decadent I thought 10 should suffice.. So one for home and one for my friend along with other SF goodies.  Instead of getting the cardboard takeout box for the truffles they were put into the paper bag which allowed them to be smushed on my journey back!  Oh well, maybe that's my bad for not asking for the box anyways..  

Overall the truffles were delicious, definitely meant to savor.  Not the most cheapest things, but it's nice to indulge and treat yourself to a little something extra when the chocolate monster hits rather than going for your run of the mill convenient store chocolates.  AND you get a free sample with your purchase!  Uhhh you had me at FREE!

Be careful to do a quick mirror check on your teeth after eating them especially if you take nibbles off the morsels because I don't know what's worse, spinach in your teeth or brown residue stuck on and in between your teeth making you look like you either snacked on poop or so that your teeth depicts 18th century England's concept of oral hygiene...
author: Priscilla C.

description: wow!  best thing ever.  Found this by accident as I was walking on columbus ave.  You have to try it.  My favorite if the raspberry truffles.  Melt in your mouth goodness.  And the owner is a sweetheart.
author: Princess C.

description: THEE Best vegan chocolate truffles. EVER. 9 flavors!!! NINE!!! Coconut, raspberry, champagne, cognac, dark, l'orange, earl grey, hazelnut, and I forget the last one. Tried raspberry, champagne, and coconut. Each incredible. Wow. Got a $16 box of 20 assorted vegan for my mom for Mother's Day.
author: four f.

description: Great staff. Awesome espresso drinks but that being said, the BEST damned chocolate truffles I've ever had. Try the cognac truffle!
author: Jason P.

description: I absolutely love this place! I discovered it while visiting a client on Columbus and it was my go to spot. Love all of the truffles and the mocha is my favorite. The owner is awesome and the staff are super friendly. :)
author: Michelle B.

description: Their mochas are out-of-this-world!! Bonus: free truffle with the purchase of a coffee. My favorite so far is the hazelnut, though the lavender was a unique runner-up. I'm going to keep coming back until I've tried all the flavors!!!
author: Ashley P.

description: The chocolate bar has been raised.  Raised higher than I ever thought possible.  With my own two eyes I got to see a master chocolatier making hand made truffles. His hands moving a fast as lightening.  I  enjoyed the tequila truffle and the champagne truffle so good and powerful.
author: Lucretiz C.

description: Truffles for .75?! Hell Yeah! There was quite the truffle selection to satisfy everyone's pallet, and staff put the truffles in tiny bags so you can eat them as you go. A great find in North Beach!
author: Lisa H.

description:
I like the orange, coconut, and raspberry ones. I think the flavor is distinct yet complementing the chocolaty taste.

This store really need to expand their space. It's so teeny! Not a good place for sitting down and enjoying your coffee + truffles.
author: Novalina N.

description:
This place makes San Francisco worth visiting. What's better than getting a fresh cup of joe for a cheap price & a free top shelf truffle sample for free? 

Seriously, there truffle chocolates are orgasmic.  Even though there establishment is very small but, there truffles are out of this world. 

Pro(s):
Delicious, cheap, many flavors of truffle, friendly knowledgable staff, great location.

Con:
Beware. LOVE AT FIRST BITE.

On your next trip to SF, don't forget to visit XOX truffle. You won't regret it. CHEERS!
author: Jodi C.

description:
After stopping for hot chocolate,coffee, and free truffles (Score!) on our way to Coit Tower I could only say, "I don't feel well." Were the tiny bites of heaven worth the overindulgence- hell yea! The lady at the counter was friendly and even kindly directed me to a close restroom. 
The tequila truffles packed a little punch and the hot chocolate was made with nice melted chocolate. 
It was a nice little find while wandering the crocked streets.
author: Heather R.

description:
My parents have known Jean-Marc since he was first starting up XOX Truffles over a decade ago. I have fond childhood memories of visiting his quaint little shop in North Beach on summer afternoons to pick up a takeout box of chocolate truffles.

Now that I live in the city, I love to stop by from time to time and buy a few to snack on. They're great with coffee (I usually eat half of them by the time I get back to my apartment).

You can taste the quality in the truffles. Each batch is hand-made, and Jean-Marc takes pride in his wide assortment of flavors. My favorites are the Dark Chocolate, Casimira's Favorite and Black & White.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Not sure why this rated so highly.

OK - The truffles are great. I got the hazelnut one and it was delicious!
The coffee on the other hand was quite average - There are many other amazing places you could go to if you just want a coffee
author: Sid R.

description:
XOX Truffles is funky and unassuming, and you could walk by a zillion times thinking it's just one more North Beach cafe. But my friends.....that would be a mistake. 

The handcrafted truffles are the size truffles were meant to be-small, two bites maybe, with a wonderful array of flavors-Earl Grey and caramel are among my favorites. 

Gift boxes are remarkably reasonable-you can get 20 pieces for $10, packaged in a cute little chinese take out box. It looks pretty swell in one of their great bags. Their gift boxes get fancier the more you buy.

USEFUL: Here's a great $30/$40 gift idea for the woman who has everything:
A $10/$20 box of truffles from XOX and a gift certificate for a $20 mani/pedi at Hand Touch Nail Salon on Chestnut. Sorry I didn't post this before Valentine's Day for you budget lotharios. You're welcome!
author: Gwynnie P.

description: The owner is so sweet and the truffles are delicious. My favorites were the dark chocolate, hazelnut, and coffee.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: I'm from my Portland where Moonstruck chocolate is made. I thought those were good. These are phenomenal.
author: Simon T.

description: Excellent truffles, including unique flavors such as many types of alcohol.
author: Niniane W.

description:
The latte was decent.
But the free truffle I got with it was delish!
They are homemade-like, which makes this little joint all the more cuter. 
Definitely worth stopping by when you're out and about and want a break from walking ;)
author: Allie E.

description:
I was in North Beach this morning and stopped in at this little place. The coffee is outstanding and to get a free chocolate truffle along with your cup of coffee, what could be more wonderful! 

This little cafe is an authentic chocolate truffle place. The owner is French and make his truffles fresh every day. In fact when I walked in the door, he was making a fresh batch. 

So, all you chocolate lovers, next time you are in North Beach, stop by XOX. Major credit/debit cards are accepted. There is street parking right out front. 

But this is North Beach so it is best to take transit and walk. North Beach is very easy to walk through. Also, North Beach is great for bicycling. 

And, what is a better energy boost after a ride on the bike than a bit of chocolate. So stop by XOX.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Delicious!

Chef Jean Marc's French chocolate truffles made with whole cream and lots of butter rolled in dark chocolate powder, are superb (like no other I've ever eaten). Several food magazines have ranked these truffles in the top 10 in the US and it's obvious why. Handmade and fresh! An organic coffee includes a free truffle and is one of the best bargins in North Beach at $1.50. (Columbus near Filbert)
author: Desiree P.

description:
Great stuff
I got my mom a box of truffles for Valentines Day
I tried a few a they were something special to say the least 
A great treat for any occasion
author: Max P.

description:
Went here for the truffles and bought a box with the 20 flavors for 12.99. Honestly I felt that the price was high for the tiny pieces that were pre packaged in the smallest sized chinese take out boxes. They are obviously hand made because of their irregular sizes, some larger and some smaller. 
    Unlike other reviewers I love that they are all in the same box because I'm a fan of guess the chocolate flavor. It's fun.

 Most of the flavors were awesome I particularly liked the raspberry, coconut, espresso, peanut butter flavors. The little truffles were covered in cocoa powder and they had a nice snap from the chocolate shell underneath. 

 Not fond of the lemon ginger or spicy tequila. I think the least favorite was the earl grey  ( that's the only thing I can think it was,  it had a more herbal taste) If it wasn't earl grey it had to be cardamom or something like a spice and was not feeling it at all. 


I would love to get a larger container next time and i think i'll hand pick the flavors this time since I know what I did like. Altogether it was a fun game and a sweet treat.
author: Lyna K.

description: After reading reviews, I decided to bring a visiting friend here. I thought maybe it would be a bigger production. But it's one guy behind a counter rolling truffles in cocoa powder while you decide. Hint: free truffle with a purchase of coffee or box of truffles. They only take cash unless it's over $7 (I think that was the limit).
author: Katie L.

description: A must-stop in San Fran! Amazing truffles. Great customer service. They have a variety of soy truffles too and they are delicious!!
author: Monica H.

description: This is a must stop for truffle lovers. Every truffle is to die for. My favorites are the orange, raspberry,  hazelnut, cognac, and cocunut.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Truffles: Earl Grey, Hazelnut were the best. We got an assortment of flavors, but those were the best! All placed into one box, it was very difficult to tell what was what. Did not like that.

Overall experience: We came during the workers lunch break. He left a note saying he would be back at 2:25. He seemed to be done w his lunch but sat inside near the door. There were about 6 of us waiting for 10mins. IMO, i would have cut my break short to serve customers. Why take the chance of letting customers walk away?!?! I was not a fan of that. However, he did make it up by giving us one free truffle each.
author: Renee L.

description: YUM YUM YUM. Champagne truffles, tequila truffles, wine truffles, yes yes yes! I love this place. Went here on a food tour and really liked it, just took my family here and they were all happy as well. The truffles chef? is very friendly too.
author: Dominique Y.

description: Amazing!  The only word that can remotly describe this place.  I am not a big sweets fan but I cant even describe how good they are here. We were at lunch across the street for lunch 3 years ago and we just stopped in to see what they had.  We have been hooked ever since.  Whenever we are in the city we have to come here.  I have never tried anything bad and the service has always been great.  I love how it is small and quiet and the little tables and chairs out front are great to just sit down eat truffles and drink some coffee.
author: Chelsea E.

description:
Truffles are as tiny as the store. These petite, lumpy little morsels look as homemade as they are. Not overly dusted, nice creamy texture. The amaretto, champagne and honey vodka are quite satisfactory. I bought a "box" of 20 but since they throw them in the tiny chinese take out box together, I forgot the other flavors I ordered by the time I got home. 

The cafe isn't a place to linger long; there's no restroom and just a sliver of a bar to sit at inside. The ceiling high storage boxes with things spilling out in front to the truffle display case make me feel like sanitation is a bit questionable.  

If you want a free truffle with your coffee, tea or hot chocolate, this is your place. I wouldn't go out of my way for it though.
author: Kim K.

description: Holy chocolate. These truffles are spectacular! Fresh and delicious - try the cognac and red wine. Nomnom
author: Liz O.

description:
I got one work for this place. Amazing. Not only do they have the most delicious truffles, their flavor combinations are adventurous and awaken your taste buds and senses. 

It is clear that Jean-Marc (the owner) is not only passionate about his product but understand the importance of consistency and creativity.  I am so glad that they took a something unfortunate and made it a delicious positive. These really are the best truffles you can get. Besides where else can you try 20 truffles of this quality and combinations for just $13!
author: Bushra S.

description: Oh dudes and dudettes - this place is unreal.  Little confections perfectly flavored and served in a little chinese take out box.  Or, you get a free single truffle with a cup of coffee - which is a perfect pairing of caffeine and sugar.
author: David S.

description: Made a quick stop here to grab some coffee. The owner was super nice and had a huge smile on his face. I noticed that with the purchase of any coffee you get a free truffle which is what this place is known for. Glad I stopped at the right place. The truffle I got was amazing! I can't remember the name of it but I am certain it was coffee flavored.I definitely recommend trying the truffles here. Your sweet tooth will thank you.
author: Nadira R.

description:
Is it possible to give a chocolate place less than 4 stars? It's kind of like rating donuts, so long as they're appropriately fried I'm not going to whine (that much). 

Their truffles were rich and delicious and I'm still enjoying them. I bought a box of 20 for $9 which seems a bargain to me (compared to the fancy pants shops in the Marina or Union Square). 

The downside (or maybe upside) is you don't get any chocolate snobbery. The staff are just regular coffee shop folks, they didn't wax poetic about the cacao content or anything like that. Okay by me if their truffles are cheap and delicious which appears to be the case.

Word.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
It just doesn't get any better.  Nothing more I can say that hasn't already been said about this wonderful little slice of chocolate heaven. 

I miss them now that I don't live near the City, but, thankfully, they deliver!  I was reminded just how delicious they are when my birthday rolled around and the FedEx man brought me a much-appreciated present of 80 assorted truffles.  It's almost worth it to get another year older.
author: Mark B.

description:
woah the truffles!!! yummmyyyy

I tried their amaretto, Peanut Butter, Hazelnut, Dark chocolate, and french roast... WOAH all i can say is woah! the good kind

So i tried the peanut butter first and my first reaction was ...oh i thought it was going to be a fuller taste, but as i continued to eat/chew and pinpoint flavors (and drink my cappucino, which btw, it was good but the foam was a huge dissapointment) it grew on me. I am glad it wasn't over powering and i feel it paired well with their coffee/espresso drinks. very light pb taste and the chocolate (mind you dark chocolate) added a fuller and a little bitter taste to it. mmm good job!

The amaretto was very memorable, as my sister puts it "it kept changing flavors".. yeah not really sis, but it was a full amaretto flavor which didn't over power the truffle. 

to be honest everything was well thought out and not overpowering the truffle, very beautiful compliments to each other and a coffee if you had one. 

Coffee wasn't the best but they don't boast their coffee, they boast their truffles and it sure met the hype.
author: Barnabas L.

description:
A perfect touristy afternoon:

Buy a bunch of XOX truffles and hike up to Coit Tower. Eat truffles on the way up, when you get to the top and on the way back down.
author: Miriam W.

description:
While I'm waiting for my sandwich being made next door, I ran into a big sign on the sidewalk and on that sign it said, "Free Truffle with a purchase small or large coffee!"
I usually get an afternoon boost, and why not check it out.

I bought a small 12 oz cup of coffee for $1.50. In addition, they gave me a choice of truffles to choose from. I asked for the popular one, which is the Caramel-flavored truffle.

As soon I got my treat, I popped the caramel truffle straight into my mouth and washed it down with my lukewarm cup of coffee before I even pay the friendly lady. It was a horrendous sight, but a tasty one. I was thinking about asking for another truffle, but my fear is that they'll deny my request.
author: Matt G.

description:
Stopped in here during a food walking tour we took through Little Italy while my visit in San Francisco.  The owner took the time to explain his method for making chocolate truffles and gave us samples of many varieties.   

He also took the time to make up a batch while we waited and gave us many samples.  I recommend if you have a sweet tooth to come on in and have a taste.  Like I said we were on a food tour so not sure what they offer for the individual that just walks in.
author: Robert A.

description:
Quite the hit with out of town visitors, the one free truffle with coffee draws you in and you leave with a couple dozen.  The are tinier morsels compared to drugstore mass made truffles, more artisan-like differently shaped pieces of slowly melt on your tongue flavor.  

It's not quite visible from nearby Washington Park but is just past the stoplight on Columbus, worth the extra few steps.

Two recommendations: go for the Cognac flavor and it doesn't necessarily open right at 9am.  The Earl Grey and red wine were also pretty good.
author: Taylor O.

description:
As simple as truffles are to make according to a certain someone, she refuses to make any. Must not be that easy to make then huh?????????? or is someone just THAT lazy? =p 

I swear the truffles in their display look like something you would see in a delicatessen browsing the salad or side orders. Anyway, I tried the peanut butter and the hazelnut truffles. Both were good, but the peanut butter truffle didn't quite have any real distinguishable peanut butter flavor. The hazelnut on the other hand was quite good and had some sort of toffee ish type coating around it. This made for a nice texture to go along with the rich hazelnut truffle. I definitely have to come back and try some other flavors on a different day.  *hint hint wink wink* You can get a free truffle with the purchase of a coffee. Make sure you get your truffle you coffee drinkers you.
author: Steven T.

description: I've been enjoying Chef Jean-Marc's creations on occasion for almost 15 years now. They are _always_ worth the effort to seek out. I won't say that they're picture perfect pretty, but they taste so amazingly exquisite that you will not mind a bit.
author: Norman G.

description:
I walked in the rain, eventually caught a nasty cold, went up-hill and through Chinatown all for XOX Truffles on V-day. I lovvvved the truffles. We grabbed the vegan truffles from the Frenchie chef who was preparing them in in bowl in this tiny place. I got a small Chinese take-out box of 11 vegan truffles assorted: hazelnut, regular and French vanilla (I think). The hazelnut blew me away and I could have scarfed them all down. 

We also grabbed a cafe mocha that was made with the same chocolate as the truffles...so it was pretty awesome too.
author: Rachel M.

description: No guilt here! Since chocolate is medically beneficial when it includes the right amount of cocoa, and these wonderfully crafted treats bring great variety and lots of cocoa you are all set! Of course, the warning on the label is that they can become highly addictive. But totally worth it. Merci to XOX Truffles!
author: Sile O.

description: My parents live in SF and this is one of my first stops when visiting. A delicious coffee and free truffle, sitting outside in a perfect day in North Beach and people watching. Can't beat it. Not to mention the absolute best truffles I've ever had. You can bring some home as a great gift.
author: Erik J.

description:
I LOVE XOX Truffles! My bf surprised me with a little box of these truffles on Valentine's morning and scored major points! I was very generous in sharing them with him too and all of the flavors were amazing!

We went back to take his parents to XOX Truffles and they gave us each a truffle to sample when we purchased a box. It's hard to pick which truffles you want because they all sound (and are) so incredible! You can also get a free truffle with a cup of coffee and their coffee is pretty good too!

This place is pretty small and easy to miss when you're walking by but is definitely not to be missed! Check it out! Maybe a very special Halloween treat for your loved one? XOX!
author: Meghan P.

description:
XOX Truffles is my favorite place for the best chocolate EVER!!  

I am a huge chocolate lover and stopped here on a whim six years ago, and nothing can beat what he does with chocolate.  I love that there is no wax so these little nuggets just melt in your mouth.  I honestly can't say which flavor is my favorite but try the Spicy Tequila Cayenne....slowly....for a real treat!  The caramel truffle tastes like pure butter rich caramel, the French Roast and hazelnut are rolled in sumptuous crunches....sigh, earl grey and a vegan truffle that tastes like utter heaven?

Seriously, if you haven't been XOX is definitely a must to your list.  Anytime I have a friend traveling to San Fran I place an order :-)
author: Lori S.

description: Yes.  You must go.  Buy your holiday, birthday and all presents here.  Forever.  Your will keep your friends happy and make new ones.  Funky truffles (chillis, pepper, jasmine), yummy truffles (dark chocolate) and ones that should never be made - you know who I'm talking to you 'white chocolate' people.  That's an oxymoron so move along.  Go.  Enjoy.  You can't overindulge, because frankly you can't afford it but it will be fun to try.
author: BethAnn S.

description:
I usually avoid places which open up with much fanfare and hype like this place did in 1998-99.  I'd rather not get addicted to a place only to see it close.

Fast forward 12 years later and I finally tried XOX truffles.  So many Yelpers have sung their praises so I'm not going to harp on.  

Besides waiting a dozen years, my other mistake was to only get 2 truffles to go -- the hazelnut (noissette) and coffee crunch (coffee roast).  These truffles are not gigantic bon bons, but like small kisses, only very rich and flavorful.  Now I know why a Yelper advised on getting a box of 20 -- that's what I'll do next time.
author: Bodhi D.

description:
Owner / chef is as welcoming as sandpaper nipple tassels.

Don't expect a smile, hey there, or thanks for your business.  (Although luckily, his employees are much nicer.)

And forget about perks.  I bought several chocolates once, before requesting a hot water refill on my tea.  "Three dollars," said Mr. Sunshine.  "Might as well buy more tea.  Will cost you the same as water."  

Tap water doesn't cost three bucks, but attitude DOES cost you customers.  

If your teeth are cravin' sweets, head to Victoria Pastry, Just a Bite, Columbus Cafe, or Boulange, instead.
author: Elle T.

description:
Having read all of the great YELP reviews I had to drop by the store and try the truffles.  I purchased a twenty piece assortment for myself and several gift assortments for my siblings to try out.

Many of the truffles look alike with the dusting of cocoa powder on top.  The smaller size of each piece is appreciated, and I tried to limit myself to one piece per day.  These candies are very good, and most of the varieties that contain alcohol are like little chocolate explosions of flavor.  I try not to eat a lot of chocolates, but it's nice to know that XOX is there when I decide I want to indulge in something rich.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Dee-Lish-Us.

Simply magnificent truffles. Chocolate-y goodness, I tells ya!

I like that they make Earl Grey truffles here. Chocolate and tea? I must have traveled through some bizarre worm hole to land in the Wesiverse where all things are possible.

Prices are good for what you get. If you like chocolate you will not be disappointed.

Warning: If you are at all weight/health conscious this place will be seriously bad, but lucky you, living in San Francisco, have many hills to climb to and from this fantastic little shop. Burn those calories, baby.
author: Wes T.

description:
Wow!! My awesome coworker lives near this place and she got me a 20piece take out box of every nonalcoholic flavor except the orange and she got me 2 of the kahlua.

I was originally planning on freezing these and eating a few at a time but I FREAKIN INHALED THE ENTIRE BOX within 20 min. I only have the chocomod truffles to compare these two but they are SOOOO much better tasting than those. They just melt in your mouth. There was one I didn't like. I think it might have been either the lemon/ginger or the Earl Grey. It reminded me of potpourri. Try each flavor!!

My fave was def Casimira's favourite.
author: Em F.

description:
Great truffles (honey vodka), average coffee.

sidenote: when I asked the barista where their coffee is from, she pointed at the coffee machine...um..didn't know coffee machines made beans these days? kind of a buzzkill for a place that has a sign that reads their coffee beans are fair trade. 

alsoo not much room to sit and enjoy the coffee & truffles inside, fyi!
author: Ami Y.

description: Chocolatey goodness crafted by hand in house...  Nice to have a place that actually makes a chocolate not just sells it.  Great prices for the quality you receive.
author: J B.

description:
Am I allowed to take off a star for aesthetics? It's not that hard to make pretty truffles. I realize that truffles are supposed to look like their fungal cousins, but the shape of these are extremely irregular and kind of look like that the one making them doesn't take pride in his work. Plus, if the chocolates aren't distinguishable in any way, once you buy more than one variety, you have no idea what you're eating until you put it in your mouth. Which isn't altogether a bad thing, (even though I'm the type of person that wants to save my favorites for last) because this kind of makes it exciting.

The flavors, for the most part, are fantastic - distinct, yet blended well with the flavor of the chocolate. And if you let them come to cool room temperature as chocolate should be eaten, the texture is phenomenal and the flavors are divine.

The service is excellent as well. The shop is tiny but usable as long as there's no more than 3 customers in the building at one time. Plus, I highly approve of the policy of giving a free truffle away with every cup of coffee and bulk purchase. Completely destroys any possible pretentiousness.
author: Amanda S.

description: A year ago when i visited XOX Truffles on the North Beach Food Tour i loved it.  However this year when i wasn't on the tour and i just went in, i wasn't as impressed.  They only had one staff member working, so she was busy giving the tour group info on the shop.  There was no one to serve customers that weren't on the tour.  The truffles we ordered were great, my only suggestion would be to have someone else working when they have visiting tour groups.
author: Amy D.

description:
Using CacaoBarry to make their truffles and then placing them in a very cold fridge, these are interesting truffles. There are accolades all over the shop about the owner and when I was in there one of the staff was talking about how she was training to make the truffles.
Interesting and really nice but I'm not sure that I was as thrilled by these truffles as others I have had.
author: deCabbit

description:
Great Truffles! Haven't been inside for Ages. I was going to get Tea there but didn't like there selection (Stash). Oh well, maybe a double Espresso. I used to drink black with whip cream. Nah... Don't want to be wired up anymore. I stuck with a CAP and got a free truffle (One free truffle for each Coffee Purchase).  
I picked the Vin Rouge(Red Vin) Truffle. Very Good.
They also have interesting liqueur inspired truffles. Like Amaretto, Kahlua, and Cognac(Chocolatier, Owner, Jean Marc) fav. I will try the Chili Tequila Truffle next time.
author: Toeknee T.

description: Order a coffee and get a free truffle. They're so good you're guaranteed to buy more! I bought the sampler for my boyfriend as a gift from San Fran. He loved it.
author: Rebecca R.

description:
This place is a chocoholic's haven! Their chocolate truffles are the best! XOX Truffles has a lot of flavors to choose from the they are all incredibly delicious. Everything is homemade and the products come in the most beautiful packaging. I have personally bought this as a gift on more than one occasion and I have been complimented each time.
My personal favorites are the Hazelnut-Coated Truffles and the Dark Soy Chocolates. Take my word for it - they have 11 liquored and 15 non-liquored flavors and they have been considered by  Chocolatier Magazine as one of the top Chocolatiers in the US. And at $0.75 a piece they are worth every cent!
author: Eileen S.

description:
All of the truffles I've had here are excellent. Real, original-style truffles. I brought some to my friend Anne, who studied at the Sorbonne and lived in Paris for 8 years, and her first words were "Wow! They look like real truffles from France! Where did you get these?!"

They are wonderful.

And, they have soy-based truffles, which is UNHEARD of since cream is the base for a ganache. Because of the soy, my lactose-intolerant (with Celiac) boyfriend can actually eat chocolate!

Ah, heaven. XOX, indeed.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Long story short: Pretty small, mom and pop kind of place but with interesting truffle flavors.  Good price point.

Long story long:

I just realized this is the third place in a row that I came to get something sweet on my SF crawl.  No matter, it's worth it!

As I was walking down Columbus Ave, I actually almost walked right by this place in an attempt to look for the address.  Actually wait no, it was because I had my map of places plotted out, but I had forgotten to print out a corresponding list.  So basically I was essentially walking to these places blindly, not knowing 100% what they were.  Well, there were a few places where I knew what it was, but others, not so sure.  This happened to be one of them.  I happened to walk by the window, realizing what it was and remembering it was on my list, so I walked in.

The place looked like it could have been a deli.  I mean, I don't know what I mean by that.  I mean, the place looked a little dingy and run down, but hey, that adds character, right?  Within a few seconds, a lady came out from the back.  She had an accent.  I couldn't really tell if it was Russian, Armenian, or of the sort.  No, I'm not being racist.  I'm thinking maybe it was Russian because this store is in relative proximity to Russian Hill.  Now, maybe I'm just assuming that it's a Russian neighborhood because it has "Russian" in the name.  Well come on.... do you expect to go to Chinatown and run into a bunch of Polish people?  No, I'm not being racist... just a comedian.

Anywho, the truffles had a more rustic look to them and looked like rugged rocks instead of perfect spheres as we're accustomed to in most places.  The flavors were kind of cool too.  Cognac?  Spicy Cayenne Tequila?  Triple Sec?  Lemon Ginger? French Roast?  a l'orange?

I got 2 of the cognac and 2 of the noisette (hazelnut).  Came out to a whopping $2 and something.... yeah... expensive *sarcasm*

Both were really good.  The flavor was prominent, but it wasn't overpowering.  I really like both and a small part of me wish I could of had more, but I was saving my appetite for Gary Danko.

I mean... it's chocolate... how can you go wrong?
author: Austin S.

description:
Visited in early June, 2012. Chocolate & coffee! Yum! 
Charming, authentic decor, the espesso & truffles are heaven on earth!
author: Susan L.

description:
This place rocks! 

I discovered this place while doing a North Beach food tour. 
The truffles looks homemade, but trust me, it is very good. 

I have taken lessons in making truffles before, and I rather have homemade looking truffles than perfect/industrial looking truffles (especially knowing some industrial-made truffles have wax and other stuff in them  to make them look perfect look DX).

Truffles here are bite size, which is great so you can eat it in one bite and not worry about pieces falling off onto the ground/or table. The truffle melts in your mouth soon as you eat it. The texture is creamy and there is a scent that lingers in your mouth afterward, a good, sophisticated chocolate scent. 

My favorite truffle from here is the Hazelnut truffle, must try it!
author: Annie T.

description:
Uh... Free handmade truffle with a purchase of  any coffee by a French man? DEAL! A deal like this sounds pretty sweet already given that one truffle here is typically $0.75 for one but it doesn't hurt that these truffles are fantastic! They come in variation of  alcoholic (YES! *woohoo and does happy dance*) and non-alcoholic. There's even a vegan option for you vegan folks.
