Your best bet is to get a Chinese box (yes they come in Chinese boxes) of 20 for $10. And you can hand pick which ones you want. They also package and ship them if you you're not in the bay. 

My favorite is the cognac and the spicy tequila. There's a distinctive kick when you have the spicy tequila. Considering the fact that I'm not a cognac drinker, I initially thought it wouldn't be my type of truffle but the cognac is a perfect marriage with the chocolate. The cognac actually makes the truffle better, not overpowering at all!  These truffles are so damn good, I get extra kisses from the bf if I take one right before he lands a pecker on me. Oysters, you're getting some competition as my favorite aphrodisiac.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I purchased truffles from here as gifts to co-workers over the past holiday season, and they were a huge hit.  I happened to be in the area again and remembered how much my friend loved them, saying that they tasted expensive, and even reused the packaging afterward to gift another present.  Being the kind, generous soul that I am, I decided to get another box for him.  

I couldn't leave myself out, so I sprung for a box of 20 of their finest vegan truffles.  Not only did they have the usual hazelnut and orange, they had several other new flavors, like earl gray, cognac, and coconut.  The truffles are so small and tasty, it's gone before you know it.  But it's nice to treat yourself (and others) once in awhile.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
OMG! This place has the best truffles I have ever tried in my life! 
YOU MUST STOP BY AND TRY! I purchased (the white box) box of 20? I forgot how much count there was in the box but I must say it WASNT enough for me (and I normally do not eat chocolote on a regular basis). They were so YUMMY!

-vodka truffles; my favorite!
-honey truffles; were good
- earl grey truffles; were ok (for me) it too bitter for my taste
-raspberry  truffles; were a delite! 
-hazelnut tuffles; were great!
author: Kathy N.

description:
OMG these are so amazing! The variety of flavors is great. My favorite is the black and white but get there early because the run out often. I love how it's a small place with the chef working right in front of you. They are not cheap but 1 or 2 is plenty. I love their little patio area and they even give a free truffle when you buy a coffee. 
Skip Ghirardelli, come here!
author: Melissa C.

description: After lunch, my friend and I wanted to get some coffee and we happened to walk by this hole in the wall.  The man working inside was super friendly and we walked in and I got a small coffee and my friend got a cappacino.  When you get coffee here, they give you a free truffle.  We both wanted to try the coconut truffle and it was dreamy, smooth and totally delicious.  This place is truly wonderful.
author: Amy L.

description:
For $20 you get a Chinese takeout container filled with 40 truffles. I bought myself 5 of these containers... One was to eat while in San Fran and the other 4 boxes were coming back to NY with me. Since I have self control there was no reason to think that I would have to return to XOX and buy more truffles. My sister on the other hand lacks self control... She rarely eats chocolate and told me not to buy a box for her. She said that she would "try one" of my truffles.  

So the morning after we visited XOX I went for a run. I came back to our hotel room a little over an hour later to see an empty container of truffles on my sisters' bed. I guess by "try one" she meant I'm going to eat 40 of your truffles for breakfast. We had to go back to XOX to replace the box my sister ate. We also had to replace the box of truffles that was supposed to last me 4 days in San Fran. This chocoholic devoured that box in 2 days.
author: Chrissy D.

description:
We chanced upon this place after rolling down from Coit Tower. The shop has a rather awkward floor plan but nothing lacking in what they offer. 

And we did. We limit ourselves to  4 truffles: Mango, Orange, Earl Grey, Hazelnut. 

That was it. My wife wanted more but I had to pull her away. It's not the price. It's the principle that "Good stuff should be consumed in petite portions". This will make us yearn for more next time. 

We left. But of course we know that they do mail orders too! lol!
author: Vince W.

description: Recently did a sidewalk walking tour of North Beach. Of all the places we stopped to taste food, this was the best! The proprietor gave a us of history and lesson in how truffles are made at XoX, but the free samples were the best!! Highly recommended so good and friendly.
author: Dane R.

description: One of the few places I would stop in for some sweets in the city. It's a pleasure to pick out some nice truffles in a variety of flavors from XOX and take them home to enjoy. Grab a sandwich from the nice lady next door and grab a truffle or two with a cup of coffee here after.
author: Brad C.

description: In 5min, I got my iced coffee, free truffle, and change for parking.  They're awesome.
author: Bertilla M.

description:
Spicy Tequila
Red Wine
Coconut

Very Small - not filled truffles, but flavored chocolate chunks.
Creamy texture, excellent flavor.
Coffee was good, too (not anything special, but good)
author: Phil W.

description: Be warned - you cannot stop after one. There are so many great flavors, I can't wait to go back and try some more. The coconut was addictive and the spicy tequila cayenne was unusually delicious too. It was deliciously difficult to choose. Can't wait to go back.
author: Carolyn S.

description:
Stumbled upon this place while walking towards a hotel to meet some friends from New Jersey!

I tried the dark chocolate, caramel and hazelnut truffles! My favorite was the dark chocolate! Yum so rich, creamy and delicious!! 

My friend ordered a shot of macchiato, it comes with a free piece! YesHH!!

Prices are super duper reasonable, $0.75 for a truffle, $1.50-$3.00 for coffee! The Italian cashier was super friendly too!
author: Leeseuh K.

description:
My little sister came to visit me in San Francisco and we were on our way to Mamas for breakfast (YUMMM)!  I walked past the store and was hit by the smell of chocolates and coffee - perfect combo.  My uncle is a HUGE (and picky) fan of chocolate and I decided that since I was going home to LA that weekend, I would pick up a box as a present.  Let's just say, he loved them.  

I had previously visited Belgium and brought a box of chocolates back for him and even he admitted that these were more delicious!  That's pretty hard to top.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I want to find the end of the conveyor belt that makes these and just open my mouth Homer Simpson style. A fun stop to a day out in the city...the 20 piece is tempting at 50 cent a piece but I've learned my lesson from shopping at Costco so I only got four at 75 cents a piece. 
Good thing this place was not on my walk from school when I was a kid!
author: Allen Y.

description:
Melt-in-your mouth flavor asplosion.  

Extraordinary service, the owner-man was incredibly patient with me and answered all my nubcake questions with a smile on his face.  I didn't feel pressured (like how I do at higher end chocolate boutiques) at all!

I especially liked the Cayenne Tequila and Hazelnut.  Mmm.

Yes, these truffles are a bit smaller than your mass-produced Godiva truffles, but pop one of these in your mouth and you'll feel all the artisanal love Jean-Marc put into crafting each and every one of these babies.  And yes, I did say "POP them in your mouth."  Besides, with the ongoing diabetes/obesity epidemic, America can use smaller portion sizes.

PRO-TIP: Don't be an overexcited noob and INHALE the cocoa powder, much verbal abuse and subsequent embarrassment will occur.  

Whatchu lookin' at, I'm a pro now.
author: Chase C.

description:
Updated 6/30/07:
I went here cuz I used to love their caramel truffle.  This time I got a latte and it's $2 for a 12 oz cup.  It's pretty good if you like latte w/ thick foam on top.  You get a FREE truffle w/ drink purchase so I picked caramel.  It tasted cold & not fresh.  Well, I complain to the owner and he said you have to eat it at room temperate and he keeps the caramel in the refrig. during the warm months.  A$$hole should have told me it was refrig. so I didn't pop it into my mouth as soon as I got it.  What a d--k.  

A regular came in and asked to try the sugarfree truffle.  She didn't have to pay the full price of .75c, probably something less, cuz he knows her I guess.  Jerk.

Credit card with minimum of $8.
--------------

i've tried most of the flavors.  My favorite is Caramel.  Wish they had a store in Fremont.
author: Ann L.

description:
I have never considered myself a chocolate lover. Not to say I didn't eat it it's just not my first choice in desserts, BUT.... this weekend I went to XOX Truffles. They were to die for and I can't wait to go back and try more flavors. If you are a chocolate lover you can't walk by this place without at least purchasing one to give them a try. And believe me once you have one you will buy more. They are little bites of heaven dusted in coco powder, handmade with love in a tiny shop. They are a bit pricey but this treat is totally worth it.  

Remember Valentines day is around the corner and these would make a great gift. I tried the Amaretto flavor but they come in a variety of flavors, even vegan. Don't walk past XOX one more time before you stop in and give them a try.
author: Dianne M.

description:
Delicious.  They have a variety of truffles for 75 cents a piece.  That sounds a little expensive, and I suppose it is, but it's worth it.  If you buy a box of 20 truffles (or more), the per-truffle price goes down.

Anyway, enough about cost.  The truffles themselves are amazing.  They have several vegan/soy options, and, while I'm not vegan (or even vegetarian), I found them to be quite tasty.  I tried the vegan dark chocolate and vegan hazelnut, as well as the caramel, earl grey, peanut butter, and mango.  And that's really only a few of their many flavors.  Looking forward to going back the next time I'm in North Beach.
author: Brian T.

description:
A friend of mine introduced me to this place a couple months back and I've been meaning to write a review for awhile now.  Anyway, I highly recommend trying the Cognac and Honey Vodka flavored truffles.  They taste like a leprechaun sliding down a rainbow on a rainy day.

In other words, this is the only good thing Paul Joseph McGuire ever did for me.
author: Ray-Ray B.

description: I'm not a huge fan of chocolate or sweets overall.  But the truffles here are amazing!.  You can taste the quality of the chocolate and I like the fact that they are not tooo sweet.  The truffles are small which is perfect for me since I only enjoy a couple of sweet bites after having food.  The variety of recipes they have are original and Highly recommended this place.
author: Manny R.

description: I credit XOX Truffles for helping me land the perfect girl! I stopped by XOX on my way to a 1st date.  The proprietor/chocolatier recommended a variety of truffles, including raspberry and red wine.  The truffles were a SMASH hit with the lady, and really helped to make for a fun and memorable night.  I have since returned to XOX for special occasions, including birthdays and anniversaries and I am always impressed by the high quality of their product and excellent service.  Recently, I proposed to my girlfriend by putting the ring in an empty XOX truffle box.  She said YES!  The moral of the story is...go to XOX truffles and your dreams will come true!
author: Wite M.

description:
Great place. Wonderful selection that changes. Nice, friendly service. A great chocolate shop.

(wish the businesses next to this great shop were cleaner and nicer - if the whole block was as clean and friendly as this shop -- it would be great. Too many homeless people lingering around).
author: John G.

description:
I didn't expect to walk up to a quaint delightful store and be greeted by the actual chef! He was preparing another delicious looking batch of white chocolate coated truffles. 

The prices are amazing. A 1/4 lb, 20 truffles, box is $10 and we got a free truffle. And we got another free truffle with the purchase of our coffee. 

I tried the Cognac, the chef's favorite, and the Honey Vodka. Both were exquisite, melt in your mouth, sensual, bite sized pieces of deliciousness. *drool* This place definitely deserves all the accolades.
author: Linda S.

description:
This place is amazing.  We accidentally stumbled upon it while walking along Columbus. 

Most "premium" chocolatiers are really expensive and consequently look very boutique. XOX Truffles, despite having mentions in the USA Today and the NYT, and being rated in the top ten of several chocolatier lists, doesn't.  Instead, it looks like a French gypsy coffee shop, and the prices are astoundingly affordable for the amazing quality and pure flavor that they serve. For only 10 dollars, we got a box of 20 truffles with one of each dark chocolate flavor. On my own I also had the Earl Grey soy vegan truffles, and IMHO they were to die for.
author: Monica W.

description:
Fresh made truffles in the heart of San Francisco, I love this stuff!

I was taking a tour so we all got free samples, and I couldn't stop eating it. This is nothing like the stuff you buy in the supermarket or candy store, it is so much better!

If you live or plan to be in San Francisco, don't miss the truffles here.
author: Mu-Chium H.

description: Yes! Excellent truffles, cognac, champagne, wine, caramel delicious.
author: C S.

description: We were looking to buy chocolate as gift and our friend recommended XOX Truffles. This place is really "hole in the wall" where you will not notice it and find it without GPS navigation. They provide free samples with coffee or when you buy a box set. They have nice packaging if you buying as a gift and accommodate customer request to remove chocolate with "liquor" in a box set. The line can be long and service was slow when we there because customer asking questions and trying out samples. Overall, the truffles is value for money, a little on the sweeter side (I am not an expert) and parking can be challenging.
author: Sam M.

description:
JUST SO AMAZING!! 

Ok first moment you walk in there, the place smells like chocolate and coffee combined. I ordered a Cappuccino which was so cheap and so good..$3!!! Plus you get a FREE TRUFFLE OF YOUR CHOICE. I love this place!
author: Lyn U.

description:
XOX Truffles, how I love you! Jean Marc, you are a gem!

I love XOX and for our wedding we decided to use the perfect sweet as a favor treat...XOX Truffles! Many of our guests LOVED the truffles! They contacted us via email, FB, or in person to let us know how delectable and delicious they were. Many asked where we had gotten them...they were a hit! So, that goes to show you how wonderful these hand made sweets are!

I also want to say that working with Jean Marc was so EASY. We had some bumps in the road with some wedding vendors, but with Jean Marc, it was so easy. I called a month in advance, put down my order...and he said OKAY! Then I did not contact him for almost a month. Then the day before the pick up date, I called to let him know I was coming and he let me know that THEY WERE ALL DONE, PACKED, and READY TO GO!

So I went by, picked them up, was given some free truffles, AND a complimentary box of delectable treats too! So easy to work with! I actually need to go back soon and get some more!
author: MishEddie G.

description:
What I love most about this place? 

The coffee is SUCH a good price (I think ranging from $1.50-2.50 depending on what size) and you get a free truffle!

The BEST part is, I love ice coffee, but to have to pay so much for an ice coffee is unreasonable! It really should be cheaper because all it is, is iced coffee, milk, and sugar. The problem? Here in the U.S it makes absolute NO SENSE to put granulated sugar in iced coffee! It doesn't melt! (don't even get me started with ordering iced tea in restaurants)

But in Japan and Hawaii if you order iced drinks they always have granulated sugar AND sugar syrup for you! 

So my point? When I went to THIS lovely coffee place THEY had sugar syrup! Which made my $2.50 large sized iced coffee taste DELICIOUS! AND I get to choose a truffle!

So the best thing I love to do in SF is get a delicious Turkey Delight sandwich at Petite Deli and then RIGHT next door get a DELICIOUS Iced Coffee and truffle at XOX Truffles!
author: Michelle L.

description: Walking by the store last night on my way out of San Francisco, and ran into the owner (or someone just closing up the shop).  Told him how sad I was that I'm a self-diagnosed chocoholic and didn't have the chance to try any of their chocolates.  He came back out with a little box full of different truffles, FREE!!  Definitely the best truffles I have ever had in my life, and that's saying a lot.  I will for sure be ordering from them online in the future!! (I hope they ship cross country)
author: Sarah M.

description: Wonderful truffle shop pointed out to us by our CItiguides tour guide during a North Beach tour.  Wandered back after the tour was finished... so yummy!  Free truffle with coffee!
author: Catherine V.

description: Morsels of heaven! A perfect place if walking in the city with your Hot New Date (to forget about the Old Bad One). They have vegan, regular, and alcohol-free truffles in the copious selection, and are so petite that there is no calorific-bombe to worry about. The owner and creator with an interesting career, Jean Marc, is great to talk to and to watch him making the truffles into bundles of art. The finest chocolate in the Bay Area.
author: Jen S.

description:
My eyes rolled back in my head as my taste buds were over taken with the sweet decadance of XOX truffles.   

HONK........oh crap I'm standing in the middle of the street

XOX's cognac, caramel, and ameretto truffles are mind blowingly amazing.  These were easily the three best truffles I've had in my life.

Do yourself a favor and head over to XOX, but remember to keep your eyes open no matter how much your enjoying what's in your mouth.  And stay out of the road, san francisco drivers are nuts!

But if I had to choose a moment to die this may have been it!
author: Ben J.

description: Free truffle with a purchase of a $1.50 small coffee... NICE! The truffle alone would have been $0.75. They're small but they're packed with chocolately, melt-in-your-mouth, sugar coma-inducing goodness. My favorites include black & white and hazelnut. On a nice day, you can sit outside the store and people watch. Or you can come here while waiting for a sandwich from Petite Deli. Their mocha lattes are also really good. Made with real chocolate.
author: Tina T.

description:
A must stop for any trip here. Dark Chocolate and at 75¢ ea., worth every penny!

dang, and Im not even a chocolate fan!
author: Mike F.

description: Picked up some coconut truffles for my mom as a gift - super affordable! And they gave me a sample with my purchase. So I bought myself 15 assorted soy truffles. The best is by far the orange liquor one. Oh my gosh so good. Worth the money!
author: Allyson D.

description: Amazing truffles!! Hand made to perfection. Good flavor selection, and each truffle tastes different but is not overpowering. And good prices! 20 pieces for $12 = a perfect little gift for someone. Will definitely be back again!
author: Rachel S.

description:
ZOMGGG SOOOO GOOOOODDDDDDDD

I am SO lucky I found this place by accident.  My gf and I wanted to try a bakery out in north beach on V-day but we arrived too late and the bakery had already closed!  We walked around the area for a while looking for something eat or do and came across this small coffee shop with a chalkboard that claims it sells the best truffles EVER.  

There was no one in line.  Is business always this slow? Shouldn't there be more ppl if these truffles are truly the best ever?  We were too tired of walking around so we just decided to come in and spend a few bucks.

With the purchase of a small coffee, you get a FREE truffle!  Coffee was good, but the truffle was EVEN BETTER (103 times better to be exact!).  The have sooo many exotic flavors.  Check their webpage for the flavors.  We ordered the Creme de Menthe and the Amaretto.  When we ate em, let's just say, ORGASM IN MY MOUTH!  So rich and divine.  I had no desire to eat anything else that day.  I wanted that amaretto truffle goodness to last in my mouth forever.

As soon as we finished our lil coffee and truffle, we turned around and BAM, the line for this place was out the door with 25 ppl waiting impatiently for their quick fix of truffle ecstasy.  I still can't believe how lucky we were in discovering this place AND beating the crowd of ppl.  The gods must be on our side!  Must come and try it out!
author: Michael P.

description: These truffles are amazing. They are so good that I developed a protocol to enjoy them: you sit outside, put one in your mouth, close your eyes, let it sit in your mouth for 7.35 seconds, bite on it once, stop, suck in the flavor, repeat till orgasm. Raspberry is my favorite
author: Ifred M.

description:
Deeeee-lish!

So, I'm a vegan. Yes - a vegan. You might be asking yourself, How does a vegan eat chocolate truffles? Aren't they made creamy by adding liquid squeezed from cow udders to fermented cacao beans? Well, if you go to XOX, you can! They'll treat you nice with not one, not two -- but THREE different vegan truffle flavors: noisette (aka: hazelnut), à l'orange, and dark chocolate... And they're so smooth, so creamy, so luscious you wouldn't believe they're made with soy and not cow juice... Plus, they actually look like real truffles (you know, the fungi that gives these chocolate treats their name)! Not those round little boob-like ones that pop out of machines...

So, go there and get the 20 piece box for $10... It's a nice price for some amazing chocolates...
Or go crazy like I would have done if I wanted to OD and get the 80 piece box for $40. =)
author: Miss C.

description:
This place is great!  Living around the corner from them has been a great test of my will power.  Occasionally I allow myself the pleasure of one or two at the weekend.

They make great gifts, and they box them in those little "Chinese food" cardboard containers.  This makes for some puzzled expressions when the recipient unwraps the gift and thinks you got them kung-pow for Xmas.
author: David H.

description:
These chocolate truffles are absolutely heavenly!  Everytime I visit San Francisco (twice a year), it's a must go to place.  I seriously cannot get enough of them.   

My favorites: 
- Champagne
- Earl Grey
- Caramel (these melt quickly so eat these first) 
- Dark Chocolate
- Noisette

I recently tried a cayenne spicy tequila which was so good. The spice did not stick to my tongue but held its heat at the back of my throat.  

The truffles are light and buttery and once you pop one in, you just want to keep on popping.  They are so smooth and delicious.  Yesterday, I was guilty of eating a Godiva dark chocolate truffle and regretted it.  I wish there was an XOX Truffles down in Orange County because I would only eat these truffles and no other chocolates.
author: Christine C.

description:
I would probably trade a kidney for their truffle recipe.

Insanely, inappropriately delicious.
author: Nicole R.

description:
I didn't even know about this place when I stopped here!

I was walking by, and really wanted some coffee and chocolate. I was headed to Ghiradelli square, because I didn't know of anything else around.

I had a Dark Chocolate Truffle, and a cup of coffee. It was delicious, and I would go back ANY DAY!
author: Jason C.

description: The window and counter space is covered with awards and newspaper articles that feature XOX truffles as among the best in the nation. Yes, they're great, but I really like this place cause it's a locally owned and very friendly cafe. I always come for the "free truffle with any coffee purchase" special (although the coffee is often just lukewarm by the time it's served).
author: Johnny W.

description: The chocolates here are really good but the best deal is that you can get anything and you get a free truffle.  So you get a $1.50 small coffee and you get a free truffle.  A great stop on a lazy Saturday!  Also, their truffles make a great gift.  I brought some to my boyfriend's parents and they were reasonably priced and came in a really cute box.
author: Rachael M.

description:
DEEELISH!

I've walked past here plenty of times while en route to the park with the pup in tow, and because of that always said to myself that I needed to come see what the truffles hubbub was all about.

So finally, I did! And hol-y cow. Amazing. Coconut, hazlenut, peanut butter all fantastic (yeah I can put away the chocolate ok?) But my personal favoreite has got the be the tequila cayenne. How do they even do that? 

I think I'm in love.
author: Britney K.

description: Wow this place. Awesome flavors. I really liked their lavender and lemon truffle. The spicy tequila is a little intense but overall I was pleased with the quality of their product. The steamed milk on the cappuccino I had was also really tasty. I can't wait to try more. So happy I came across this little shop.
author: Liz P.

description:
Hands down THE best truffles I have ever tasted.  

When my brother was working in San Francisco 10 years ago, he would bring back a box of truffles from XOX Truffles once in a while, and it would be the highlight of my week.  For the past decade, every truffle I have had has been compared to these little odd-shaped truffles from XOX, and none have ever measured up.

Last week when I ventured into North Beach for the first time since I moved to Berkeley four years ago, I found XOX and it made my week again!  The service is extremely friendly.  I also got to see them making the truffles behind the counter by hand, which was really cool and made me feel connected to the chocolate as opposed to huge companies like Godiva and Ghirardelli.  I got two boxes of 20 truffles with 10 dark chocolate and 10 hazelnut each (one was to give away to a friend, which now I wish I didn't!).  They were just as decadent as I remember, and I will now frequent this place whenever I swing by San Francisco to treat myself to these amazing truffles.
author: Carrie C.

description: The truffles are ridiculously tasty, and the coffee is nothing to sneeze at either. I highly recommend trying some of their more off-the-wall truffle flavors like Tequila. They have a couple outdoor seats where you can sit and enjoy, and the park right nearby is a nice place to eat, too.
author: David B.

description:
*DROOOOL*

Best truffles anywhere!  Well, anywhere that I've been.

No other explaining necessary.  Jut go try it and guaranteed you'll return.
author: Byoung Kyu S.

description:
A little piece of heaven in North Beach and I'm so thankful!  This is probably one of the most hidden gem in the neighborhood because the front is so deceiving.  Nothing fancy and small in the middle of a block near the outskirt that appear to be a local coffee place then you enter and see all those funny looking chocolate in the glass display case.  As other Yelpers have said, you get a free sample with the purchase of coffee or whatever drink you order.

On our way to meet up with friends, I decided to pick some up as a treat.  When I started ordering, the lady behind the counter asked how many I wanted to get?  She explained it's $0.50 each or $7.50 for 20 so you save $2.50 or get 5 truffles for free!  Well, that's a no brainer - get me a box of 20!  That was the easy part, the hardest part was picking out the flavors.  I picked 2 each of caramel, lemon, coconut, dark chocolate, raspberry, french roast, hazelnut, orange, peanut butter and rum raisin.  

Let me tell you these truffles were a HIT with my friends.  Every truffle melts in your mouth like butter, so creamy and silky but it's not overly sweet.  

Go ahead, let your taste buds have a party and spoil yourself with some sinfully good truffles.
author: Gloria H.

description:
I don't have a sweet tooth normally, but WOW! This place has the most delicious chocolate truffles - just right amount of sweetness, smooth, amazing flavors.   We each ordered a coffee and was given samples.  We then ordered a box of 20, then given more samples.  The shop lady was also really nice -  

I had the dark chocolate and milk chocolate and my hubby had the rum raison and cognac - all were amazingly delicious.  We can't wait until we try the other flavors that we brought home (green tea, hazelnut, earl grey, plus a few more.)  

This is just the type of place I love - hole in the wall, quality is excellent, great service, and affordable. 

If you even remotely like chocolate, you must try it!
author: Jay-Tee L.

description:
Where do you get good hot chocolate on a cold San Francisco morning? XOX Truffles of course! I don't know why but I've been on a hot chocolate craze. I came and ordered a small hot chocolate $3 and a small coffee $1.50 for my mom. Since I ordered two drink I got two complimentary truffles. Dark chocolate and caramel are my two favorites! 

$3 for a small hot chocolate might seem like a lot but it wasn't at all. Let me tell you why. The owner actually puts a good amount of his chocolate mixture in the cup. It was a little too sweet for me towards a little more than half the cup so I saved the rest until I got to it boyfriend's house. Took a cup of milk from his fridge and steamed it. Then I poured the steamed milk to fill up my half cup of hot chocolate that I didn't finish. Stirred everything together and gave it to my boyfriend. So technically I paid $3 for 2 cups of hot cocoa. Haha
author: Tracy A.

description:
Was there today for a cup of coffee and a free truffle!!  Coffee is not the best but decent.  The truffles are the best!!  I'm trying to cut down on sweets so instead of buying a box of 20 like I usually do, I ration myself to one.  Lots of choices for the truffles and I liked them all!  Had the hazelnut today.  Service today was great!!!  

Great place to grab a coffee and the satisfy my truffle fix and then a nice walk around North Beach!!!

They have a second location in Oakland.
author: Ray Y.

description: Deliciously decadent truffles that melt right in your mouth. They have so many creative varieties... I liked all the ones I tried. I wish I lived closer to here so that I can grab a box of truffles and a coffee! Definitely need to visit San Francisco soon!!
author: Clu N.

description:
CHOCOLATE BLISS.

Never has a confection rendered me speechless...... until now. I can't describe how impressive these chocolate truffles are - you absolutely must experience them for yourself.  At first impression, this unassuming little shop in North Beach doesn't seem like the place where world class treats are made. And their wide selection of hand-made truffles  aren't as glamorous or impressive as Godiva's overpriced candies. But never judge a chocolate by it's shell - these truffles are worth their weight in gold! At such great prices there is NO excuse not to run over to north beach for a sweet treat (Order a coffee and get a truffle free!). Thank you XOX for your chocolate creations - truly a taste of the divine.
author: Caroline J.

description:
Free homemade, handcrafted chocolate truffles with a coffee delivered by an impeccable french man and kind lady in a cute, little warm store. 

what more do you need?
author: Daniella B.

description:
Stumbled upon a cute little cafe while walking my way along Columbus Av--little did I realized that it's XOX truffles store. I figured I needed a shot of caffeine for the walk, so I dropped in to order a single cappuccino. 

The interior is simple: a very cute and homey little store with a giant fridge containing a variety of different flavored truffles. Very simple, nothing fancy, but very tempting. The Italian guy who works there, perhaps the owner too, was making truffles and he said I can pick a sample piece with my cappuccino. I got the cognac truffle. It's not a big sized truffle, which means I can try more flavors without getting full of it too fast.

Let me tell you. It's the best Italian chocolate truffle I've eaten as far as quality is concern. MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH. The cognac flavor is distinct and you'll be satisfied walking out the store.
author: Rika P.

description:
Forgive me father for I have sinned.  

You see, it all started with a simple wish to fit back into those really cute jeans I bought back in September.  You remember them...okay, maybe not --- but they are adorable and they make me look and feel great.  And once I started thinking about those jeans --- well, I started to feel bad about all those other great clothes sitting in my closet getting no use whatsoever right now.  And I felt so sad.  And a teeny tiny bit of self-pity.

Okay, maybe more than a teeny tiny bit --- but that little pity party got me started.  Why am I letting all those clothes get away with taking up that much room in my closet, sucking up resources and not even contributing to the rent.  What do they think they are?   I mean, what have they done for me lately?  Right?  

So I decided for the first time in my life to have a new year's resolution.  I have restarted my exercise program and my healthy eating habits that seem to have deserted me back in, oh, May 06.  I have banned heavy foods, fattening desserts and early morning bed-slug behavior from my life.  I am strong.  I am resolute.  I am...

I am wiping the chocolate dust from an Earl Grey truffle off the keyboard as I write this sentence.  

Maybe it was the small size, or the flavors, or --- yes?  

Okay, okay.  No excuses.  I am weak.  But I am still resolute!

So how many minutes on the elliptical will this one cost me?
author: Suzanne B.

description:
Did you know that it takes 3,500 extra calories to make up one pound of fat?   

The average female has 27 BILLION fat cells in her body?

That if you lose weight, you never lose fat cells, they just shrink?

That a morbidly obese person can have as many as 200 BILLION fat cells in their body?

These are the numbers that swirl in my head these days.  You see, I am undergoing a "lifestyle change" as my doctor lovingly puts it.  It's a fucking diet people.  And I am bitter.  

With my usual steely determination I have forged a healthier diet that is low in calories and fat.  I had emptied my cupboards and refrigerator of any and all high calorie, high sugar items.  My big treat at the end of  the day is some non-fat Fage Greek Yogurt, Berries and a thin drizzle of honey.  And I had pretty much convinced myself that this was okay.  

Until I got THE BOX.  

THE BOX was a birthday gift from a friend.  I knew it was trouble the minute I saw it.  A beautifully wrapped box with a velvet bow and the little XOX Truffle logo stamped on the bottom.  Uh-oh.  

I got THE BOX home and stuck it in the fridge.   

When I got home from work the next day, I opened THE BOX.  GODDAMN!  60 little truffles staring balefully back at me . ..

"You know you want us."  They said.

"No,  I want a low-fat Chinese chicken salad from Trader Joe's." I whined.

"Sure you do."  They said, cockily.

I closed THE BOX,  threw it back in the fridge and ran to Trader Joe's - the whole time those little chocolate jewels were swimming in my head.  

When I got home, I prepared my salad and reached into the fridge to grab a Fresca.  Wait!  What was that?  I leaned forward.  From inside THE BOX I could hear this muffled greeting. . .

"Hi Lainie.  You know you want some."  

I backed away from the fridge and slammed the door.  

I ate my salad.   We all know where this is going . . .one truffle is not going to kill me, I thought.  They are very small.  

I placed one truffle on a plate to come to room temperature. . because if I was going to indulge I wanted to make sure it was perfect.   Like a Jesus face imprint on a piece of toast, I could have sworn that truffle was smiling at me.   It looked awfully lonely on that plate.  All alone.  Small.  Tiny, actually.  I added one more truffle to the plate. . you know to compare and contrast flavors.  I am, after all, a pastry chef and these things are important for my job.  I have a very strong work ethic.

I waited an hour and then bit into my first truffle.  I was surprised to find it filled with a buttery caramel ganache.  Quite delicious.  A little on the sweet side but still tasty.  The other one I sampled was very boozy.  Lots of orange liqueur.   Two more on a plate - for professional purposes I needed to figure out how they got the intensity from all that booze without compromising texture.   

Did you know it takes less than 20 minutes for an XOX truffle to come to perfect room temperature?  And if you do this, two at a time, it will take only 5 hours to eat thirty of those evil little treats?  

Yeah, all 5 gazillion fat cells were screaming out for those evil dark orbs of deliciousness.  I didn't have a chance.

I took the rest of THE BOX to work the next day.  I had them in my purse and all morning I could have sworn I heard them whispering. . .

"Good morning, Lainie. .  .Laaaaaiiiinnnniiiieeeee.. . .you know you want some."

Evil.
author: Lainie L.

description:
I was given a box of vegan chocolate truffles from here for my birthday* and fuck me, they were amazing.  And I'm not even really a chocolate person.  Now, mashed potatoes...that's another thing.  I'd kill a man for some mashed potatoes.  I would literally kill a man.  I'd probably kill Colonel Sanders.  I'd raise that motherfucker from the dead and then re-kill his ass.  In fact, I'd love to kill any man involved with the Kentucky Fried Chicken regime, including the man known as Star Jones because I know he was a  KFC stock holder at some point (or at least looked like one).  I would like to send them all through a slaughterhouse and watch them be torn apart, limb by limb, still alive, screaming for mercy that will never come.  Then, I will take all of the lovely chickens out and we will enjoy big vats of mashed potatoes and have a dance party.  It will RULE.

Another man I'd kill for some mashed potatoes is Tobey Maguire.  I just don't like the way that kid looks...he should donate his face to down's syndrome research.  While I'm at it, I'd kill Julia Stiles for a pack of gum. Seriously, have you SEEN Mona Lisa's Smile?  Well, I DID.  IN THE THEATER.  Ugh, I've said too much.

author: Laura B.

description:
Oh. My. God.
oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god oh my god
