author: Margie B.

description:
Both times I received a box of these, I put on 10lbs.  I'd eat them at breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Seriously, these are some addictive pieces of heaven.  Just set one in your mouth and and the chocolate will melt into a perfect blanket of sweetness that covers your taste buds.  They will make you XOX the person who gave them to you (including XOXing yourself)!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
The BEST Cafe Mocha in the United States.
There is none better.
I'm not kidding. I know coffee and I know chocolate.
This guy is a French Chocolatier.
I made the mistake of stopping here
during a trip last year. I ended up going back 2 and 3 times a day.
Excellent. A 5 STAR Cafe Mocha if ever there was one.
author: Billy G.

description:
this place is sweet ~ i like that they greet you in French and that the chocolates are lovingly hand-made. Get a cappucino and a box of twenty truffles. It's a good deal for $10. You get one more taster for buying a box and another for getting an expresso. Now you have 22 delicious chocolates.

This was my last box ~ 6 caramel, 4 earl grey, 4 coconut, 4 hazelnut, and 2 amaretto. Very yummy ~ and unike other sweets the chocolate here gives me a nice lift and not the sugar blues.

read the review that says she was given a box when they were "just friends" and now they are married. Good tactic. Heed that advice.
author: Liza B.

description:
Love!
The truffles here are fabulous.  If you are going to get a coffee anyway, why not get a truffle thrown in? 
The owner recommended the cognac -- and we went with that and were not disappointed.  I've since tried others (like white chocolate, champagne, rum raisin) and they are all good, but cognac is the one to go with if you are only getting one.
The truffles themselves are not much to look at but they hide a world of flavor!
author: Smog R.

description:
I went here yesterday, because of all the Yelpers that are drooling over these little chocolate balls.

As I way buying some for a friend's birthday, albeit late  ... and she knows who she is ... I bought some for myself.  I got a sample of the Red Wine Truffle, and I was so close to keeping the gift for myself, it was that good.  The small box of assorted truffles I bought for myself, maybe 30 pieces, is nearly gone.  I was literally drooling, and I'm not that big of a chocolate fan.  This experience might have changed all that.

You can tell these are hand made, as they are not all the same shape, as you will find at other places.  And for you vegans and people that want sugar free chocolate, you are safe here.  Now, WHY you would get a chocolate ball, if you are a vegan or on a diet and need sugar free truffles, is beyond me.

Many varieties are available, as are pre-packaged; usually only in dark variety.  

They also have coffee!  Coffee and Truffles is the new Coffee and Donuts.

SIX stars!!!  ... but minus one for the surly service, but it was the end of a bad day for the girl behind the counter.  Cash and credit cards are accepted.
author: Michael M.

description: Looove this chocolate! We are from LA and every time we are in SF we visit xox. We never miss the chance to try the most amazing chocolate in the world!
author: Tatiana P.

description:
My only regret about XOX is not hitting it more before I moved away.

Awesome selection done in house, it's so hard to choose which ones to fill the takeout container and once you get them home, it is hard to stay out of those.

What sets this place apart, though are the prices. I have never seen prices that low for quality truffles, amazing!
author: Howie F.

description:
After reading the reviews on 5 Star Truffles, I had to come to the original to try their truffles and support the original owners! The lady working there today was Italian and had a heavy accent.  I got to talk to her about Italy & Europe, which was really nice.  She was helpful and sweet.

I ended up buying 40 pieces and it's not a bad deal but I thought they would be in the beautiful ballotins.  We were in a hurry today because our meter was running out many blocks away so I stayed to browse.  I guess I should have taken the time to find out more about the ballotins because they all look so beautiful.  The chocolates come in a regular Chinese take-out container/box.

I think the chocolates were very smooth.  So far I have only tried 2 of them since I have been eating out all day.  O=) What I really liked was the Hot Chocolate.  Even though it was really hot today, I had to try the hot chocolate.  Nobody can beat Angelina's African Hot Chocolate from Paris, but the one they served was pretty delectable.  It's made from the same chocolate as the chocolate truffles.  

First she poured the chocolate mixture into the cup and then the steamed milk.  Then she used a beater to mix it all together, which I found a little intriguing... I guess... but all that matters is the drink was very flavorful and rich.  It reassured me that the chocolate must be good if the hot chocolate went down smoothly.  Of course I had to tip her too ^_^ You also get a free chocolate with your drink purchase, which is very nice.  

It's a very cute and cozy place.  I wished there was air-conditioning in the store but I know it's SF so you wouldn't think it would be so HOT these days.... booo on the weather lol  I'd probably come back on my next trip and hopefully it will be COLD outside so I can thoroughly enjoy the hot chocolate! lol
author: Kat L.

description: BEST TRUFFLES EVER!! Hazelnut and Cognac are sooooo good! The cayenne will definitely give you some heat (but is more to try for an experience over pleasure).
author: Stephanie H.

description:
You'll make an O face after tasting the truffles at XOX Oh...

Yeah, they're that good.

This morning I did what I always do when I am the first person at the office (which is almost never). I walk aimlessly up Columbus for a cup of coffee at wherever looks promising. Today I avoided my usual (Brioche Bakery) as I had already eaten breakfast and did not want to order another pastry as I knew I would.

I happened upon XOX and saw the sign that said "Free truffle with a cup of coffee" I stepped inside, ordered a nonfat capp and got my free truffle while talking to the owner, who was very french and amiable. He recommended the cognac truffle to go with my cappuccino, which I gladly accepted and bit into luxuriously while walking out the door. The inside was creamy and melt in your mouth with a strong cognac flavor. The chocolate left no bitter aftertaste and was better than any of that crap you get at Sees.

Before I even got a block away from the store, I turned around and went back for a second truffle. Just a single Earl Grey truffle. I came back sheepishly, ashamed to have been there less than a minute before and to have already come back. The owner just smiled, grabbed a napkin and some tongs, and asked what I would like in a completely non-patronizing way. As I left, he told me many people do exactly what I just did.

The truffles are delicious and super creamy, as I said. Highly recommend the cognac, though the earl grey was great too. They are not the sort of things I would give as gifts since they are ugly mis-shaped little lumps (I can make much prettier, almost equally delicious truffles by hand, though my flavors aren't nearly as creative). But they are full of love and heart, and I really appreciate that. Also, they get cool points for even having vegan truffles. I didn't think it was possible, but apparently it is...

I tried to forgive their coffee since they are a chocolate shop, but the cappuccino was so weak it would have lost in a fight to the skinniest kid in elementary school. When I have chocolate in the morning, I want my coffee to be stiff enough for my spoon to stand upright. For this infraction, I must knock them down to 4 stars.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Can I just say that I don't even like sweet food???
And yet these truffles tricked me and forced me to love them desperately...  

They are all hand-made, wax-free, and I hear the ingredients are straight from France.  This info is irrelevant, however, b/c the truffles are so great I I still dream about our next meeting...
author: Sid D.

description:
I bought a box of 20 truffles to bring back and share at work but when I got there I had nothing left to share...

These are really tasty, rich truffles that are smaller than most, which is a good thing because you can try more flavors. The cool thing is that I bought the box of twenty, then got a couple extra for free. Then I bought a double espresso (sidebar: this is one good espresso in North Beach - see my other reviews.), and I got a couple more for free. I walked out the door a man rich in caffeine and chocolate.

The Earl Greys are popular for a reason. Get a few.
author: Jesse C.

description: Worth every penny! I live about 2 blocks from this place and always pick up their treats to give as gifts. They're tiny bursts of flavor that just melt in your mouth - and very definitely made by hand and with love. I especially appreciate some of their more adventurous flavors. This place is an original - you should check it out!
author: Serena S.

description:
Oh sweet heaven. Thinking about XOX? Stop reading this review right now. Just go. Double the number of truffles you were thinking about buying. No -- make that triple. Even if you act like Dwight from The Office, you will instantly gain best friends. 

No bitter aftertaste. Intense. Smooth. Voted one of the best chocolates in the world. I've literally tried all the flavors, and you really can't go wrong. I am partial to the Earl Grey, plain Dark Chocolate, and Grand Marnier though. 

Seriously, there is no better final flourish to your meal than a single, perfect, full-bodied XOX truffle.
author: Gloria L.

description: It's so sad for all the other chocolatiers! (Only one perfect truffle store slot available).
author: dave c.

description:
For Valentine's Day, I got chocolates for my girlfriend and she loved them.  I also got some for myself.

The place is very small, but the chocolates make up for everything.  The guy who owns the store is very helpful and nice and he helped me pick out the chocolates I liked.
author: Gino B.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

This trick with a truffle is to treat it like a tootsie-pop: just hold it in your mouth and don't bite.
Eventually it will melt into a multitude of textures and flavors. The great thing about getting that extra taster with the larger boxes is that the person/people to whom you give it think that you controlled yourself and did not partake of the goodies.
author: Bob R.

description: The truffles are decent, no doubt, but the owner there is so rude and abrasive that his candy leaves a bad taste in all our mouths. The man has eye rolling and disdainful looks in his routine and it gets old real quick. We have been there several times and he never fails to snap at us for no particular reason, Sure, he's a great chef, but there is already one Gordon Ramsey, so he'w got that market covered.
author: ed A.

description:
Orgasmalicious.  Seriously, they are portable chocolate heavenly goodness that makes you forget the word "diet".  They come in these cute innocuous Chinese take-out boxes for easy access.  This can be habit-forming and expensive.

Times visited: 2
author: Amy L.

description:
Every year around mid September, I end up with this terrible feeling in the pit of my stomach. No, I'm not talking about indigestion. I'm talking about that terrible clench that twists your insides once you've realized that you really, really screwed up.

Almost every year, I forget my father's birthday. Sigh.

Perhaps, deep down I'm just trying to forget. It's not like I look forward to my own birthdays. Maybe I just don't want to deal with it. After all, my father is near impossible to shop for. If he wants something, he just goes out and buys it. There isn't much he can't afford. What the heck do buy for someone who already has it all?

Ha ha! This year I figured it out. These truffles are the perfect thing.
 
Sadly enough, my father's own dieting has saved me. He'd never order a box of truffles for himself, but I'm sure deep down he'd really like to. Here's where I come in. Since I'm buying this for him as a gift, he has an excuse to take a small break (actually a big one, the last box I sent had 80 truffles) from his diet. The truffles end up serving as a strange 2-in-1 gift: yummy chocolate and a valid excuse to depart from the usual self denial.

This place is fantastic. Not only does it provide me with incredible chocolate, but has also saved me from some pretty intense guilt.
author: Holly T.

description: Tried their free piece of handmade French-style truffle today.  I am not a chocolate person, but I am going back to get a few boxes.  It was really quite amazing.  Smaller than a regular commercial truffle, but perfect with a cup of strong expresso or to feed your chocolate urge.
author: Mindee C.

description:
Hands down best truffles in town! Mais oui! They offer a wide selection of flavors of bite-size tasty truffles. Being an avid Francophile, whenever I visit this place, I'd always try to impress Jean-Marc, the owner/chocolatier, with my broken Francais when ordering "mes truffes"!

Some of my all-time favorites are as follows:
- Caramel
- Cognac
- Creme de Menthe
- Liqueur de Noisette
- Framboise

They even have a few selection of Soy/Vegan flavors. I haven't tried the Soy/Vegan flavors myself...so not sure how they'd taste.

Another nice perk about XOX Truffles is that when I order a cup of coffee or latte, they will give me a truffle of my choice to go with my beverage. Can't beat that!

These truffles are great for my OWN consumption but they are also great as GIFTS.

Bon Appetit!
author: Jen L.

description:
Yes...I did buy those heavenly morsels for my mother for Mother's Day.

No...I was not smart enough to buy myself my own box.

Yes...they are quite the steal at only $8 for 20, given that I would gladly sell my soul for a lifetime supply.

No...I don't think she will mind if I have just one.
No...she won't notice if I take another, they are all heaped on top of one another and she doesn't know there are supposed to be 20 anyhow.  
No...my mother wouldn't want melted chocolates, which is what these might be if I wait two days to give them to her.

Yes....I do have to buy my mother another present.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
This place is probably one of the best places to get a host/hostess gift for the holidays.  The truffles come in different flavors ranging from green tea, Earl Gray, espresso, to your traditional chocolate truffles. 

The pre-packaged truffles seem small, but are jam-packed with these little guys.

They have come to my work a few times and have offered some awesome deals for the truffles.  They taste so good and melt in your mouth.  Yay for XOX.
author: Eugene F.

description: I always hear about how XOX truffles are SUCH good buys. However, the reality is that each one is pretty tiny. They taste OK (nothing special) but aren't much to look at. They're just uneven blobs of chocolate covered with cocoa powder, and pretty much look like what I've made at home. I gave them as a gift once but was pretty disappointed by their appearance and packaging.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Earl grey and champagne  =)  
they sell them by the piece instead of by weight, which doesn't really make sense because some of the pieces are big, and some are so dinky.
author: Tadaa T.

description:
I never realized how amazing traditional cocoa-dusted truffles are!
XOX is fabulous. The chocolates are also nice and teensy so you can have just a couple and not feel too indulgent. Even more impressive is that a small takeout-shaped box  of 20 truffles is only $8.00. They have amazing flavors such as "Framboise," "Rum Coco," and "Vin Rouge."

C'est Magnifique!

PS-when you get a box to go, you get a free truffle to sample :-D
author: Jill M.

description:
I want to start this page of mine with the sweetest review ever. 
Chocolate, delicious chocolate! This is the place to try the best chocolate truffle in the city.
Little expensive...but worth every penny. Enjoy!
author: Nancy S.

description: Yuuuuummy truffles!! Gave a box of chocolate to my darling and he loved it! Definitely going back again.
author: Maitai N.

description:
A+ when it comes to cafes and truffles!!!
Excellent customer service- the Chef is a genius. His truffles are heavenly. And the coffee & hot chocolate are the best in North Beach!!!

You also get a free truffle with coffee! 
Downside ( really small inside- Kinda pricey)
author: Danielle C.

description: The truffles were pretty good.  I don't think that they were best in the world truffles.  That being said, they get 4 stars because they offer a great deal.  With any coffee purchase, including their delicious iced, a truffle is offered for free!
author: Katherine D.

description:
Cognac
French Roast
Kahlua
Caramel
Noisette
Earl Grey
Green Tra
Peanut Butter
Rasberry
Rasberry Liquor
Coconut

......I cant remember the rest.....but it doesnt matter...cause I havent had one where I didnt enjoy~

heh i remember when I was working in the kitchen and I always wondered where they got these...so after a lil bit of searching found their store~ Its not suprising that they are named one of the Top 10 Chocolate Makers in the United States and as one of the 7 Greatest Chocolates in America~
author: phillip w.

description:
I love this place.
Cheap, strong coffee, and it comes with a truffle!
My favorite is the Earl Grey, I have yet to find another Earl Grey truffle, that I like anywhere else.
But you must try them all at some point!
author: Jess L.

description:
Holy crap!  My darling girlfriend gave me a little box of these recently.  They're amazing.

Now, I love places like Cocoa Bella that have every amazingly creative combination you can imagine.  I mean, who doesn't want to have some kind of orange marmalade/cayenne pepper ganache piped into a dark chocolate tuba, but these truffles are not that type.  

These ones are small, blobs of delicious delicious chocolate rolled in cocoa powder, nuts, or coconut.  They're simple and perfect that way.
author: Dave G.

description:
Awesome, amazingly tasty hand made truffles !!

These have to be the best hand-made chocolates in San Francisco, with a great selection of flavors, as well as many Liquior flavors - great for a romantic night with your significant other!

Try the assorted box of 20 - its basically like trying every flavor they have (minus the speciality ones - such as Soy, Vegan, Matcha-Green Tea etc).

This is a great deal as it only costs $8.00 !

Where else do you know were to get handmade French truffles at this price?
author: Lisa M.

description:
The only reason I'm giving XOX truffles 2 stars is because of the customer service. I walked in with a friend who was visiting from Japan (who specifically asked to go there) and the two people that were working behind the counter were SO RUDE! It was around 5:20pm, I believe they may have been getting ready to close but I checked the sign and they don't close until 6pm. 
They asked us in these words "hurry up and make it quick". WHAT?! Seriously?! We'd been in the store for maybe 30 seconds - come on! My poor friend didn't understand that they wanted her to make a decision ASAP. The man behind the counter literally threw the truffles she picked out into the little carry out basket and took her money and pushed us out. 

The truffles are delicious but I will NEVER go back there again. There is no excuse for treating a customer that way.


11/14/07 - Re-Review

I received a very nice, apologetic note from the owner of XOX Truffles for the treatment we received. It also sounds like the employees in question are no longer working there. The note was much appreciated and I may go back again if I have another out of the country friend in town.
author: Emily L.

description:
Wow.  And wow.

Tiny, cute, and cozy hole in the wall with amazing truffles.  I LOVE the amaretto truffle, but they really are all fantastic.

The french man working there is very nice, and its relaxing to sit outside at one of the tables with coffee and truffles.  I love this place.
author: Ali G.

description:
Must stop here when picking up beans at Graffeo, it's an unholy caffeinated union in cahoots to make me both tubby and wired.

The unique little trufflettes they are famous for are lovely, not too sweet and quite flavorful.  Will have to make a point not to keep getting the assorted box though, I always seem to end up with too many of something I like less then some others (I just have to remember which is which, I get confused when confronted by all of the choices).  

Try to eat them while fresh, the flavors don't seem to fare that well after several days.
author: GIR ..

description: Best truffles ever!!!!! Im a total chocoholic and this place is my rock bottom. I can easily go there 10 times a day. My favorite is the hazelnut but they are all sooo yummy its hard to choose just one. you also have to get their hot chocolate!!! ugh how I wish I was there right now....
author: Angelina A.

description: A delicious framboise truffle paired with fresh hot cup of coffee...for only a buck fifty. Life is good.
author: Debbie C.

description:
Lovely friendly service and to-die-for mochas keep us coming back. 

Somehow they manage to top even this however: you get a free truffle with every coffee drink you buy. And they really know their truffles. With flavors ranging from the tried and true amaretto or dark chocolate, to exotic earl grey, matcha green tea, and honey vodka, these are little morsels of heaven. Truly, truly! 

I love that such a great product line is made by such wonderful people. I love to support their business! 

All around, c'est parfait!
author: Monica S.

description:
An incredibly understated little coffee and truffle store nested amongst the larger buzzling cafes of Columbus Ave. The mochas was smooth with the touch of bitter from the coffee. Today, I had their hot chocolate which light, fluffy and just the right amount of sweet. 

I have tried two types of truffles both equally delectable. The lemon ginger today melted on the mouth starting with the sourness leaving away for the spicy ginger. The second type was the spicy tequila. The dark chocolate melt wonderfully combined the sharp pang of chilli with the smooth familiar comfort of tequila on a cold sat evening ;-)
author: isis n.

description: Great chocolate. Everything is good here. I love the rasberry, coconut, orange, and dark. YUM!
author: Clint T.

description:
Thank you yelpers for this recommendation. The truffles are soft, fresh and great. 20 pieces for $10 is a good deal as they're really rich and a little goes a long way. If they were any bigger, it'd be death by chocolate.

The liquer flavour is nice and strong but it's kinda impossible to distinguish between the different kinds (we got 1 of each flavour). There are more than 20 flavours!

Best affordable and yummy chocs in bay area so far.

Don't forget to have a coffee or hot choc to get a free truffle.
author: pj n.

description:
I had never seen this place open until that sunny weekend my sister visited me in the city and we decided to stop by North Beach on the way home.

We parked right in front of the little shop and chose a few truffles to try along with a thick hot chocolate that made you forget your name.  My sister is a French major and spoke perfect French to the chef which made my head spin!  You imagine a cute Asian hottie speaking perfect French!  SACRE BLEU!
author: Keika L.

description:
The owner, Jean Marc, used to be a chef in his native France. A heart attack altered his life path, and he switched to making truffles instead of cooking. These are no ordinary truffles. He experiments with flavors and loves taking suggestions. There was vodka honey, beer, rum coconut, hazelnut, caramel, etc... the list goes on and on (with a common theme of alcohol though). 

When you get a coffee you also get a free truffle. Both are the perfect indulgences to hunker down at one of the outdoor tables with, watch the passing Columbus Ave. traffic, and appreciate the good life.
author: Shoshana D.

description: I visited upon the recommendation of an acquaintance.  Boy am I glad I did.  These truffles are divine.  They are so decadent and just melt in your mouth.  I recommend the hazelnut, the peanut butter, and, for something quite interesting, the tequila cayenne truffle.  The brewed coffee leaves something to be desired, but it's really about the truffle.
author: Robert M.

description: totally yummy and I dont really eat sweets. The orange Truffle was to die.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Not for perfectly-shaped-truffle-loving sissies. These irregularly shaped little nuggets are like the rejects of the truffle world but under no circumstances should you reject them. XOX Truffles will change your idea of what a truffle should be. 

There is nothing imperfect about the flavors. There are lots of options (some with liquor) and they even have a few soy/vegan flavors. They are all delicious.

My favorites:
Caramel
Earl Grey 

XOX Truffles make a good gift, if you can manage to not eat them yourself. 

This tiny shop on Columbus is across the street from another one of my favorite North Beach shops - Conor Fennessy Antiques & Design. Wander over there after buying your truffles and have a look at the interesting objects, art and furniture.
author: Sophie Y.

description: Nothing compares to the truffles made here! A must try. You won't regret it. Don't just get a few. Get the box of 20 for $10. It sounds like a lot...until you realize it's actually not.
author: Connie W.

description:
Here's the deal-- no fuss, no pretentious attempt to make chocolates look like art and no chocolate snobbery feeling--just amazing, award-winning, melt in your mouth chocolate options.

Great Idea for a Hostess Gift/Thank You:  I pretty much stop in here on a regular basis to buy their 1/2 lb variety box (cute in a chinese to-go container) for $9 as a thoughtful way to say thank you to someone in a local, unique and yummy way.
author: Shasta N.

description:
Rich lovely decadent hand rolled truffles. LOVELY!

Reminds me of 5 Star Truffles on Divisadero, but its nicer looking on the inside with no Mitchell's ice cream. The hot chocolate was good. Service was nice, but rushed. Overall a good experience.

The dark chocolate and red wine are divine!
author: Judy L.

description: Went here once... about 10 years ago... and still have dreams about that dang Framboise truffle. Pure decadence.
author: Liz C.

description:
Great little chocolate shop.  The truffles aren't the prettiest in the world but they taste great.  They are made fresh which is great if you are buying them for immediate consumption.  However, I think they do not keep as well and really do not seem to travel that well either.  

Cost is accessible unlike some of the other truffle vendors.

It also helps to have someone who is knowledgeable about the craft working behind the counter.
author: Jerry C.

description:
Awesome truffles and you get one free with coffee or you get a coffee free with a truffle. Whatever, great chocolate and they have vegan truffles also. 

Small place with bar stool seating and some outside seating. You can grab and go and stuff your face in under 5 seconds with the truffles since they are so good.
author: Wendy B.

description:
I cannot say enough positive things about this shop. Jean-Marc's truffles are SO.AMAZING. a cup of iced coffee and an amaretto truffle is my 5 minutes of pure heaven.

Thank you for making me chocolate happy!
author: laura f.

description:
I thought I had a pretty good grasp of how a great chocolate is supposed to taste but I am pleased to announce that my world was turned upside down a few days ago by a sweet little chocolatier by the name XOX Truffles. I've tried chocolates all over the world in Paris, Bavaria, New York, and Los Angeles at names like Vosges, Maison, Payard, and Ricard and many of the chocolatiers to be fair were sinfully good. Undoubtedly the quality of Maison and Payard are amongst the best the world has to offer, but there is another. Nestled at the end of the Columbus drag in North Beach, San Francisco is a little wedge of a shop that serves the best chocolate I have ever tasted at a price that I couldn't and wouldn't believe.

XOX Truffles is a mom and pop styled operation started about 12 years ago by chef Jean Marc Gorce following a heart attack. His days as a French restaurant chef were over, but thank god we weren't robbed of Gorce's talent. Like a phoenix Gorce has soared far beyond the limits of chocolate making known to normal men and I guiltily admit I'm a little happy he is now making his delectable chocolates. In the little shop in North Beach you can meet Gorce and watch him prepare his wonderful truffles and I swear there isn't a humbler person.

For the most part XOX Truffles come in a variety of traditional liquored and non-liquored flavours. The truffles' appearance is classic, deep in colour, and looks as rich as it tastes. You can tell right away that the truffles were made that morning and it doesn't take watching Gorce make them behind the counter to believe it. My favourite of the flavours is the Tequila Chipotle truffle, but I have to admit the Earl Gray and Champagne were just as good. Even the plain old Dark Chocolate was delectable in its simplicity. Of the five or so flavours I tried my least favourite was the Green Tea which was a bit too strongly powdered for me but once the flavours mixed together it was still good.

My last favourite chocolatier has been Vosges for a long time, not so much for the quality of their chocolate but their sinful exotic chocolate concoctions with ingredients like Tallegio cheese, Balsamic Vinegar, Sweet Indian Curry, and Hungarian Paprika, and I never would have thought that a traditionally flavoured chocolate could surpass my taste for the exotic but I was very wrong. In comparison to other excellent traditional choclatiers with premium quality truffles XOX surpasses them for two reasons, freshness and price. Every other great chocolatier knows their skill and charges like they know it and then double that, but XOX is unbelievably well priced. Gorce even goes so far as to throw in complementary tasters on small orders like $20 which in the store will get you 40 truffles. Secondly the truffles are just so fresh and so tasty that I still truly believe they are the best I've had. Maybe it was being able to meet Gorce or maybe there's some other secret magic in the truffles but after just one visit I am completely sure that XOX is the best chocolate I've ever eaten.
author: Derek F.

description:
This place is cool fo sho.  Local, fresh, handmade.  This is the anti-Godiva.  

Lost a star for me because personally, I think the flavor is on the intense side.  More a milk chocolate kinda guy here.  And sometimes these little balls creep me out.  I dunno the asymmetrical ball shape just reminds me that someone's hands are rolling each one of these into a ball.  Grosses me out.  I'm not expecting anyone to relate with me on this one, just so you know.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I've been going to XOX since around the time they opened and it will always have a special place in my heart.  The owner Jean-Marc is incredibly sweet & kind, and he always makes sure that gift boxes are wrapped just so.  The chocolates themselves don't look very pretty, but what they lack in appearance they make up for in flavor.  The Earl Gray perfectly blends a familiar tea with luscious chocolate, and the black & white is simple but decadent.

If you get a chance to visit, Christmas is his busiest time and he vacations right after, so it's best to go any other time of the year.
author: Jorge M.

description:
XOX is the bomb. Yum! this is the place to be at the time of the month when you get those cravings...you know what I'm talking about. So I'm not a chocoholic but I def. want to be one when I walk in here.

Also, if you ask very nicely, they may just give you a sample or maybe I was just there on a good day, either way, check it out! you won't be sorry!
author: christina C.

description: I smelled the chocolate wafting into the street, so I went in to sample a truffe. 5 euphoric minutes later I left with 15 truffles + the 2 I'd sampled.  They are amazingly delicious and totally mood enhancing.  And, the service was great too.  In one word: "amazing".
author: Jeffrey E.

description: My, my, my Delilah! THE BEST truffles, chocolates I have ever had! Major bliss! Very pricey ($.75 for one itty bitty thing or $11.00 for 20 pieces) but must have. I love the early gray, French roast, coconut, caramel, oh what the heck all of them!
author: Lauren R.

description:
Okay, my mom's a serious cook.  She made her own truffles- she told me that's the real way to have truffles made.  Not like the way Godvia or Lindt does them.  I believed her.

When I walked in this place and looked at the case filled with truffles of different flavors, I realized that my mother was absolutely right.  I asked for peanut butter, amaretto, french roast, and red wine.  French Roast and red wine weren't as strong as the other two.  When I picked out the pieces out of the bag and popped them in my mouth, I just thought, "I'm so lucky to appreciate these homemade truffles... "

Next time, I'd just go for the amaretto and try the hazelnut as well as early grey's.

To repeat, the place shows you what real truffle should look like, balls of smooth chocolate, perhaps lightly dusted with coocoa.  Not balls heavily dipped in chocolate like Godiva or Lindt's.
author: Sara H.

description:
Voted as one of the top ten truffle places in the United States by food critics.  Delicious truffles in a large selection of flavors and fillings.   My favorites are the cognac, caramel and hazelnut.  If your budget can afford it, try them all.   At least once if not twice.

You can even get pretty boxed sets for that special someone, works especially well if you're in the dog house.  Definintely not cheap but worth the indulgence.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
This is my FAVORITE place anywhere to get chocolate. Straight-up and pure dark chocolate and/or infused with coconut, peanut butter, liqueurs-- you name it. Delicious! 

Jean-Marc and his wife are also a treat. (No pun intended.) Such a great pleasure to submerge myself in the depths of the chocolate world they have created.
author: Dianne N.

description:
LOVE this place!  their truffles are to die for - and they always have 3 vegan truffles! (hazelnut, orange, and um one other one..) 

thankyouthankyouthankyou!  

they also make a mean soy latte, if i do say so ;)
author: Kat R.

description:
Amazing decadent truffles! They were being served at an event my mom and I attended, and only propriety kept us from gobbling them all up!

A dangerous discovery!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Sunny: Oh truffles! Lovely truffles! I can't have enough of these things(my faves: black and white, hazelnut, and raspberry)! It's a tiny place on Columbus and Greenwich, with little tables and chairs outside on the sidewalk. The owner personally hand makes these truffles and you can see him making them sometimes right behind the counter. These little chocolate goodness is definitely worth 5 stars! I can't wait to try the other flavors! 

Nolan: I stop off here to pickup chocolates once every one or two weeks.  These are the best chocolates I have found in San Francisco hands down.  The shop is very simple and focuses on delicious truffles above all else.  My favorites are Black and white, orange, raspberry, french roast, hazelnut, and coconut.  They also make hot chocolate tablets you can take home.  They are easy to prepare by melting them inside a cup placed in boiling water.  After melting add milk and whipped cream to taste and enjoy.  These are a definite hit with the girlfriend!
author: SunnyandNolan E.

description:
As a preface: Chocolate is my career. I am incredibly critical of all chocolate and know what good (some would argue perfect) chocolate entails. Any chocolatier I review is being put under very serious scrutiny. Also, I will not review any chocolatier I have worked for or consulted with. Some major players will be left out, but it will also avoid any bias. 

I like XOX. I like them for what they are. They are honest truffles made by hand, sold without ridiculous couture-level chocolate packaging and markups. They are sold with coffee, which speaks of their purpose: to bring sweetness to an otherwise normal moment. 

With that in mind, the truffles perfectly fill their role. They are spartan: roughly shaped gobs of ganache with ill-tempered chocolate shells rolled in whatever coating (if necessary) will make identifying their flavor less cumbersome. 

These are truffles any of us could make (and some of us do, better) for holiday gifts. They are traditional, rational, and incredibly tasty. They are truffles for yourself, truffles to eat with their organic coffee. Truffles to reward yourself with after climbing to Coit Tower. 

But, if I give one piece of advice it is this: if you are thinking of gifting these truffles... Don't. Look up a recipe online, find a store that sells bulk Valrhona (this will be the best you can find in bulk), and make your own.
author: Train W.

description: Wandered in here with a friend and sure glad I did! The truffles are 75 cents a piece and so tasty! The regular dark chocolate, hazelnut and coconut were my favorite. The barista/chocolatier women was so helpful and informative about the company and the values behind what drives the company. I'm hoping to come back frequently but especially during the holiday season for gift giving, would be a great present for anyone.
author: Rachel S.

description:
I love the raspberry truffles. It's a nice combination of bittersweet chocolate and tangy, sweet raspberries.

I picked up two[all raspberry, ha] of the chinese takeout boxes yesterday and was not disappointed.

The place is a bit small with a few chairs nestled into the corners of the shop and chairs and tables outside for customers to sit and enjoy their truffles and coffee.
author: Angelina L.

description: Truffle with every coffee - OUTSTANDING! Best place to get coffee with friendly staff. Try the mocha! (Went every day while on vacation.)
author: Amy B.

description: Quite possibly the best truffles I've ever eaten.  I have a particular fondness for any of the raspberry flavored ones.
author: Karen W.

description: A great local business worthy of your support... we had a great time trying different truffles and combining different flavors with the coffee.  We even purchased more to take home and give to our friends.
author: Scott P.

description:
Sweet, smooth, creamy, melt-in-your-mouth truffles.

I'm salivating already...
author: Janel Y.

description: I've been here several times and I absolutely love their truffles. They are little balls covered in cocoa powder, well most of them anyway. I love the ones that have liqueur in them as well as the mint and raspberry ones. The only issue I have with them is the packaging. They literally throw them all into a take out box. Just like the ones that Chinese restaurants have with the little silver handle. There is no way to figure out what is what. Some of course you can taste but some are really hard to tell. They should have a better way of packaging their chocolates and/or make them different so I can tell what is what.
author: Diane M.

description:
I think I am in love.

I got one of each and have never had so much fun eating chocolate.  It was a beautiful day for sitting outside and having truffles...even when it's not a beautiful day, just buy a box and it will become one.
author: Debbie Y.

description:
I walk up and down and around North Beach every day (or at least I used to when I lived there) and one day this truffle shop jumped out at me. I know it had been there a good while but it's one of those small places that make you stop and say 'Has this ALWAYS been here? Yep. I"m losing it.' 

So I went in once, and that pretty much gauranteed I'd be going back until I moved out of SF. I"m not even a huge chocolate nut (I like white chocolate, the 'fake' chocolate, if you will) but these are worth every penny, calorie and fat gram they deliver. I like the one named after his wife, I forget the name but I can what it looks like and just how good it was. 

And you can't beat the coffee/truffle combo. Or the friendly smiling guy behind the counter, the close proximity it is to my apartment, or the fact that it's so very un-posh, trendy or anything high-end yet everything in the store is superb in one way or another.
author: Lynn B.

description:
It's a sin for my health! The truffles were really really good. The chocolates were very smooth and the flavors just blended nicely with each bite. It's a decadent! I  wanted to buy one of each of what they have. But, they are pricey, so I just had to pick some that I wanted to try. 

I, first tried their truffles at a friend's party who was crazy enough to buy one of each truffles this place has. Well, the truffles are good, the place is rather small, totally different from what I've pictured in my mind, and they are pricey. I also thought that they have a pretty box or package for the truffles, but no... it was only a white paper bag.
author: Daisy S.

description: You can get a Chinese to-go box of 20 truffles for $10 and you get one free truffle. Or you can order a coffee and get one free truffle. They are a little store and doesn't look like they have much but you should definitely try at least one or two before you judge away by appearances. The truffles at XOX aren't the prettiest. They look like dirt balls, but the taste gives them their 4 stars. The come in a variety of flavors. My favorite hazelnut and mango. The truffle is so smooth and creamy that they feel like they melt in your mouth.
author: Jess H.

description:
Yummy truffles at a reasonable price. I had to restrain myself from buying them in bulk. I kept justifying it (I'll give them to my co-workers! I'll give them to my girlfriends!) but then I realized I would probably just end up eating them all and not sharing. 

The man behind the counter (I think he was the owner) was super friendly. The free truffle with your cup of coffee is a good deal too. I've never heard of free chocolate with coffee but I'm definitely a fan. 

I love chocolate. Sigh.
author: Alli J.

description:
I just found out about this place a couple weeks ago, and they are absolutely delicious. They have a nice selection of flavors. none of which were overpowering or over-faint; all the ones that i tried were wonderful. On top of that, they're quite well priced compared to some of the more touristy destinations that sell truffles, such as the one at Pier 39.

I highly recommend the ones with bourbon, triple sec, and hazelnut, but they're all worth trying.
author: Bernie L.

description:
This place is the real deal. I've been coming here for 5 years now and it's simply the best you're money can buy. My all time favorite is their Early Grey flavored truffle. What a unique idea to pair with chocolate. Simply amazing and truly addicting.

These truffles make the perfect gift as well. You can pick either a beautifully decorated box to house your truffles or choose a plain Chinese take out style box for none gifts. 

Such a great experience every time I come here. I've been honored to meet the truffle maker himself Chef Jean-Marc Gorce and may I say he is quite gorgeous!
author: Ericka A.

description:
Best nebulous clumps of rich multiflavored chocolate in North Beach, which puts them in the running for best nebulous clumps of rich multiflavored chocolate in the nation.  Essential San Francisco.

Just be sure to check the business hours, as I often find that these guys are closed by the time I want some XOX truffles (usually just after finishing dinner in North Beach).  They're worth the planning ahead.
author: Mike O.

description:
Yum...  

I went here to buy my friend some vegan chocolates for her birthday.  Having a soy allergy, I was a little worried at first for my own health (last thing I need on a vacation is a trip to the ER for anaphylactic shock!).  But no need...  I was able to eat most everything there, and boy was it delicious!  My friend is lucky the chocolate made it back to Pittsburgh...  :)  Definitely make a trip if you want some delicious truffles!
author: A L.

description:
The truffles are good but I was expecting more ... I don't know, maybe a mini orgasm?  Yet another lesson in why I should never allow myself to be so built-up by hype.
I thought the store would look more like that chocolate place in SF Center but it's just a small deli case in a cramped little place.
The service was good though and they give you a free sample after your purchase.
author: JaM W.

description:
I've read through some of the reviews here. Yes, this place has fantastic truffles. In fact they are considered by truffle "experts" to be one of the top truffle shops in the US. It seems many people are blissfully ignorant of this fact. The whiners looking for other chocolate products should go elsewhere. Now that I live in Washington, DC I am dying for the days I could take a quick hop to North Beach and pickup a box of these divine truffles. Count yourselves lucky San Franciscans.

Oh how I miss you XOX Truffles!!!
author: Huy N.

description: Four different types of vegan chocolate truffles! Soy hot chocolate and mochas! Yum!! This place is wonderful.
author: Patricia R.

description: I recently won a box of xox truffles from a silent auction raffle. I was planning to give it away as a Christmas gift. Unfortunately, my midnight cravings took over me as I could no longer resist opening the bag of truffles. I'm sure I'll regret tomorrow morning, but as right now, I am so happy to have downed those six pieces of "melt in your mouth" truffles. Jesus, they are f***ing good...
author: hello k.

description: i love love LOVE their truffles... sadly I'm not in Nor Cal anymore to get them. :( but these truffles are delicious!!!! kinda pricey, but totally worth it!!!
author: Anne H.

description:
It's true what the other reviewers said, you leave these stacked up in the Chinese box too long, and it turns into the monster truffle blob from outer space. .....

my favorites from XOX are the Kahlua and French Roast truffles.  These are a treat for the mouth, if a little visually nondescript.  But who cares about looks when they're so delicious?
author: Smruti S.

description:
Salut!
J'aime bien les truffles de XOX!
Mes truffles favorits sont les "Hazelnut" et "Early Grey."

MMMM!!!
Merci
author: dj z.

description:
Why write another review of XOX Truffles?  Because they are that good.

Come here, be happy.  Do I have favorites?  Sure, but I will leave it to you to go and sample.
author: Kapeli M.

description:
A tiny hole in the wall, nothing corporate about it, that turns out truffles the way they're meant to be -- rough-hewn, rocky-looking, rich -- not all smooth and shiny.  (They're supposed to look like real truffles, the fungi, not like plastic dice or brown marbles.) Be choosy, and choose them all.

Viva XOX!
author: Nancy W.

description:
My expectation may have been a little high after reading the reviews and having just come from new york....
don't get me wrong, the matcha and the raspberry truffles were amazing.  but the hot chocolate? something was wrong because it was really bad.  the melted chocolate was great but after the first sip of melty chocolate i could smell that the milk was off (having been a barista before).  
The place was not appealing overall, not the quaint little spot to sit and enjoy some reportedly great hot chocolate that i was hoping for.  
I will come back though, and take my raspberry and matcha truffles to go.
author: Tamsen S.

description: getting coffee here is always a treat for me. it's bold and rich, just how i love my coffee!  i stopped going to starbucks when i discovered this place. it's so homey and adorable and it always smells like fresh chocolate. where else do you get a free house-made truffle when you order a drink!? trying the different flavors is so much fun. this is why i love living in north beach.
author: Melody C.

description:
Absolutely wonderful truffles.  The service is pretty curt, but that's the price you pay I guess.

Oh, and if you get a coffee, you get a free chocolate.  Now that's a wonderful deal.
author: Jessica B.

description: I work near the store and it's always a treat to walk over there, get a cup of coffee and a complimentary truffle. I love all of their alcoholic truffles and Earl Grey is my favorite non-alcoholic one. Their 20-piece with a Chinese to-go box comes in handy when I need to get a quick treat or present for friends and familiy. The owner seems to be always there bringing out fresh batches of truffles and the person behind the counter is always nice and friendly.
author: Alva L.

description:
Fantastic truffles here!  

The owners/chefs are fantastic people that are genuinely interested in their creations first, and the business end of things second.  I've bought many many pounds of truffles from here and every last one of them was amazing.  Excellent treats for weddings and parties.
author: Patrick B.

description:
This place is why im going to get diabetes and die.

Highlights: Hazelnut, Coconut, Honey Vodka (my girlfriend loves this one) and Cognac.

Their coffee is nice and strong too, and if you buy a cup you get a free truffle. Who doesn't love a free truffle?
author: Arnold S.

description: This to me is the greatest truffles ever, the coconut just melts in your mouth! Kudos to xox truffles!!!
author: Joiera C.

description:
The boyfriend brought these home the other day - hands down, the best box of chocolates I have ever had.  THE perfect gift.

XOX makes three vegan flavors - orange, hazelnut, chocolate.  AWESOME!
author: Lauren G.

description:
..exquisite nuggets of silken dark chocolate...I always get the complimentary truffle and then go for the earl grey and a l' orange flavored ones. 

There are a couple tables out front to sit & drink coffee, observe life or people watch....I've lazily sat here for hours...be sure to stroll a couple doors down and check out the Paul Thiebaud Gallery.-EFK
author: Eliza K.

description:
oh and the only reason why we stumbled upon this place was because the smell of the coffee was sooooo delis! i mean i'm not a heavy coffee drinker...but man...the smell alone was mouthwatering!

Love their coffee...love their truffles...what more do I gotta say?!?

author: Cynthia C.

description: Delicious mochas that are reasonably priced for this neighborhood. I'm not a huge fan of the truffles, but they give you a free one with every drink, so I'll take it.
author: Amy K.

description: The hot chocolate is so decadent! I love how you get 1 free truffle with a purchase of a drink. I come here all the time when I walk by Washington Square park. I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Shivani S.

description:
I'm not a huge chocolate fan. I have a few things I enjoy every so often, but rarely do I go out of my way for chocolate - or any sweets for that matter. I concentrate more on the "bitter" end of the tastes spectrum.

That said, Cubby and Shada were in town this weekend and we decided to go on a tour of the city in the drizzling rain. We went to some of the usual tourist spots - the Mission, Twin Peaks, and Alamo Square. As we made our way past China Town, and headed to North Beach I suggested we stop at XOX truffles.

This is the home of one of the "top ten chocolatiers in America" (as awarded by somebody or another who knows about such things). It's an unassuming store front West of North Beach on Columbus Avenue. If you walked past the place, you'd assume that they are a small cafe. Upon entry you find a large glass case to your left with three shelves of the most oddly shaped (and endearing) truffles you'll ever see.

The place was started by Jean-Marc Gorce. He had some background in the food industry, but decided he wanted to start something of his own. So he opened shop with is wife in 1998. You can read more about him and his success at the website.

These truffles aren't the polished truffles of Godiva or other upscale chocolatiers. These are tiny, misshapen, handmade lumps. If you judged them by appearance, you probably wouldn't buy them. But taking a bite of one changes you whole impression. These are amazingly deep in flavor, texture is smooth, creamy and dense. They really are amazingly dense. The flavor of the chocolate is there, and the overtones flavor (or undertones depending) swells up as they melt on your tongue.

I'm not sure what type of chocolate he uses, but the dusting of cocoa powder on some varieties is bitter, dark and dry, which perfectly compliments the richness of the interior.

They are amazingly low priced - an assortment of 40 truffles for $16 really can't be beat. Some of our favorites are the Earl Grey, the Caramel, Cognac and Hazelnut.

We sometimes get an assortment, and then take small nibbles of each, sharing them, while trying to guess their flavors.
author: tjay f.

description:
I first went here a few years (or 8) back when the Guardian listed this place as "Best Bang for the Buck".  Oh, those were the days when you could get 5, yes FIVE, truffles for ONE dollar.   And gas was a nickle, milk was a dime, and I walked to school 5 miles in the snow...  

But really, they used to be five for a dollar.  Then it crept up to 4, then 3, then 2 for a buck.  Now I've lost track...  But it doesnt really matter, because thes are the tastiest little chocolates ever.  I'm partial to the French Roast and the orange one.  But they're all good.  

Saw they opened up shop in Montclair too.
author: Val U.

description:
I had been wanting to try XOX Truffles - given that I really enjoy fine chocolates and having read the good press about their truffles.  Since I don't make it to SF too often (yes, even though I live in Palo Alto!)...I was going to have them shipped to my house.  

And, then - XOX Truffles came to our work campus for an afternoon to sell their truffles.  Awesome...got to try (and buy) them without having them shipped and without having to make a special trip to SF.

OK, now to the truffles...they provided free samples (hazelnut, caramel, dark chocolate, french roast,...) - I tried a few and bought the 40 truffle box!  The truffles are smooth and melt in your mouth.  All of the flavors that I've tried so far complement the chocolate very well and as a few other people mentioned - since the truffles are bite sized, self control is essential (although I also rationalized that a girl's got to sample all the flavors)!  

I highly recommend these truffles and they would make great gifts for the chocolate lovers in your life - as the boxes are quite nice.
author: Tracey K.

One day I hope some one likes me and gets me a box of xox truffles.
author: danny e.

description:

I was extra happy to learn that I get to pick 30 different flavors for the chef to pack into my cute little box! (Please see the photo I uploaded for details.) The chef also gave us very fresh samples of the raspberry truffles, which were so soft and delicious that even my energetic friend was speechless for a brief moment until she started exclaiming, "Oh, wow! That is so good!"

I hardly ever go to North Beach, but I always make sure to stop by XOX Truffles when I'm in the area. I get my XOX Truffles fix from the Whole Foods on 4th St otherwise. My family loves it when I bring home these delicate truffles for the holidays!
author: Hana I.

description: Amazing! I led my mother and cousin on a long shlep through the rolling streets of San Francisco looking for coffee in North Beach. We stumbled upon XOX Truffles just wanting a latte and hot chocolate and wound up with much more! With every beverage you get a free truffle. I got the dark chocolate truffle, peanut butter truffle, and the caramel truffle and they BLEW our minds!!!! The woman working their was so sweet and really made us smile. author: Url R.

author: Juliane N.

description:
I've been going to XOX since 1999 and I am fanatically addicted to their truffles.  I've been a chocoholic all my life, on the quest for the best chocolate ever, but this is it - once I found XOX, I stopped looking.

I was in XOX one day a few years ago when the Editor-in-Chief of Chocolatier magazine stopped by.  She was compiling their "10 Best Chocolates in America" issue, and XOX had just been selected as one of the 10.  I overheard her tell the owner that - while she wasn't able to say it in print - XOX Truffles were her FAVORITES of the top 10.  Imagine that - XOX Truffles are the favorite chocolates of the Editor-in-Chief of Chocolatier Magazine!

I live in the Marina and there are two chocolate stores on one block in my neighborhood (and, get this, a third set to open in the old Kimmel's Stationery location).  I've been to both - boooring. 

Most truffles are as much about presentation and shelf life as they are about flavor.   Whereas, XOX Truffles are fragile, lumpy, irregular...there's no stiffeners in them to make a glossy outer coat that holds up well and looks pretty, but tastes like wax.   XOX is all about the taste and the mouth feel, and - they got it just right.

With something like 22 flavors (or is it up to 25 now?) , there's something for everyone.  They have soy vegan truffles, and white chocolate truffles, and "liqueur de" truffles...cognac, triple sec, kahlua... I have so many favorites it's impossible to list them, but in particular I love the orange, liqueuer de noisette (hazelnut), citron (lemon), Earl Grey, and caramel.    Check out the flavors page on their web site for a full listing.

I usually get a hot chocolate covered in yummy whipped cream (the real stuff) and sit outside at one of the outdoor tables (there's also seating inside, but this is a TINY store so don't bring your laptop and expect to spread out - ain't going to happen.)

You get a free truffle, any flavor you like, with a coffee or other drink.

You can mail order these truffles, or buy gift boxes that are just beautiful.  I give these as gifts, and they would make great party favors at a wedding or other event.

Another fun thing about XOX is the location - there's a great mix of Boho locals, and tourists.  So if you hang out there,  you can meet an amazing array of interesting people.  I don't stop by unless I have an hour to kill because I inevitably get caught up in a conversation.

And, if business is slow (which it never is)  you might get to chat with Jean-Marc Gorce, the handsome co-owner (with his wife Casimira).  Jean-Marc is an immigrant from France, and Casimira is from the Philippines - they both have backgrounds in restaurant and food service.  Pre-XOX, Jean-Marc was chef de cuisine at Fringale Restaurant, and Casimira was a food rep for a local supplier, so they both know the local restaurant/food scene inside and out.

Most of the truffles at XOX are Jean-Marc's original creations (a few were based on requests from Casimira).  Jean-Marc is friendly and approachable, but at the same time, he has that old-school French politeness where every customer is special, and he's completely focused on you while he's serving you.  I don't know how he still does that after all these years!

All the truffles are made by Jean-Marc by hand.  It's fascinating to sit there and watch him.  I think he must make truffles in his sleep after all these years.

They have a store in Montclair, if you live in the east Bay - I've never been to that one - since North Beach is essentially in my back yard, I don't need to travel to get my choco fix :-)

And, if you feel like a sandwich, Young next door in the hole-in-the-wall sandwich shop makes the most amazing sandwiches.  I get the club, on toasted whole wheat, slices of bacon, and a side of butterfly pasta.  I don't know what magic ingredient she puts in, but her sandwiches are to die for.
author: Alexandra D.

description: I haven't actually been to the store, but I've met them at the Fort Mason Chocolate Salon. They're really nice, but their truffles are better. I plan to visit them when I'm gift-hunting.
author: Michael H.

I finally went one weekend in the fall and it was opened ---- that tiny little store makes mouth watering truffles. i bought a 20 piece box and i was eating it on my drive home and suddenly i got sick from all the chocolate!  i love the earl grey flavor, rasberry flavor, and cointreau ones too!  I met the store owner and for each cup of coffee or tea you buy, you get a free truffle.  he has another warehouse storage in the east bay.  cute little store if you want to make your girlfriends happy =)
author: Jboogie L.

description: I don't even like truffles, but the bite I put in my mouth was sheer heaven. The atmosphere could use some work, but it's not really a place you'd come to hang out in anyway. In addition to the truffles, the coffee drinks are superb. Absolute best non-fat white mocha I've ever had. Plus, the inner cheap-ass in me loves the fact that you get a free truffle with a coffee. (Yes, I know, the drink wasn't cheap, but it's the IDEA...) Just thinking about that hot yummy bevvie and sweet creamy white chocolate truffle makes me want to go back now.... stop in as you're walking around North Beach, it's not to be missed.
author: Kristen L.

description: an amazingly cute little hole in the wall.  just getting the chocolate is an experience and they are really really delicious.  I like em all but my special recommendation has to go to the hazelnut ganache! try one!
author: greg B.

description: Earl Grey truffles are very unusual. Delicious. I must say I dont understand why the owner wouldnt improve the display - get nicer  plates.. I entered this shop twice before I was ready to buy, it looks a bit filthy and messy. I know, it's San Francisco, but come on, the chef is French!
author: Daria G.

description: So many truffles pack into this small location in North Beach.  According to articles posted, they are pretty well known outside of California.  The owner is helpful and patient in helping you select your one-way ticket to the dentist even if there is a line behind you.  The selection is mind boggling.  Unbelievable flavors that will haunt your memory every time you think of truffles.  Guys this is a great place to help say- sorry, love, or thank you to that special lady in your life!
author: Jason A.

description: Not sure how much the truffles cost, as you get one free with a cup of coffee. Gratis caramel truffle proved to be an excellent afternoon indulgence especially while sipping a latte.
author: Jason B.

description: Have you ever orgasmed in your mouth?  I think I did with these truffles!  They're excellent for those days when a PMSy girl needs more than just any old store bought chocolate.  I'd go more often if they weren't so pricey!
author: Vanessa C.

description: Does anyone here speak English? Not that I'm a xenophobe or anything but when they can't understand what I'm ordering from a menu of 15 truffles we have a problem. The good truffles (caramel and dark chocolate) are pretty good but I was disappointed with the red wine and earl grey ones. If the staff could understand me, wasn't rude, and used deodorant (they don't and it overwhelms the chocolate smell) I'd definitely go back.
author: Keith R.

description: It's okay. The service was helpful and polite, though somewhat curt. I realize these may seem contradictory but I guess you have to experience it. Definitely not BAD service, but hurried maybe. I bought a small box of 20 truffles and, for the most part, they're decent but surely not something I would crave or am all that excited about eating the rest of. So far I like the amaretto best. I ordered an americano with my truffles and it was pretty poor. Not horrible, not great. I *might* go back if the opportunity were to present itself.
author: Jen S.

description: How could anyone give this place less than six stars? XOX is a place I return to at least 5 times a year. Every time I go I have to buy more for friends who live out of the area. It's truly a labor of love:)
author: David P.

description:
yay for this: buy a coffee, get a free truffle. buy a box of truffles, get a free truffle. buy a hot chocolate for your kid, get a free truffle...  and these truffles are fantastic. i was talking to the guy (real french guy for those of you who care), and he was telling us how he was featured on the food network and usa today wrote an article about them having one of the best chocolate in the world.

i usually order a white chocolate mocha from here. unlike starbucks, they add real white chocolate (like chunks)  and whisk the hell outta it into your mocha. then i indulge in a hazelnut truffle and a cigarette. (cigarettes are sold separately).
author: Renae C.

description:
with their irregular shapes & restricted dimensions, dark, rich & dusted with cocoa powder and voted as one of the ultimate chocolates in america...how can you not love their divine truffles?
their amaretto, orange, hazelnut and rapsberry flavored truffles are just some of my favorites and they are pure heaven to taste!

merci! for making the best truffles......
author: Nelle A.

description: Smooth, not too sweet, and all hand made with love. These are some damn good truffles. My faves are raspberry and peanut butter.
author: Kristine Y.

description:
Ok...every time I start my Master Cleanse my dagnabit boss walks in with these things!

These truffles are pure bliss!   And for me, a woman committed to practicing abstinence;  this is the closest I have been to S _ X in many many many many many moons!  So, you see why I had to put down my squeeze bottle of carefully concocted lemonade and scarf down one of these "big daddies"!  Yes.  I ruined my diet over one little truffle...now I need a cigarette!
author: Karla F.

description:

Traditional styles and flavors can be wonderful, if they are executed well. XOX truffles unfortunately are not well executed.

The quality of ingredients is lacking, the flavors are flat when not chemically. Some were difficult to place and a few tasted like Sharpie pens smell, not good.
