Good chocolate shouldn't be so hard to find. At least they are cheapish.
author: Catch X.

description: I love these chocolates! Hubby had some sent to me for my birthday. Great packaging, even for mail order chocolates! My only issue was they were in one bag, no indication as to which chocolate was which. But who cares I guess, when all of them are sooooo good?
author: Cheri H.

description: So simple yet so addictive! The hazelnut ones have the perfect texture, smooth and crunchy. I normally can't eat too much chocolate in one sitting so I'm glad that the truffles are bite-sized. One or two never fails to satisfy my chocolate craving.
author: Nathalie L.

description: No doubt... best chocolate in town! But honestly... I only come for a large Soy Hot Chocolate with a Peanut Butter or Rum Coco Truffle every Friday morning! C'est Magnifique!!!
author: Leroid D.

description: These truffles are soooooooooooo good.  I get them at their other shop - which is located on LaSalle Avenue in Oakland's Monclair district.  In addition to the truffles, they also serve ice cream (Mitchell's YUM), coffee and desserts.
author: .Hon H.

description: The truffles were okay ... I was expecting more, I suppose.  My sisters and I got 16 truffles.  The menthe and matcha green tea were okay. As for the black and white ... the white chocolate was good but the black was a mouthful. a burst of strong liquor.  My favorite was the definitely the hazelnut!
author: Jen P.

description:
A tiny little shop in San Francisco's North Beach area.  Right on Columbus Avenue.  Keep your eye out, because you might pass right by it and not know it.  If you are driving by, you might get lucky and find a space conveniently out front and can pick your flavors, while keeping an eye on the meter outside.  You can find their products at stores such as Neiman Marcus, too.  But it's more fun to go to the store, so you can customize your own selection.  Plus, they give you a freebie, or two, with your purchase.  They're now located in Oakland, too.

I was intrigued by how XOX Truffles began, when I saw stories about and interviews with the owners.  And how the truffles look.  And the list of flavors.  Finally, I got a chance to stop by the shop and purchase some of their heavenly chocolates.  I even chat with Jean-Marc, if he is in the shop.  He is very friendly and obviously has a passion for what he does.  The chocolates are highly rated by the experts, ya know.  You might even catch him making a fresh batch, tossing them in the chocolate powder.  The truffles are in what looks like a mini-delicatessen display case.  With big bowls of the various flavors.  I usually get a mix of the flavors, but forget which is which, until I bite into them.  Almost all of them are similar on the outside, dusted in chocolate powder.  That little tiny takeout box is a treasure trove of wonderful flavors.  They're bite sized and very manageable.  So, I don't feel too guilty if I eat the entire box...over a few days.  But, I try to share, if I have the willpower.  Best is to eat them as soon as possible.  Otherwise, once refrigerated at home, the flavors blend and can harden a bit.  They're probably meant to be eaten ASAP, since they're freshly made, with high quality ingredients.  Besides, you aren't supposed to save chocolates, but enjoy them right away!  My favorite is the Caramel.  WARNING: Do not sit at your desk with a box of XOX Truffles within reach...

Next, you need to try the hot chocolate.  It's the BEST I've ever tasted.  I believe it's a chocolate tablet, which is melted down in the cup, with warm milk.  Not too sweet and just right.  Very creamy and so comforting.  You can also buy it and make a big bowl of hot chocolate, to serve to your friends.
author: CE Y.

description: Seriously addictive: Dark Chocolate, Creme de Framboise (raspberry),  Casimira's Favourite (vanilla and white chocolate). At 75 cents a piece, they can add up, but well worth it...
author: Nicolas H.

description: The only reason I'm not giving it a full 5-stars for being the amazing chocolatier place in the world, albeit in my vicinity, is because: I always want a selection of their cool truffles, and they don't let you do that. You have to get a big box of all one type, or individual ones in your sweaty hands. So to the owners: please setup a kind of assortment box!!! The Earl Grey one is yummy.
author: Anna B.

description: I make the drive from Concord to XOX just for the truffles and hot chocolate.  The hot choclate is rich, bittersweet and absolutely lovely. (You can also purchase the solid chocolate and make the hot chocolate at home.)  As mentioned numerous times, you get a taster truffle with the purchase of coffee/beverage.  Caramel is my absolute favorite and I highly recommend it!!!  Jean Marc, the owner, is super friendly and has an excellent memory of his customers!
author: Row M.

description:
XOX Truffles are the bomb!  I serve these in my business and clients rave about them.  They always want to know where they are from.  The gift boxes are a regular treat that I send to my family out of town.  They are beautifully packed and always arrive fresh and on time.  The owners are exceptionally nice - they remember me and always reward the repeat business.  You can't go wrong here whether you are treating yourself or someone you love.
AMAZING!
author: Robert A.

description:
Let me preface this by saying that this style of truffle is easy to make yourself, in the comfort of your own kitchen.  To do this really, REALLY well is another matter.  It is upon this point , in fact, that my debate over XOX rages with a coworker of mine.  My thought is that just because I can make, for example, a killer risotto at home does not mean I can't rave about someone else's.  She disagrees, to put it mildly.

Upon that line, XOX makes some of the best French truffles in San Francisco and, reportedly, the country.  Even my significant other, who only likes milk chocolate, is addicted.  The only two people I've ever seen here are Jean-Marc (owner and chef) and a woman whom I think is his wife.  The chocolates look more like a truffle mushroom than a chocolate, but the exquisite flavor within belies the humble exterior of each creation.  My favorites are the cognac (the house specialty) and rum coco flavors, although "seasonal" selections have included tequila-and-cayenne, and an incredible ginger vodka.  Feel free to ask any questions about the chocolate -- they will be answered honestly, even if it entails bashing a particular flavor.  For example, don't buy the matcha green tea truffles, because NOBODY thinks they're good enough.  Otherwise, the chocolate itself is rich, and the liquors and flavors tend to be very prominent.

For the optimal experience with these truffles, either eat them once they've achieved room tempurature, or let them warm and melt slowly in your mouth.  Jean-Marc even suggests this, and who wouldn't take his advice?
author: Nick B.

description:
The owner is an enormous prick.  I live in the neighborhood and was on my way down to safeway on a cold morning when I realized I desparately needed a tissue all of the sudden so I stepped in this place and asked if I could grab a napkin.

The woman behind the counter told me the napkins were only for customers with a smile so I took one (thinking obviously she was being sarcastic) only to find her staring at me while I wiped my nose.  I asked "are you serious?" and that was when the owner came out.  He asked me "are you going to buy something? I can't  believe you would take a napkin without buying something you are so rude.  Where were you raised you have no manners... etc."  I asked him if he wanted me to buy something but he told me "no, get the hell out of my store".

Now I was under the impression that I lived in a friendly neighborhood and any normal human be okay with lending someone a single paper napkin but that really got thrown out the window when I walked in this place.

I finished my walk down to safeway and bought the cheapskate a huge thing of napkins which I dropped off on my way home (he wasn't too pleased with this gesture).

All in all, I have no comment on the food or drinks - just the service.  Please don't patronize someone who is really not a respectable human and does not fit in the NB neighborhood. If anything, walk in there and snag a napkin to see for yourself.
author: Kevin W.

description: The hazelnut truffles here are the best.  And they bring back good memories for me - my now husband bought a box for me when we were "just friends".  The chocolates are great, but he's the sweetest...
author: Lauren S.

description: Fantastic truffles and such a nice staff! My favs- hazelnut, black and white, and the red wine- delish! And you don't feel guilty eating one because they're mini morsels of deliciousness.
author: Noelle Q.

description: If you're in North Beach, stick your head in the door and get a perfect little dessert. They also make fantastic gifts. A little bite of heaven.
author: Niko Z.

description: This place is AWESOME.  The truffles are amazing - I like that they are smaller than the average so that you can try a few and not feel toooo guilty.  No one mentioned this, but I think it is key - they give you a free truffle with any purchase.  Buy a cup of coffee, get a truffle :).
author: Alicia A.

description: I come here every morning - they have the BEST hot chocolate - on my way to work and am always greeted by the owner making wonderful truffles (try the red wine one, the best.) Cheap and delicious, a perfect morning wake up call. Please go! Support local!
author: Sara D.

description: I got a box of those for my birthday once.  Incredibly delicious.  And the packaging is really cute too, but you will have to just go there and check it out
author: Nellie L.

description: Great truffles.  I recommend the carmel ones when they have them in stock.  Great gift for any chocolate lovers out there.  Staff is very friendly.
author: Buddy R.

description: Scrumptious! My husband loves these truffles.  The Earl Grey truffles are to die for.  I love the fact that they are small and ALL dark chocolate!
author: kacey h.

description: Love this place. I saw an article years ago, then a segment on tv. I just knew I had to try it. I was not disappointed. I love dark chocolate. I love truffles. These are very rich & flavorful. The best way to try them is a mixed little box. I recommend letting them cool just a bit, as they are kept in a deli style case & need to take the slight chill off to really enjoy. I feel like they taste the best within 1-3 days of purchase. I enjoy the champagne, l'orange, coconut best.
author: Angie C.

description: Fantastic truffles.  I love the earl grey and hazelnut flavors. This guy has been rated one of the top ten chocolatiers in the US and I believe it.  Packaging leaves something to be desired, but I forgive them since they are SOOOO good.
author: Gisela S.

description: Always a favorite of mine for great truffles! I first discovered it when  I moved to North Beach four years ago and have been going every since.  I try to refer people and let them know that it's a nice place to stop if you're ever in the neighborhood. I recently got some for my girlfriend on Valentines day and she loved it. However we opened a box and some of them had been crushed, and some had chocolate melting out from the middle. I was bummed but I still loved them.
author: Kale T.

description: Oh, truffles, why do you have to live so far away in North Beach? I rarely go to your neighborhood making it so hard to meet.  Maybe we should have a date next week at Trieste?  Don't let the distance get between us.
author: Sun K.

description: Good San Francisco truffles. The place is nothing special, but the product is great. There aren't many fresh-made products, most of the chocolates you get elsewhere are brought in from other places, neither fresh nor San Franciscan. XOX is top for truffles, and I like Goldleaf Chocolate on nearby Union St for other chocolates.
author: Jeffrey A.

description: More like XXX OH OH OH Truffles. These are divine, yet sinful. And if you get enough, they come in a cute little Chinese take-out style box. Melt in your mouth choco-licious goodness.
author: G Z.

description: The liquor Chocolate is really good, I like it very much! It's the best Chocolate shop in San Francisco.
author: yinghong x.

description: My lordy these are some damn good truffles! I haven't actually gone there yet. My office got a box of truffles from a client. Gotta love them clients.
author: Mary L.

description: I don't care what you people think, but I totally love truffles and chocolate here! After I had a mint chocolate truffle, I ended up enjoying some dark chocolate and a strawberry truffle with a white chocolate swirl on the outside. If you think See's Candy is good, you ought to try this place. This place rocks!
author: Jason C. J.

description: The truffles are yummy, the service decent and the selection amazing! They have all kinds of truffles and have vegan options also! It's a small cozy lil' shop and you'll be sure to stop by to please your sweet tooth.
author: n b.

description: What a gem!  They have such fantastic variety and the best hot chocolate!  Hullo - real chocolate mixed in! You can't go wrong with that!  My fav truffle is the caramel... so decadent and dee-lish!  There are so many to choose from, you're good with a starter of 40 pieces at $20.  I love supporting local mom and pop places like this and don't forget: you get a sample for every beverage.
author: Lily S.

description: Oh yeah. Sometimes truffles are too dark/bitter but not these. Or at least, not the caramel ones. So. Damn. Good.
author: Margie L.

description: Some of the best chocolate in the country made by one of the nicest people in the neighborhood.  Thanks Jean-Marc.
author: Michael H.

description: Simply delicious and decadent! I was told this place had the best truffles in San Francisco, so when my friends and I happened to be walking by it I ran back for a cappuccino and the free truffle that came with it! The cappuccino was one of the best I've ever had, strong and fresh. I chose a vin rouge truffle at the suggestion of one of the regulars and was very pleased with her advice! I've never had anything quite like it. The owner even gave us the suggestion to let it warm up in our hands or the sun to release the flavor the truffle. I will sure to be back next time I come out west.
author: R C.

description:
Probably my second favorite in the city....first being Tcho,

I make sure I visit XoX whenever I am in the neighborhood. For some recent photos check out: http://locomotoring.net/2009/06/19/coffee-and-chocolate-at-xox/
author: Mishti D.

description: Greatest dessert around.  Not that overpriced $3 each just because they look pretty crap.  Here, it's all handmade, rolled in cocoa powder, and unbelievably tasty.  Are they pretty to look at?  Not unless you're a chocoholic.  But when they taste that good, who cares?  And even the earl grey is good, which never fails to amaze me.
author: Don H.

description: Def cool that Jean Marc makes the truffles himself.  When we walked in, he was busy forming cute little truffles while I browsed all the flavors. If you want perfectly round machine made truffles or some slick trendy decor, this is not your place. If you want unique flavor combinations, handmade by the guy who's taking your order and money and making your coffee and who clearly is doing it for the love of chocolate, then come here.
author: Lena W.

description: Their size can only be described as "pop-able".  After I have visited, the button on my jeans can only be described as "pop-able".  These truffles are heavenly.  I love the caramel.  I also love the French owner's pronunciation of caramel.   I'm glad they are now open on Sundays too!  Who needs church when you can have truffles?!
author: Squirrel L.

description: Oh man, I LOVE chocolate, and XOX truffles are the perfect sized little chocolate bits of heaven.  These are made by a really nice French chef, I've talked to him several times and they are just small enough to plop into your mouth and savor the goodness.  There are around 15 different flavors to choose from, Espresso, Coconut, Kahlua, and Earl Grey are at the top of my list.  You get 20 truffles in a cute little take away box and you get a free truffle with every order!  These are heaven, I will drag my butt all the way to North Beach for these!
author: Monica L.

description: Best chocolates in the city, no contest.  The black and white, orange, raspberry, and french roast are all favorites of mine.
author: Nolan E.

description: There will always be a place for XOX Truffles, but in a marketplace where understanding of chocolate is becoming increasingly more sophisticated, where XOX once dominated the gourmet chocolate market, it now occupies only one niche. The market for chocolate bars seems to be growing, as is the market for an increasingly varied array of chocolate confections (caramels, pralines, nut clusters, and filled confections that are not just limited to truffles). XOX truffles are pretty good, and they have nice texture. They do one thing very well. If you're in the mood for a traditional French truffle, they will satisfy your craving. If you're looking for variety and innovation, there are a lot of other places to go.
author: Joyce G.

description: My best friend and I were wandering North Beach with a crazy chocolate craving.  So happy we stumbled into this place.  Can't even begin to describe the joy of a XOX Carmel truffle.  Peanut Butter runs a close second.  Hand crafted, perfectly sized.  Here's a perfect SF moment...walking through North Beach, coffee in hand, truffle melting in your mouth...phenomenal.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
now i don't care for the rich intense super sweet godiva/joseph schmidt type truffles...........but i do adore these creamy lighter hand-made truffles from this cute lil store in north beach.......

its been a long while, but from what i can remember...........i enjoyed the: coconut, dark chocolate, french roast, kahlua and ESPECIALLY the hazelnut.   i remembered when i first came into this store about 7 or 8 years ago, it was 3 for $1, the last i heard it was $.75 each..............
author: Cindi N.

description: Homemade truffles. Very small, very satisfying bites. The sell 20 truffles for $8. One truffle is included with each coffee purchase. Very good deal. Favorites include the black and white, Casimira's favorite (all white), cognac, red wine, Earl Grey and caramel. The hot chocolate is the best that I have ever had anywhere - it comes with a truffle, too. At Christmas, this place is a zoo as everyone in the 'hood loads up on XOX to give as gifts. Someday, there will be a chocolate trail in SF (like the Freedom Trail in Boston) and this place will be on that trail.
author: Vena V.

description: I had just woken up in the morning, and what did I reach for, despite the tons of fruit in the fridge, despite my constant inclination to diet?  That damn truffle.  Unlike the other truffles I've had (including those from the nearby chocolate festival), the truffles here are neither too saccharine sweet or dense.  Instead, they're oozingly soft and perfectly sweet.  This place has made me a believer in all things truffle.    I am in love and ready to buy more.  Plus, if you buy a coffee here, you get a free truffle.  How awesome and adorable is that?
author: Jennie T.

description: Mmmh. Truffles. Caramel is my favorite, but I'm also partial to Hazelnut, the Black and White, Raspberry and Peanut Butter. The chinese food take out box is a cute concept for carrying them to your destination. Make sure to eat them really fast during the summer months, or you'll end up with a large blob of truffles.  A necessary destination for those in need of a chocolate fix.
author: brenda b.

description: XOX Truffles is about the best thing about North Beach.  Not only is the coffee great, the truffles are free and the people that work there are out of this world.  I often go in there just to visit--not to mention the truffles--did I mention the truffles were the Best. If I ever need to take something special to a sick friend or a party or co-worker--I hit XOX Truffles and get a beautiful gift box filled with those sinful little tidbits of heaven.  Hey, they can't be beat!
author: Elisa B.

description: Hot chocolate was pretty good. Made with thick chocolate and steamed milk. A little on the sweet side, but it was nicely balanced with a dark chocolate truffle on the side. I would got out of the way to go, but worth it if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Saren S.

description: Wandered across this little gem of a truffle shop a few years back.  The truffles are little nuggets of yum.  Tiny shop full of character, tiny truffles full of flavor. They also offer a sample truffle with a cup of coffee.  The coffee is delicious and reasonably priced and you get a truffle to boot!  Splurge for a little 1/4 pound box of heaven and sample 20 of these lovely little morsels.  You can get a 1/4 or 1/2 pound box of these truffles in some really pretty little boxes and I think they would be a great host/hostess gift instead of the usual bottle of wine.
author: Colleen W.

description: Simply the best homemade truffles in the city. I am not a big chocolate fan, but when I'm around Columbus avenue I have to stop by and buy a little box, that is always good to share with someone you love.
author: Sergio D.

description: I LOVE this place!!! The owner was super friendly and the truffles he made were just amazing!!  I tried the Earl Grey, Dark Chocolate, Caramel, Green Tea and French Roast.  I can't wait to go back and get more!!! I highly recommend this cute little place in North Beach!!
author: JenJen W.

description:
Despite it's small store front and unassuming location; XOX Truffles is definitely one of the crowning jewels of San Francisco's food scene.  In a city renowned for it's dining this chocolate lovers paradise is unrivaled.  Knowing me for the chocolate fiend that I am, and well aware of my uh 'discerning palate' my brother introduced me to XOX a few years back while he was living nearby in North Beach.  

The store is open 9am-6pm Mon-Sat which while not ideal for someone that lives in the South Bay such as myself, is still workable.  Occasionally the store will be closed on one of it's normal days, or earlier than listed but it's certainly worth the risk.  The entire range of 20+ flavors are all wonderful.  Personally I am particularly fond of the caramel, dark chocolate, kahlua, french roast and hazelnut.  Though as a bit of a purist, I definitely purchase the dark chocolate in larger quantities than any other.  The exquisite handmade truffles are crafted in small organic looking shapes (rather than the manufactured looking coated spheres you find many other places) and usually dusted in cocoa powder.  Every truffle will literally melt in your mouth, releasing flavors that are simply blissful.  Chef Jean-Marc Gorce is usually present and making new batches.  If the store isn't busy he's happy to chat with customers.  His wife Casmira is often behind the counter as well and is the perfect advisor if you're having a difficult time making a flavor decision.  

Whether it's as a gift, or just for yourself, I can't do enough to encourage anyone and everyone to at least journey to this small treasure at least once and sample what is truly one of San Francisco's finest culinary treats.
author: Adam W.

description:
good truffles.  great texture.  rich and creamy.  no air.  flavors are strong enough to discern what you're eating without being told before hand.  

recommended.
author: Mike C.

description: This place has some of the most amazing truffles!  They are all made on premise by hand.  Must haves are the caramel, hazelnut and champagne.  A perfect last-minute gift idea too!
author: D. E.

description: I seriously can't tell you how much I wish the whole Truffle menu at this place were vegan.  The vegan truffles are perfect.  The owner is super nice.  I am kinda glad that I don't live in North Beach because I would spend too much time at XOX.
author: crystal r.

description: Amazing truffles from this once pastry chef.  You can buy these truffles at Neiman Marcus and other high-end shops, but going to the cafe is the best, and by far the cheapest way to get them.  I must say the packaging and appearance of the truffles themselves could be better, but once you taste them that is all forgotten.  My favorite flavors are dark, caramel and hazelnut.  They have some interesting selections such as Earl Grey and even a vegan truffle.  These truffles are highly rated, check out their web site.
author: David C.

description:
Simply the best. While we are also huge fans of Recchiuti, XOX creates perfect size bursts of chocolate with a variety of flavors. Their double chocolate is tops in pure chocolate - followed by Recchiuti Force Noir.

The 20 piece box for $10 is a bargain in good chocolate. We find it a great and well appreciated hostess gift.  I also see many tourists end up with that option when they go in, realizing they will not be able to stop with 1 or 2.
author: Tom N.

description: Legendary little truffles!  I learned of this place from a chef. This shop makes me so happy. I don't go for all the crazy flavors though-  just regular dark chocolate please. If you get a small box- it's a cute gift  too- like a chinese take out carton.
author: jen m.

description: Make this a daily hit spot. The ice coffee is outstanding! You get a free truffle with any coffee. The neighborhood is perfect. Seriously a whole in a wall. Owned by the French-makes it even better! I love this joint.
author: SLO C.

description: Phenomenal truffles!! Jean Marc is an expert.  Amazing quality and value.  5 stars all the way.
author: Archie M.

description: Very rude person working there. Went in to get some truffles. When I walked in a man had his back to me looked back at me then waited about a minute and said what do u need . Asked how they were sold he just pointed to the menu. Then found out they do not accept credit cards.. also bad smell inside.
author: Marc S.

description: I love this place. It is right in my neighborhood and to get a great truffle with coffee is fantastic. The chocolate is about as good as it gets and the prices are reasonable.
author: William F.

description: OH SO GOOD!  I understand Train's point, but for those of us with neither truffle-making skills nor time, this is a fantastic option for gifts that are actually appreciated.  For my part, I do my best to forget that this place exists so that they don't have to start rolling me down the hill to get there.  But when I remember and stop by to indulge in a chocolate peanut butter truffle... heavenly.
author: S J.

description: good chocolate, good flavors, free samples.  the french guy rocks.  the customer after us was picking up for a friend and declined the free sample.  he said he didn't like chocolate, the french guy (confused, who doesn't like the chocolate) disagreed and made him try a caramel truffle, customer liked it.
author: kiki b.

description: best place for truffles and coffee...i don't want to say anymore.  so many flavors.
author: Julia H.

description: i didnt find the truffles that tasty.  theyre ok.  nothing beats kee's chocolates in soho manhattan!!!  if youre in the area, you'll never forgive yourself if you dont stop by.  trust me, i know me chocolates.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Delicate hand-made truffles to die for.  Be careful not to get addicted to them.  They are so good.  You won't notice you are licking your fingers!
author: Su Kyeong K.

description: any occasion.. buy them for your loved one.. it's the best truffles in the city guarenteed..
author: Timothy W.

description: I got my coffee here every day on the way to work (and would therefore be late to work half the time because they don't open until 9 am). Their coffee is pretty standard but it's cheaper than most places around North Beach and comes a free truffle -- the truffles are seriously amazing. My roommate got so sick of me talking about these truffles and of me telling him repeatedly he should get coffee here in the morning when he doesn't even drink coffee and apparently doesn't love truffles the way I do. His loss. My two favorites (and trust me, I have tried them all) are hazelnut and dark chocolate. I wasn't so much a fan of the caramel one because it ends up being almost overly sweet when you eat it. I always get people the boxes of truffles for thank you gifts, etc. and they love me more for it. Okay maybe they don't love me more but they love the truffles for sure and I'm willing to pretend that means they love me more. You can get a premade mix in a box (that they keep in the fridge) or you can choose your own. The packaging isn't super nice because for the smaller sizes they just put it in a chinese takeout box and they have pretty gaudy looking boxes for bigger mixes but the truffles make it all worth it.
author: Esther K.

description: My favorite is the hazelnut, followed by caramel. This place is the best. sooo delicious. I usually take out-of-towners here, who are always very impressed. Also have awesome rad delivery packages for gifts. Can do it all online.
author: Matt T.

description: I get a hot chocolate here whenever I'm in North Beach.  It's not made from a powder or syrup but from actual melted chocolate . . . yum.  You also get a free truffle with any drink.  The chef is super friendly too.
author: Laura S.

description: First visited the Friday before last, the 3rd, and while the gods did not bless me with authentic Parisian brusqueness, as I was waited upon by an excessively polite young lady who appeared to have alighted from the steppes of Mongolia,  I was nonetheless fortunate enough to participate in the holiday jack-up-the-prices program.  The Chinese takeout containers are now $22 for 40 truffles, $44 for 80 (1 lb.).  As I was looking for a communal gift for a group gathering, I opted for the harlequin gift box, a fine looking container, no doubt about it, with festive bow to boot.  The employee said it would take a few minutes to prepare (there were no other customers at the time).  I had the honor of paying $65, not the prorated $55 one might naively expect given the increased quantity purchased, as I belatedly realized during her "preparation."  Upon the gift being opened the following evening, the preparation revealed itself: the truffles were now in a sealed celophane bag.  Had I been charged an extra $5 for this packaging in lieu of the steamed rice box, I would have felt hustled.  Lucky for me I was charged $10.  However, it must be noted that the little melt-so-luxuriously-in-your-mouth units are very, very good.
author: Ultiminio P.

description: Decadent, delicate and delicious - XOX offers a pure and true chocolate experience. These make great  gifts - elegantly  boxed and wrapped. Indulge in Perfection.
author: Susan A.

description: This place rocks! They promote slow food, home-made and hand-made.  They sell amazing chocolate truffles that melt in your mouth, but not in your hands. Small little cute truffles, no need to bite, one in a mouth. They have many flavor to choose from too.
author: Virginia T.

description: ok this place is great.  i would have the courage to buy those truffles in bulk because if i did i would be much fatter than i already am.  that being said a raspberry chocolate truffle with hot coffe from this place is definitely one of life's greatest pleasures.  i like the fact that you can watch them make 'em right there while you are purchasing.  this place is a treasure of SF and one of the added benefits of living in this great city.
author: Anthony Y.
